If you obey him, you will be on right guidance. The Messenger’s (Muhammad’s) duty is only to teach the clear (Message)."

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has promised those among you who believe and work righteous deeds, that He will surely grant them inheritance in the land, as He granted it to those before them; That He will affirm with authority their religion— The one which He has chosen for them; And that He will change (their condition), after the fear in which they lived, to one (condition) of security and peace: "They will worship (only) Me and not join anyone with Me," if any do reject Faith after (accepting) this, they are rebellious and wicked

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And establish regular prayer and give regular charity; And obey the Messenger (Muhammad); That you may receive mercy

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You do not ever think that the disbelievers are going to block (Allah’s Plan) on earth: Their home is the Fire— And it is truly an evil place (for shelter)

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Let those whom your right hands possess, (servants and servant-girls) and the (children) among you who have not come of age (to puberty) ask your permission (before they come in your presence), on three occasions: Before the morning prayer; And the time you take off your clothes for the mid-day (afternoon) heat; And after the late-night prayer: (These) are your (three) times for privacy: At times other than these, it is not wrong for you or for them to move about taking care of each other. Thus Allah makes the Signs clear to you: And Allah is All Knowing (Aleem) and All Wise (Hakeem)

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the children from you come to puberty, let them (also) ask for permission, like those older than them do (ask for permission). Thus Allah makes the Signs clear to you: And Allah is All Knowing (Aleem) and All Wise (Hakeem)

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And such older women who are over the possible chances of marriage— There is no blame on them if they put away their (outer) garments, so long as they make not a willful show of their beauty: But it is best for them to be decent. And Allah is All Hearing (Sami’), All Knowing (Aleem)

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There is no (such) restriction for the blind, nor for one born lame, nor for one struck with illness, nor (is there any restriction) for yourselves, if you eat in your own houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses your mothers, or the houses your brothers, or the houses your sisters, or your the houses father's brothers, or the houses your father's sisters, or the houses your mother's sisters, or in houses whose keys you have, or in the houses of a sincere friend of yours: There is no blame on you, whether you eat in company or alone. But when you enter houses, greet yourselves (and each other)— A greeting of blessing and purity as from Allah. Thus Allah makes the Signs clear to you: That you may understand

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Only those are believers, who believe in Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad): And when they are with him about a matter needing joint action, they do not leave until they ask for his permission; Verily, those who ask for your (Prophet's) consent are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad); So when they ask for your permission (to leave), for some matters of theirs, give the permission to those of them whom you will, and ask Allah for their forgiveness: Truly, Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do not treat the call of the Messenger within yourselves, like the call of one of you to another: Allah does know those of you who slip away under some excuse; Then let those who listen to the Prophet’s order, warn in case some trial befall them, or a painful penalty be handed down over them

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Be sure that to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth. Indeed, He (Allah) knows well what you are up to doing: And one Day they will be brought back to Him, and He will tell them the truth of what they did: And Allah, about all things, is All Knowing (Aleem)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is the Blessed (One), Who sent down the Criterion to His servant (the Prophet), so that it may be a warning and guidance to all creations—

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (is the One) to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: He has fathered no son, nor does He have a partner in His kingdom; It is He Who has created all the things, and made them in proper (proportions) sizes

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Even then, besides Him, have they taken gods that can make nothing, and are themselves made; That have no control to harm or do good for themselves; And they cannot control death, or life, or Resurrection

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the disbelievers say: "This is nothing but a lie that he (the Prophet) has made up, and others have helped him at (making) it." In reality, it is they who have put forward an injustice and a lie

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they say: "Stories of the old times, which he has made to be written: And they are dictated before him morning and afternoon."

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "(The Quran) was sent down by Him Who knows the Secret in the heavens and the earth: Surely, He is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they say: "What sort of a messenger is this, who eats food, and walks in the streets? Why has an angel not been sent down to him to give warning and guidance with him

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Or (why) has a treasure not been granted to him, or why has he (not) a garden for enjoyment?" The wicked say: "You follow no one other than a man under spell."

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: See what types of comparisons they make for you! But they have gone away from the right, and they will never be able to find a way

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is the blessed (One) Who, if it was His Will, could give you better (things) than those— Gardens under which rivers flow; And He could give you palaces (to live in)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for they reject the Hour (of Judgment): And We have made a blazing fire for those who falsify the Hour

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When it sees them from a far away place, they will hear its fury and its angry roar

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they are thrown in, bounded together, into a tight place in there, they will plead for (their) death

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This Day plead not for a single death: Plead for death (that is) repeated many times!"

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Is that better, or the eternal Garden (Paradise, that is) promised to the righteous? For them, that is a reward and a goal (of joy)

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "For them in there, there will be all that they wish for: And they will live (there) forever: A promise to be prayed for from your Lord."

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And on the Day He will collect them together and those whom they worship besides Allah, He will ask (those): "Was it you who led My servants away, or did they go away from the Path themselves?"

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those (whom they worship besides Allah) will say: "Glory to You! Not proper was it for us that we should take for protectors others besides You (Allah): But You (Allah) did give them and their fathers, the comfort and good things (in life), until they forgot the Message: For they were a people (who were) lost."

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah will say): "Now they have made you liars about what you say: So you cannot escape (penalty) or (get) help." And whoever from you does wrong; We shall make him taste a great penalty

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the messengers whom We had sent before you, (they) were all (men) who ate food, and walked through the streets: We have made some of you like a trial for others: Will you have patience? And your Lord is All Seeing (Baseer)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who do not expect (their) meeting Us said: "Why are the angels not sent down to us, or (why) do we not see our Lord?” Truly, they have a false opinion of themselves with rudeness in their great arrogance

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day (when) they see the angels— There will be no joy for the sinners that Day: The (angels) will say: "There is a limit totally banned (for you)!"

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We shall turn to those deeds they did and We shall make such deeds like floating dust thrown around

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The companions of the Garden (Paradise) will be well that Day, in their Home, and have the most beautiful and the happiest of places for rest

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Day the heaven will be torn apart by clouds, and the angels shall be sent down, descending (in order and in grandeur)—

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day, the Sovereignty of right and truth, shall be (only) for the Most Merciful (Ar-Rahman): And it will be a Day of great difficulty for the disbelievers

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Day when the wrong-doer (of every type) will bite at his hands; He will say: "Oh! If only I had taken a (Straight) path with the Messenger (of Allah)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Oh! I am (now in) misery! If only I had never taken such an (Evil) one as a friend

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He led me astray from the Message (of Allah, even) after it had come to me! And Satan is only a traitor to man!"

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Messenger (Muhammad) will say: "O my Lord! Truly, my people (took the Message lightly and) abandoned this Quran."

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this We have made for every prophet an enemy from the criminals (and sinners): But your Lord is enough to guide and to help

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who reject Faith say: "Why is Quran not sent to him all at once?" (It is sent) like this so that We may give strength to your heart with it, and We have made it known to you in slow well-ordered stages, little at a time

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And no example or parable do they bring to you that We have not made known to you the truth and the best explanation (of the questions)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who will be gathered to Hell (fallen) on their faces— They will be in evil fate, on a path most astray

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, (before this,) We sent Musa (Moses) the Scripture (Torah), and appointed his brother Haroon (Aaron) with him as minister

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We commanded: "Both of you, go to the people who have rejected Our Signs (verses):" And those (people) We destroyed with total ruin

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the people of Nuh (Noah)— When they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them like a Sign for (all) mankind: And We have prepared a (most) painful penalty for (all) wrongdoers—

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And like (the people of) ‘Ad and Samood (Thamud), and the companions of the Rass, and many a generation between them

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for each one (of the peoples) We set forth parables and examples; And each one We broke to total ruin (for their sins)

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And truly, the (disbelievers) must have passed by the town on which was rained by a shower of evil: Then did they not see it (with their own eyes)? But they fear not the Resurrection

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they see you, they treat you no other way than in joke: "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Truly, he would have almost misled us from our gods, if we were not unchanging towards them!"— Soon will they know, when they see the penalty, who it is that is most misled from the (true) path

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you see the one who takes for his god his own desire (or impulse)? Could you be a guardian of affairs for him

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do you think that most of them listen or understand? They are only like cattle— No! They are worse astray in path

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have you not turned your sight (and thoughts) towards your Lord? How He pulls the shadow (longer during the evenings and mornings)! If He willed, He could make it fixed! Then We make the sun its guide (as it lengthens)

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We draw it in towards Ourselves— A shortening by easy stages (during the night and noon)

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is He Who makes the night as a (long) cover for you, and sleep as rest, and makes the day (like) a resurrection

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is He Who sends the winds as messages of glad news (and tidings), that go before His Mercy (of the rain), and We send down pure water from the sky—

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So that We may give life with it to the land that is dead, and quench the thirst of things We have created— Cattle and men in large numbers

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We have distributed the (water) among them, in order that they may recite (Our) praises, but most men are ungrateful and denying

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if it was Our Will, We could have sent a warner to every town

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore do not obey the disbelievers, but work hard against them with the greatest strength, (with the Quran by your side)

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is He Who has released the two parts of flowing water; One (that is) drinkable and sweet, and the other (that is) salty and bitter; And He has set a barrier between them, a boundary forbidden to be crossed (by the waters)

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is He Who has made man from water: Then He has set up relationships of family and marriage: And your Lord is ever All Powerful (Khadir, over all things)

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And still, do they worship things besides Allah that can neither profit them nor harm them? And the disbeliever is a helper (of Evil), against his own Lord

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We only sent you (O Prophet), to give glad tidings and warning

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "I do not ask any reward from you for it except this: That each one who will (wish to do so), may take a (straight) Path to his Lord."

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (you, O Muhammad!) put your trust in Him Who lives but does not die; And recite His Praise, and He is All Aware (Khabir) of the faults of His servants—

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He Who created in six Days, the heavens and the earth and all in between, and rose over (Istawa) on the Throne (of Authority); (Allah,) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)! Then ask Him as the All Aware and informed (Khabir, about all things)

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when it is said to them, "You adore (Allah) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman)!" They say, "And what is (Allah), the Most Gracious? Shall we adore that which you order us?” And it increases their flight (from the truth)

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is the blessed (One) Who made groups of stars in the skies, and placed a Lamp in there and a Moon giving light

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is He Who made the night and the day to come after each other: For such as (those who) have the will to celebrate His Praise or to show their gratitude (to Allah)

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the servants of (Allah), the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman) are those who walk on the earth with humility, and when those who do not know talk to them, they (the servants, gently) say: "Peace!"

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who spend the night in the devotion to their Lord (either) prostrate and standing

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who say: "Our Lord! Take away from us the torture of Hell, verily, its torture is an eternal severely painful (and a fierce) punishment—

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Evil indeed, is it as a home, and as a place to rest in;"

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who, when they spend are not wasteful and not miserly, but hold a fair (balance) between those (limits)

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who do not call, with Allah, any other god, and do not kill the life which Allah has made sacred, except for honest cause, and do not commit adultery— And any who does this (the evil acts) shall get the penalt

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And even) the penalty on the Day of Judgment will be doubled to him, and he will live in there with dishonor.—

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Unless he repents, believes, and does rightful acts, because Allah will change the evil of such persons into good deeds, and Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whoever repents and does good has truly turned to Allah with a (true) change (towards righteousness)—

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who do not testify to lies, and if they come by useless (things), they avoid it with honor

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who, when they are warned by the Signs of their Lord, do not sink down (low) at them as if they were deaf or blind

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who pray, "Our Lord! Give to us wives and children who will be the comfort of our eyes, and give us (the grace) to lead the righteous."

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those are the ones who will be rewarded with the highest place (in Paradise), because of their patient constancy: Therein they will be met with welcome and with words of peace and respect

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Living in there— How beautiful a home and place of rest

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say (to the disbelievers): “My Lord does not care for you if you do not pray to Him: But you have in fact rejected (Him), and soon will come the inescapable (punishment)!”

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ta  Sin  Mim

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These are verses of the Book that clarifies (all the many things)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It may be that you upset your soul with sorrow, because they do not become believers

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If (it) was Our Will, We can send down a Sign from the heaven to them, to which they will bow their necks in humility

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But to them, there does not come (even) one new revelation from (Allah,) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman), but they (already) turn away from it

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, they have rejected (the Message): So they will soon know the truth about that which they made fun

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not look at the earth— How many noble things of all types We have produced in there

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, there is a Sign in this: But most of them do not believe

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, your Lord is He, (Who is) Exalted in Might (Aziz), Most Merciful (Raheem)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) when, your Lord called unto Musa (and said): "Go to the people who are wrongdoers—

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "The people of Firon (Pharaoh): Will they not fear Allah?"

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Musa): "O my Lord! I fear that they may deny me (and accuse me of falsehood)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "My chest may become strained: And my speech may not go smoothly; So send forth (with me) Haroon (Aaron)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And they have a charge of crime against me; And I fear that they may kill me."

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Allah): "Not at all! Now both of you go with Our Signs; Verily, We are with you, and (We) will listen (to you)

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So both of you, go forth to Firon (Pharaoh), and say:  ‘We are the messengers of the Lord (and Cherisher) of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "‘You send with us the Children of Israel.’"

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Firon) said (to Musa): "Did we not cherish you as a child with us, and did you not stay many years of your life amidst us

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And you did an act that which you did (killed an Egyptian) and you are a thankless (wretch)!"

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Musa (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was wrong

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So, I ran away from (all of) you, when I feared you; But (after that) my Lord has granted me judgment (and wisdom) and made me one of the messengers

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And this is the old favor with which you put me to shame— That you have made the Children of Israel, (your) slaves!"

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Firon (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the ‘Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)’?"

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Musa): "The Lord and Cherisher (Rab) of the heavens and the earth, and all between— If you want to be quite sure."

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Pharaoh) to those around: "Do you not listen (to what he says)?"

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Musa (Moses) said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers (right) from the beginning!"

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Firon): "Truly, your messenger who has been sent to you is undeniably a madman!"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Musa): "Lord of the East and the West, and all between! If you only had the sense (to understand)!"

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Firon): "If you bring forward any god other than me, I will really put you in prison!"

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Musa): "Even if I showed you something clear (enough) to make you believe?"

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Firon): "Show it then, if you tell the truth!"

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So (Musa) threw his rod, and look, it was a (huge) snake, clearly (for all to see)

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he drew out his hand, and look! It was white (and bright) to the seers

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Firon) said to the chiefs around him: "This is truly a magician of high skill."

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: His plan is to get you out of your land by his magic; Then what is it (that you) command

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "Keep him and his brother in suspense, and send out the callers to the cities to collect—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And bring to you all magicians of high skill."

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, the magicians were brought together for the event on a well known day

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the people were told: “Are you (all now) gathered

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That we may follow (the religion of) the magicians, if they win?”

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, when the magicians arrived, they said to Firon (Pharaoh): "Truly— Shall we have a (worthy) reward if we win?"

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Firon): "Yes, (and more)— Because, in that case (if you win), you will be (given positions) near (to me)."

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said Musa (Moses) to them: "You throw— Whatever you are about to throw!"

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, they threw their ropes and their rods, and said: "By the might of Firon (Pharaoh), it is we who will really win!"

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then (Musa) threw his rod, when, look! It right away swallows up all the lies that they make up

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then the magicians fell down, prostrate in praise

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "The Lord of Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)."

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said (Firon): "Will you believe in Him (Allah) before I give you permission? Surely, he (Musa) is your chief, who has taught you magic! But you will know soon! Be sure I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will cause you all to die on the cross!"

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "(That) does not matter! About us, we shall only go back to our Lord

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, our desire is that our Lord will forgive us for our mistakes, that we may become first among the believers!"

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By inspiration We revealed to Musa (Moses): "Go (away from Firon) by night with My servants; Because surely, you will be chased."

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then Firon (Pharaoh) sent news to (all) the Cities

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "These (people) are only a small group

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And they are very angry against us

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But we are a many more with enough warning."

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So We expelled them from  gardens, springs

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Treasures, and every kind of honorable position

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It was like this, that We made the Children of Israel inheritors of these things

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So they (Firon) chased them (Musa and the Israelites) at sunrise

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the two groups saw each other, the Musa's (Moses’) people said: "We are sure to be overtaken (and overrun)."

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Musa) said: "Not at all! My Lord is with me! He will soon guide me!"

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We told Musa (Moses) by revelation: "Strike the sea with your rod." And so, it (the sea) divided, and each separate part became like the huge, firm part of a mountain

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We made the other people come there

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We saved Musa (Moses) and all who were with him

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We drowned the others

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, there is a Sign in this: But most of them do not believe

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is), the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz), Most Merciful (Raheem)

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And recite to them Ibrahim (Abraham)’s story

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When he said to his father and his people "What do you worship?"

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "We worship idols, and we remain attending to them always."

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "Do they listen to you when you call unto (them

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Or do (they) cause (any) good or harm to you?"

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "No, but we found our fathers doing like this (what we do)."

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "Then do you see what you have been worshipping—

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You and your fathers before you

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, they are enemies to me; except the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Who created me, and it is He Who guides me

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And it is He Who gives me food and gives me drink

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And when I am ill, it is He Who cures me

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And it is He Who will cause me to die, and then bring me to life (again)

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And Who, I hope, will forgive me for my mistakes on the Day of Resurrection.

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O my Lord! Give me wisdom, and join me with the righteous (people)

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And give me honorable saying on the tongue of truth of the later (generations) to come

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And make me one of the inheritors of the Garden of (Eternal) Joy (the Paradise)

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And forgive my father, verily, he is among those who go astray

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And let me not be in disgrace on the Day when (men) will be raised up;"&mdash

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when neither wealth nor sons will be of (any) use

89.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except only he who brings to Allah a good heart (will be treated well)

90.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Garden will be brought near to the righteous

91.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Fire will be placed in full sight to those lost in evil

92.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it shall be said to them: "Where are the (gods that) you worshipped—

93.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Besides Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"

94.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they will be cast right into the (Fire)— They and those lost in evil

95.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the whole groups from (the race of) Satan altogether

96.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say, while they quarrel in there

97.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘By Allah, truly, we were in a clear error

98.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘When we held you (Satan) as equal to the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

99.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And none has led us astray except those who were criminals, (deeply) soaked in sin

100.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘Then, we have none to intercede (for us) now

101.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘Nor a close single friend to feel (sorry for us now)

102.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Now if we only had a chance to return, we shall truly be of those who believe!’ "

103.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe

104.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

105.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The people of Nuh (Noah) denied the messengers

106.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When their brother Nuh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear and obey (Allah, in total trust or Taq'wa)

107.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I am to you a messenger fit for all trust

109.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds

111.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "Shall we believe in you when it is the lowliest who follow you?"

112.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (Noah) said: "And what do I know about what they do

113.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Their account is only with my Lord, if you can (only) understand

114.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I am not one to drive away those who believe

115.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I am only a plain Warner (to warn you clearly)."

116.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "O Nuh (Noah)! If you do no stop, you will be stoned (to death)."

117.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my Lord! Truly my people have rejected me

118.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, You judge between me and them openly, and save me and those of the believers who are with me."

119.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We saved him and those with him, in the Ark full of (all of creatures)

120.Syed Vickar Ahamed: After that We drowned those who remained behind

121.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely in this is a Sign but most of them do not believe

122.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

124.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When their brother Hud said to them; "Will you not fear (Allah)

125.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, I am to you a messenger fit for all trust

127.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

128.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Do you build an important place on every high place to bring joy to yourselves

129.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And do you get for yourselves fine buildings with the hope of living in there (for ever)

130.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And when you play your strong hand (with force), do you act like cruel men with absolute power

132.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Yes, fear Him Who has given you freely all that you know

133.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He has freely given you cattle and sons—

135.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Truly, I fear the Penalty of a Great Day for you."

136.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "It is the same for us if you preach (warn) us or do not be among (our) warners

137.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This is nothing different from the customary actions of the ancient (people)

138.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And we are not the ones to take pains and penalties!"

139.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So they rejected him, and We destroyed them. Surely there is a Sign in this but most of them do not believe

140.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

141.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Samood (Thamud people) rejected the messengers

142.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When their brother Salih said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)

143.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I am to you a messenger fit for all trust

145.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

146.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Will you be left safe (for ever), in (the enjoyment of) all that you have here

148.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And corn-fields and date palms with their (leafy) covers almost breaking (with the weight of fruit

149.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And you dig out houses out of (rocky) mountains with high skill

151.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And do not follow the call of those who are wasteful—

152.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Who do mischief in the land, and do not correct (their ways)."

153.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "You are only one of those under a (magical) spell

154.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You are no more than a human like us: "Then bring us a Sign, if you tell the truth!"

155.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "Here is a she-camel: She has a right to (come to the) water, and you have a right to (come to the) water, on a day appointed

156.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And do not touch her with harm, or the penalty of the Great Day seize you."

157.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they killed her (by cutting the hamstrings): Then they became full of sorrow

158.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the penalty seized them, surely there is indeed a Sign in this but most of them do not believe

159.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is), the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

160.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The people of Lut (Lot) rejected the messengers

161.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When their brother Lut (Lot) said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)

162.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, I am to you a messenger fit for all trust

164.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

165.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Will you run after males, of all creation (made) in the worlds

166.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And leave those (the females) whom Allah has made for you to be your wives? No! You are a people exceeding (all moral limits)!"

167.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "O Lut (Lot)! If you do not stop, you will surely be one of those driven out!"

168.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "I am one of those who disapproves your acts (of sodomy) with severe hate and anger

169.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O my Lord! Save me and my family from such things like what they do!"

170.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We saved him and his family— All

171.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except an old woman who kept behind

172.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the rest We destroyed totally

173.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, We rained down on them a shower (of hard clay-stone): And evil was the shower on those who were warned (but did not listen)

174.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely there is a Sign in this but most of them do not believe

175.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

176.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The companions of the Wood rejected the messengers

177.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When Shu’aib said to them: "Will you not fear (Allah)

178.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I am to you a messenger fit for all trust

180.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I do not ask for any reward for it from you: My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

181.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Give proper measure (to others) and do not make loss (for others by cheating)

182.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And weigh with true and upright scales

183.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And do not defraud (hold back) things that are truly due to men, and do no evil in the land, by making mischief

184.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And fear Him Who created you and the generations before (you)."

185.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "You are only one of those under a (magical) spell

186.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You are no more than a human like us: And really, we think that you one of the liars

187.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Now make a piece of the sky to fall on us, if you are truthful!"

188.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "My Lord knows well what you do."

189.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they denied him. Then the punishment of a day of great sorrow seized them, indeed that was the penalty of a Great Day

190.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, in that, there is a Sign but most of them do not believe

191.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely your Lord is He (Who is) the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

192.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Truly, this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

193.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With this (the Quran), the Spirit [Gabriel] of truth came down (to bring it)—

194.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To your heart and (to your) mind that you (O Prophet) may warn and guid

195.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In clear (and easily understood) Arabic tongue

196.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And without doubt it is (from) the mystic Books of the earlier peoples

197.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it not a Sign to them that the learned from the Children of Israel knew it (as true)

198.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If We had revealed it to any of the non-Arabs

199.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if he read it to them, they would not have believed in it

200.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this We have made it enter the hearts (and minds) of the criminals

201.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will not believe in it until they see the painful penalty

202.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the (penalty) will come to them swiftly, when they are not aware of it

203.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they will say: Will we be given some relief

204.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then do they ask them for Our Penalty to be hurried on

205.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you see? (Even) if We let them enjoy (this life) for a few years

206.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And still at the end, there will come to them (the punishment) that they were promised

207.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It will not help them that they enjoyed (this life)

208.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We never ruined a population that did not have its warners—

209.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As a reminder (to mankind); And We never are unjust

210.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And no Satans' (or the Evil ones) have brought down this (Message)

211.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It would not befit them, and they would not be able (to produce it)

212.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As a fact, they have been removed far away from even hearing it

213.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So do not call on any other god with Allah, or you will be from those under the penalty

214.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And advise and warn your nearest relatives

215.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And lower you arms (as greetings) to the believers who follow you

216.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Even then, if they disobey you, say: I am free (of responsibility) for what you do

217.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And place your trust on the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

218.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Who sees you standing up (in prayer)

219.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (sees) your movements among those who prostrate themselves

220.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, it is He Who hears and knows all things

221.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (O my people!) Shall I inform you, on whom it is that Satans' (or the Evil ones) come down

222.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They come down on every lying, sinful person

223.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (In their ears) they fill half-true, worthless things, and most of them are liars

224.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As for the poets— Those astray (in evil) who follow them

225.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see that they (anxiously) speak about every subject (of lies and sin) in their poetry

226.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that they say what they do not do

227.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except those who believe and work rightfully, and do much in the remembering of Allah, and (act to) defend themselves only after they are wrongly attacked. And soon will the unjust attackers know what sudden changes their actions will take

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ta  Sin: These are the Signs (verses) of the Quran— A Book that makes (things) clear

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A Guide; And glad tiding (news) to the believers—

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who perform prayers regularly and give charity regularly, and also have (total) belief in the Hereafter

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made their actions pleasing in their eyes; And so they walk around lost without a focus

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These are they for whom lies a painful penalty: And their loss will be greatest in the Hereafter

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, you (O Prophet!), the Quran is granted upon you from the One, All Wise (Hakeem), All Knowing (Aleem)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his household: "Surely, I see a fire; Soon I will bring you some news from there, or I will bring you a burning piece to light our (own fire) fuel, so that you may warm yourselves."

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But when he came to the (fire), he was called: "Those in the fire and those around are blessed: And Glory to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rub-ul-'Ala'meen)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O Musa (Moses)! Surely, I am Allah, the Supreme in Might (Al-Aziz), the Wise! (Al-Hakeem)..

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And now you throw your rod!" But when he saw it moving (by itself) like it was a snake, he was set back wondering, and (he) did not look back on his steps: (Again, the voice said), "O Musa (Moses)! Do not be afraid! Truly, in My Presence, those called as messengers (they) do not have (any) fear—

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But if any have done wrong and have afterwards replaced good in place of evil, then truly, I am Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Now put your hand on your chest, and it will come out white without stain: (These are) from the nine Signs (you will take) to Firon (Pharaoh) and his people: Verily, they are unruly people exceeding all limits."

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But when Our Signs came to them that should have (really) opened their eyes, they said: "This is clearly magic!"

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they denied (rejected) those Signs with injustice and pride, even though their souls were convinced of them: So, see what was the end of those who acted wrongly

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We gave knowledge to Dawood (David) and to Sulaiman (Solomon): And they both said: "All the Praises (and thanks) be to Allah, Who has chosen us above many of His servants who believe!"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Sulaiman (Solomon) was to inherit after Dawood (David). He said: "O you people! We have been taught the language of Birds, and to us is given (a little) of all things: Truly, this is (by Allah’s) clear Grace."

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And before Sulaiman (Solomon) were gathered his armies— Of jinns' and men, and birds, and all of them marching forward in order and ranks

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Till when they came to a valley of the ants, (and) one of the ants said: "O you ants, get into your houses, lest Sulaiman (Solomon) and his armies will crush you (while marching) without knowing it."

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So he (Sulaiman) smiled, amused at her speech; And he said: "O my Lord! Command me that I may be thankful for Your mercies, which You have blessed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may act righteous that will please You: And admit me, by Your Grace, to the ranks of your righteous servants."

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he took a troop of the birds, and he said: "Why is it I see not the Hoopoe? (A bird with feathers like a crown on its head ) or is he from those absent

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I will really punish him with a harsh penalty, or (even) kill him, unless he brings to me a clear reason (for being absent)."

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (the Hoopoe) did not stay behind too far: He (approached Sulaiman and) said: "I have traveled (through lands) where you have not gone and I have come to you from Saba (Sheba) with true (and correct) news

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I found a woman (queen Bilqiz) ruling (there) over them and made things available for every want; And she has a grand (and beautiful) throne

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I found her and her people worshipping the sun besides Allah: Satan has made their actions appear pleasing to their eyes, and (he) has kept them away from the (Straight) Way— So they receive no guidance—

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "(And) so they do not prostrate themselves before Allah, Who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you hide and what you show

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Allah! There is no god but He! Lord of the Throne Supreme (Rab-ul-Arsh Al-Azeem)!"

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Sulaiman) said: "Soon shall we see if you have told the truth or you are one of the liars

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Go you with this letter from me, and give it to them: Then get back from them, and (wait to) see what answer they give back." .

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: She (the queen of Saba) said: "You chiefs! Here is a letter delivered to me— A noble letter

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "It is from Sulaiman (Solomon), and is (written): ‘In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘You do not act proudly with me, but come to me as Muslims, in submission (to the Religion of Allah).’ "

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: She (the queen) said: "You chiefs! Advise me about (this) ordeal of mine: No ordeal have I decided without your presence."

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "We are blessed with great strength, and used to fierce war: But the power is with you; So think about what you will command."

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: She said: "Verily, when kings enter a country, ruin it, and make the noblest from its people, its meanest; They act like this

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But verily, I am going to send him (Sulaiman) a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ministers."

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, when (the ministers) came to Sulaiman (Solomon), he said: "Will you give me a lot of wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given to you! Really! It is you who take joy in your gift

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Go back to them, and be sure we will come to them with strong armies that they will never be able to meet: And we shall remove them from there in disgrace, and they will feel in low position."

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said (to his own army): "You chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me surrendering as Muslims, in submission

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said an Ifrit, from the (race of) jinns': "I will bring it to you before you get up from your Court (and gathering now): Truly, I have the full strength for the deed, and (I am) trustworthy for such work (service to you)."

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said one who had knowledge of the Scripture: "I will bring it to you by the blinking of an eye!" then as (Sulaiman) saw it placed firmly before him, he said: "This is by the Grace of my Lord! To test me whether I am thankful or unthankful! And if anyone is thankful, truly, his gratitude is (only for the good) for his own soul; But if anyone is unthankful, truly, My Lord is free of all Needs (Ghani), All Bountiful (Kareem, in His generosity)!"

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "Change her throne that it is beyond recognition by her let us see whether she is guided (to Allah) or (she) is one of those who takes no guidance."

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So when she arrived, she was asked, "Is your throne like this?” She said; "(It is) as if it was just the same;" He said: "Knowledge was bestowed to us before her, and we have submitted to Allah (in Islam)."

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And she came away from the worship of others besides Allah: For she was from a people who had no faith

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: She was asked to enter the high palace: but when she saw it, she thought it was a pool (lake) of water, and (pulled up her skirts), showing her legs. He (Sulaiman) said: "This is only a palace smoothly covered with sheets of glass." She said: "O my Lord! Truly, I have wronged my soul: And I submit with Sulaiman (Solomon) to Allah and to the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)."

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Before now), We sent to the Samood (Thamud), their brother Salih, saying, "Worship (serve) Allah:" But look! They became two groups arguing with each other

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my people! Why do you hurry to evil rather than the good? If you only ask Allah for forgiveness, you can (still) hope to receive (His) mercy."

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "We foresee bad sign from you, and from those who are with you." He said: "Your bad sign is with Allah; Yes, you are a people under trial."

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the City, there were Nine men of a family, who made mischief in the land, and would not correct (themselves)

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Among themselves) they said: "Make a common oath by Allah that we shall make a secret night-attack on him (Salih) and his household, and that we shall then tell his heirs (when they want to punish us): 'We were not there at the killing of his household, and verily, we are surely telling the truth'. "

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So they plotted and planned but We too planned, even while they were not aware of it

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then see what was the end of their plan! (Only) this— That We ruined them and their people, altogether

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Now their houses were like this— In utter ruin, because they did wrong, surely in this, there is a Sign for people with knowledge

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We saved those who believed and did righteousness

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And We also sent) Lut (Lot, as a prophet): When he said to his people, "You do what is shameful (sodomy), even though you see (it is wrong and unjust)

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Would you really run after men in your excessive (sexual) desire rather than after women? No! You are a people (totally) ignorant!"

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But his people gave no other answer except this: They said, "Drive out the followers of (Lot) from your City: Truly, these are men who want to be clean and pure!"

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So We saved him and his family, except his wife: We destined her to be of those who remained behind

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We rained down on them a rain (of yellow sulfurous stones): And evil was the rain on those who were warned (but did not pay attention)

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Praise (and thanks) be to Allah, and Peace on His servants whom He has chosen. (Who) is better? Allah or the false gods they associate (with Him)

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it not He, Who has created the heavens and the earth, and Who sends down rain for you from the sky? Yes, We cause well planted gardens to grow with it full of beauty and delight: It is not in your power to cause the growth of (such) trees in them. (Is there another) god with Allah? No! They are a people who turn away from justice

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it not He, Who has made the earth strong to live on; Made rivers in its middle; Set mountains firmly upon it; And made a separating boundary between the two expanses of flowing water? (Is there another) god with Allah?" — No! Most of them do not know

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it not He, Who listens to the hurting (soul) when it calls on Him, and Who removes its hurt, and makes you (believers) inheritors of the earth? (Is there another) god besides Allah? Little is the attention you give

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it not He, Who guides you in middle of the depths of darkness on land and sea, and Who sends the winds as (the blowing) Signs of the good news, which come before His Mercy? (Is there another) god with Allah? Allah is High above what they associate with Him

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it not He, Who originates Creation, then repeats it, and Who gives you the means to live from heaven and earth? (Is there another) god with Allah?"— Say: "Bring up your reasons, if you tell the truth!"

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "No one in the heavens or on earth, except Allah, knows what is the unseen:" Nor can they foresee when they shall be raised up (for Judgment)

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Even less can their knowledge understand the Hereafter: No! They are in doubt and uncertainty about it; No! They are blind to it

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The unbelievers’ say: "What! When we become dust— We and our fathers— Will we truly be raised (from the dead)

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Indeed, we were promised this— We and our fathers before (us): These are nothing but the stories of the old."

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say to them: "Travel through the earth and see what is the end of the criminals."

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But do not feel sad for them, and do not pain yourself because of their plots

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they say: "When will this promise (be true)? (Speak) if you are truthful."

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It can be that some of the events that you want hurried can be following (close to) you!"

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But surely, your Lord is full of grace to mankind, still most of them show no gratitude

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, your Lord knows all that their hearts conceal, and all that they reveal

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And there is nothing from the unseen, in heaven or earth, which is not (written) in a clear book (a record)

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, this Quran does explain to the children of Israel most of the things about which they disagree

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it certainly is a Guide and a Mercy to those who believe

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, your Lord will decide between them by His Order: And He is Supreme in Might (Aziz), All Knowing (Aleem)

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, (believers!) put your trust in Allah: Surely, you (O Prophet!) are on (the Path of) clear (and open) Truth

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, you cannot make the dead to hear, nor can make the deaf to hear the call, especially when they go away in hiding

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nor can you lead the blind, from wandering away (from the Path): You will get only those who believe in Our Signs to hear, and those who have submitted (to Allah as Muslims)

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) when the Word is made true against them, We shall bring out from the earth a beast to (face) them: To speak to them, because mankind did not believe in Our Signs with (due) certainty

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) one Day We shall bring together from every people a group of those who reject Our Signs (verses), and they shall be kept in (their proper) order—

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Until, when they come (for Judgment, Allah), will say: "Did you reject My Signs, even though you did not understand them with (any) knowledge, or what you were doing?"

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Word will be made true against them, because of their doing wrong, and they will not be able to speak (for mercy)

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not see that We have made the night for them to rest and the day to give them light? Surely, in this are Signs for any people who believe

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) the Day that the Trumpet will be blown—and all those who are in the heavens and those who are on earth, will be struck with fear; except those as Allah will please (to forgive): And all will come to His (Presence) as the created (ones) aware of their lowliness

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You see the mountains and think that they are firmly fixed; But they (too) will blow away like the clouds blow away: (Like this is) the doing of Allah, who regulates all things with Perfect Order: Verily, He is very familiar with all that you do

89.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If any do good, (their portion of) good will (increase) for them from it; And they will be safe from the terror that Day

90.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if any do evil, their faces will be thrown straight down into the Fire: (It shall be said:) "Do you receive a reward different from what your actions have earned (for you)?"

91.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For me, I have been ordered to worship (and serve) the Lord of this City (Makkah), He Who has cleansed it (as pure and holy) and (He) to Whom belong all things: And I am ordered to be of those who bow in Islam to Allah’s Will—

92.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And to recite (and rehearse) the Quran: And if any accept guidance, they do it for the good of their own souls, and if any wander away, say: I am only a Warner

93.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And say: "All the Praise (and thanks) be to Allah, He, Who will soon show you His Signs, and you will recognize them"; And your Lord is not unaware of all that you do

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ta  Sin  Mim

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These are the Signs (verses) of the Book (Quran) that makes (things) clear

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We recite (and restate) to you with truth a part of the story of Musa (Moses) and Firon (Pharaoh), for people who believe

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, Firon (Pharaoh) had raised himself in the land and broken up its people into groups, keeping a small group (Israelites) lowly among them: Their sons, he killed but keep their females alive: Verily, he was truly a mischief-maker

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We wished to be kind to those who were kept lowly in the land, to make them leaders and to make them the inheritors

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To make a firm place for them in the land, and to show Firon (Pharaoh), Haman, and their armies, at their (Israelites) hands, exactly those things which they were careful (to avoid themselves)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We sent this inspiration to Musa's (Moses’) mother: "(Breast) feed (baby Musa), but when you have fears for him, put him into the river (in a basket), but do not fear or feel sad (for him): Verily, We shall bring him back to you, and We shall make him one of Our messengers."

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then the household of Firon (Pharaoh) lifted him up (from the river): (It was) that (baby Musa) would be an opponent and a reason of sorrow for them: Verily, Firon (Pharaoh) and Haman and their armies were men of sin

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Firon's (Pharaoh's) wife said: "(He is) a comfort (and joy) of the eye for me and for you: Kill him not! It could be that he will be of use to us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they did not foresee (what they were doing)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And there come an emptiness in the heart of the mother of Musa (Moses): She was almost going to tell his (story and her loss), if We had not strengthened her heart (with faith), so that she may remain a (true) believer

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And she said to his (Musa's) sister, "Follow him (floating on the river)," so she (the sister) watched him from a distant place, as a stranger, and they (Egyptians) did not know

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We commanded that he refused to (breast) feed at first, until (the sister) said: "Shall I point to you the people of a house who will feed and raise him for you and be truly attached to him?"

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this We brought him back to his mother, so that her eye might be comforted, and that she might not feel sad, and that she might know that the Promise of Allah is True: But most of them do not understand

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when he reached full maturity (of manhood), and was well placed (in life), We gifted him with wisdom and knowledge. Like this We reward those who do goo

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And at one time he entered the City while its people were not watching: And he found there, two men fighting— One of his own part (religion), and the other, of his enemies (Egyptians). Now the man of his own religion asked for help against his enemy, and Musa (Moses) hit him (the Egyptian) with his fist and (that) killed him.  (In regret Musa,) he said: "This is a work of Satan verily, he is an enemy who clearly misleads!"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He prayed: "O my Lord! I have wronged myself! So (I pray You) forgive me!" Then (Allah) forgave him: Verily, He is the Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my Lord! For what You have granted Your Grace on me, I will never be a help to those who are criminals!"

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So he saw the morning in the City, (still) looking around in a state of fear, when look! The man who had wanted his help, the previous day, called loudly for his help (again). Musa (Moses) said to him: "Clearly, you are truly a quarrelsome fellow!"

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when he decided to catch the man who was an enemy to both of them, that man said: "O Musa (Moses)! Is it your intention to kill me like you killed a man yesterday? Your intention is nothing except to become a harsh powerful man in the land, and not to be one who sets things right!"

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (about the same time) there came a man, running from the far end of the City. He said: "O Musa (Moses)! Verily, the Chiefs together are (now) Taking an opinion about you, to kill you: So you go away, truly, I am one of the sincere advisors to you."

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore he got away from there, looking around (still) in a state of fear. He prayed: "O my Lord! Save me from people used to doing wrong."

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And then, when he turned (went) towards Madyan, he said: "I hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and straight Path."

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when he came to the watering (place) in Madyan, there he found a group of men watering (their herds), and in addition to them, he found two (young) women who were holding back (their herds). He said: "What is the matter with you?” They said: "We cannot water until the shepherds take back (their herds); And our father is a very old man."

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, he watered (their herds) for them; Then he turned back to the shade, and said: "O my Lord! Truly, I am in need of any good that you will send me!"

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Afterwards one of the (two young women) came, walking shyly to him. She said: "Verily, my father invites you so that he may reward you for having watered (our herds) for us." So when he came to him and narrated the story, he (the father) said: "You, do not be afraid: You have run away from unjust people."

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And one of the (two women) said: "O my father! Hire him on wages: Truly, the best of men to work for you is the (man) who is strong and trustworthy."

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (the father) said: "I want to marry one of these (two) daughters of mine to you, provided you serve me for eight years; But if you complete ten years, it will be (kindness) from you. But I do not want to put you under a difficulty: You will truly find me, if Allah wills, one of the righteous."

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (Musa) said: "Let that be (the agreement) between me and you: Whichever of the two duration's I fulfill, let there be no bad feelings for me. Let Allah be a witness to what we say."

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When Musa (Moses) had fulfilled the time, and was journeying with his family, he saw a fire in the direction of Mount Thr. He said to his family: "You wait (here); I see a fire; I hope to bring some news from there for you, or (bring) a piece of burning fire, so that you may warm yourselves."

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So when he came to the (fire), a voice was heard from the right side of the valley, from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Musa (Moses)! Surely, I am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)..

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Now you throw your rod!" But when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it was a snake, he turned back going away, and did not look back (at the past): "O Musa (Moses)!" (The voice said): "Come near, and do not be afraid: Verily, you are of those (people) who are safe

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Move your hand towards your chest, and it will come out white without stain (or disease), and take your hand close to your side (to guard) against fear. These are the two Signs from your Lord to Firon (Pharaoh) and to his chiefs: Verily, they are a people unruly and rebellious."

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my Lord! I have killed one of their men, and I fear that they will kill me

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And my brother Haroon (Aaron)— He is more fluent in speech than me: So send him (also) with me as a helper, to support (and strengthen) me: Indeed, I fear that they may accuse me of lying."

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) said: "We will certainly (strengthen you,) make your arm strong through your brother, and trust you both with power (and authority), so that they will not be able to touch you: With Our Signs (verses), both of you, and those who follow you— Will be the victorious."

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then when Musa (Moses) came to them with Our Clear Signs (verses), they said: "This is nothing but magic made up (for us): We never heard (anything) like this from our fathers of the past!"

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Musa (Moses) said: "My Lord knows well who comes with guidance from Him and whose end will be the best in the Hereafter: It is sure that the wrongdoers will not prosper."

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Firon (Pharaoh) said: "O Chiefs! I do not know of any god for you except myself: Therefore, O Haman! Fire up a (large oven to make bricks) from the clay for me, and build me a high palace, so that I may climb up to the God of Musa (Moses): But as far as I know, I think (Musa) is one of the lairs!"

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he and his armies were arrogant and rude in the land, beyond limit—  without (being) right, they thought that they would not have to come back to Us

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We caught him and his armies, and We threw them all into the sea: So see what was the end of the wrongdoers

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We made them (only) the leaders inviting (others) to the Fire: And on the Day of Judgment, they will find no help

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We made a curse to follow them in this world: And on the Day of Judgment they will be from the hated (and damned)

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We gave the Book to Musa (Moses) after We had ruined the earlier generations, (as a) Vision (of Truth, the Torah) to men, and Guidance and Mercy, that they may receive warning (and guidance)

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you (O Prophet!) were not on the Western side (of the Tawa valley of Mount Thr) when We gave the prophethood to Musa (Moses) and you did not see (those events)

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But We raised up (new) generations from them, and the ages that passed over them were long; And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, repeating Our Signs to them; But it was We Who send (them) messengers

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you were not at the side of (the Mountain of) Thr, when We called (to Musa). Still (O Prophet! You are sent) as a Mercy from your Lord, to give warning to a people (of Arabia) to whom had come no warner before you: In order that they may remember and receive the warning

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if (We had) not (sent you to the people of Makkah)— (and) if a misfortune came over them for (the actions that) their hands have already done, they might say: "Our Lord! Why did You not send a messenger to us? We should then have followed Your Signs and been from those who believe!"

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (now), when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves, they say, "Why are not (Signs of Allah) sent to him, like those (Signs; The rod, the glowing hand) which were sent to Musa (Moses)? Then, did they not reject (the Signs) which were formerly sent earlier to Musa (Moses)? They say: "Two types of magic, one helping the other!”, And they say: “For us, We reject all (types of magic)!"

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say (to such rejecters): "Then you bring a Book from Allah, which is a better Guide than earlier of them, that I may follow it! If you are truthful!"

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But if they do not listen to you, (You) know that they only follow their own wishes: And who is more lost than one who follows his own wishes without the guidance from Allah? Verily, Allah does not guide people used to doing wrong

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We have made the Word (this Quran) reach them, so that they may remember and receive the warning

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those to whom We sent the Book before this— They (also) believe in it (the Word of Allah)

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when it is read out to them, they say: "We believe in it, verily, it is the Truth from our Lord: Truly, we have been Muslims even before this."

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These (people) will be given their reward twice over, because they have persevered, and (in) that they repel evil with good, and that they spend (in charity) from what We have given to them

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they hear evil and vain talk, they turn away from it and say: "To us our deeds, and to you yours; Peace be to you: We do not search out the ignorant."

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is true that you will not be able to guide everyone whom you love; But Allah guides those whom He will. And He knows best those who receive guidance

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they say: "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we will be driven away from our land." Have We not built for them a land of safety, to which are brought all types of fruits, as gifts— A stock (of food) from Ourselves? But most of them do not understand

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And how many a town have We destroyed, (those) that became thankless for the livelihood: Now after them (the people of the towns), their homes lie empty and unlived— All except for a little! And We took over after them

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And your Lord was never the One to ruin a population until He had sent to its center a messenger, reciting (and rehearsing) to them Our Signs; And We not going to ruin a population unless its members commit injustice

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whatever (worldly) things you are given are only the comforts of this life and its show; But what is with Allah is better and more lasting: Then will you not be wise

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Can (these two) be the same? One to whom We have made a good promise, and who is going to see its (fulfillment), and (the other) one to whom We have given the good things of this life, but who, on the Day of Judgment, will be from those raised up (for punishment)

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Day when (Allah) will call to them, and say: "Where are My (so called) 'partners’? Whom you thought (to be so)?"

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those against whom the charge will be proved, will say: "Our Lord! These are the ones whom we led astray: Because we were astray ourselves: We free ourselves (from them) in Your Presence: They did not worship us."

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it will be said (to them): "Call to your 'partners' (for help):" They will call to them, but they will not listen to them; And they will see the penalty (before them); (They will wish:) "Only if they were open to guidance!"

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that Day (Allah) will call to them, and say: "What was the answer you gave to the messengers (of Allah)?"

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then on that day, the (whole) story will seem dark (and distant) to them and they will not be able to question each other

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But any who had repented, believed, and worked righteousness, will hope to be with those who are successful

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And your Lord creates and chooses as He pleases: No choice have they (about it): Glory to Allah! And He is far above the 'partners' they give (to Him)

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And your Lord knows what their breasts (hearts) hide and what they reveal

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He is Allah: There is no god but He. To Him be praise, at the first and at the last: For Him is the Command, and to Him you will be returned

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Tell me! If Allah was to make the night last for ever for you till the Day of Judgment, which god is there other than Allah, can give you Light? Then will you not listen?"

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Tell me! If Allah was to make the day last for ever for you till the Day of Judgment, which god is there other than Allah, can give you a night in which you can rest? Then will you not see?"

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is from His Mercy that He has made for you night and day— That you may rest in it (the night), and that you may seek His Grace (in the day)— And so that you may be thankful

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Day that when He will call to them, and He will say: "Where are My (so called) 'partners'? Whom you thought (to be of those)?"

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And from each people, We will draw a witness, and We shall say: "Produce your proof:" Then shall they know that the Truth is with Allah (Alone), and the (lies) that they had invented will leave them in the bad situation

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, Qarun (Qaroon) was from the people of Musa (Moses); But he acted rudely towards them: The treasures We had given to him were such that just their very keys would have been a burden to a group of strong men; "Remember", his (Qaroon’s) people said to him: "Do not feel overjoyed, because Allah does not love those who are joyful (in their wealth)

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But search out, with the (wealth) that Allah has given to you, the Home of the Hereafter, and do not forget your lawful (and good) fortune in this world: But you do good, like Allah has been good to you, and do not search (to make) mischief in the land: Verily, Allah loves not those who do mischief."

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "This (wealth) has been given to me only because of a certain knowledge which I have." Did he not know that Allah had ruined, before him, (whole) generations— Which were superior to him in strength and exceeded in the amount (of riches) that they h.ad collected? But the wicked are not called (right away) to account for their sins

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So he went before his (own showy) people with the (pride of his worldly) show. Those whose goal is the life of this world, said: "Oh! If only we had the (wealth) like what Qarun (Qaroon) has got! Verily, he is truly a lord of very good fortune!"

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But those who had been given (true) knowledge said: "Sorrow for (woe unto) you! The reward of Allah (in the Hereafter) is best for those who believe and act righteousness: But this no one will get, except those who continuously persevere (in good)."

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, then We made the earth to swallow him up and his house; And he had not (the smallest) group to help him against Allah, and he could not protect himself

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who wished his position the day before began to say the next day: "Ah! It is truly Allah, Who grows the provision or shrinks it, to any of His servants He pleases! If it was not that Allah was kind to us, he could have caused the earth to swallow us up! Those who disbelieve will never be successful."

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We will give that Home of the Hereafter to those who do not want arrogance or mischief on earth: And the end is (best) for the righteous

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If any does good, the reward for him is better than his deed; But if any does evil, the doers of evil are only punished to the extent of their deeds

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely (O Prophet!) He, Who ordained the Quran for you, will bring you back to the Place of Return (signifies both Makkah and the Hereafter). Say: "My Lord knows best who brings true guidance, and who is openly in the wrong."

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you had not expected that the Book would be sent down to you, except as a Mercy from your Lord: Therefore you do not give any support to those who reject (Allah’s Message)

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And let nothing keep you away from the Signs of Allah (verses) after they have been made known to you: And invite (men) to your Lord, and do not be in the company of those who join gods with Allah

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And call not, besides Allah, to another god. There is no god but He: Everything (that lives) shall die except His Own Face. To Him belongs the Command, and to Him will (all of) you be brought back

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Alif  Lam  Mim

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does mankind think that by (just) saying, "We believe," they will be left alone and that they will not be tested

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We indeed, did test those who were before them, so that Allah will indeed know, those who are true and He will know those who are liars

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do those who act evil think that they will gain over Us (Allah)? Evil is their judgment (if they think so)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whosoever hope (and wish) for meeting with Allah (let them work hard); Because the Time (fixed) by Allah is surely coming: And He is the All Hearing (As-Sami’), All Knowing (Al-Aleem)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whosoever strive a(with will and strength), they do so for their own souls: For Allah is Free (Ghani) of all needs from all Creation

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who believe, and do righteous good deeds— Surely, from them, We shall remove any evil deeds still (left) in them, and We shall truly, reward them according to the best of their deeds

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have enjoined kindness to parents from men: But if they (either one) try hard to make you join (anything) with Me (others for worship) anything about which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. (All of) you have to return to Me (Allah), and I will tell you (the truth) of all that you did

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for those who believe and do righteous good deeds— Surely, We shall admit them to the company of righteous

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then there are among men who say, "We believe in Allah;" But if they suffer pain in (the cause of) Allah, they treat men's suffering as if it was the Anger of Allah! And if victory comes (to them) from your Lord, they are sure to say: "Verily, we have (always) been with you!" Does Allah not know best all that is in the breasts (hearts) of all Creation

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, Allah most truly knows those who believe, and as truly (He knows) those who are the hypocrites (who hide the truth)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who disbelievers say to those who believe: "Follow our path, and we will bear (the burden) of your faults." Never (and not) in the least will they bear (the burden of) their faults: In fact they are liars

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, they will bear their own burdens, and the burdens (of others) with their own, and surely, they will be called to account, on the Day of Judgment, for their lies that they made up

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We (once before) sent Nuh (Noah) to his people, and he waited with them for a thousand years less fifty years; But the Flood overtook them while they (kept up their) sin

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We saved him and the companions of the Ark, and We made (the Ark) a Sign for all peoples

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember, We also saved Abraham) Ibrahim, when he said to his people, "Worship (and serve) Allah and fear Him: That will be best for you— If you (only) understand

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You worship idols besides Allah, and you bring out falsehood. Verily, those whom you worship besides Allah have no power to give you the provision to live: For this reason, you seek your livelihood from Allah, worship (and serve) Him, and be grateful to Him: Your return will be to Him

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And if you reject (this Message), many generations before you also did so: And the duty of the messenger is only to preach plainly and openly (and clearly)."

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not see how Allah originates the creation, (and) then repeats it: Truly that is easy for Allah

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Travel through the earth and see how (Allah) originated the creation; Like this Allah will bring forth a later creation (Hereafter): Verily, Allah is Able (Khadir) to do all things

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He punishes whom He wills, and He grants mercy to whom He wills, and towards Him will you return

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And neither on earth nor in heaven; Will you be able to escape (His Plan), and you have no protector nor helper besides Allah."

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who reject the Signs of Allah and the meeting with Him (in the Hereafter)— They shall suffer without My mercy: And they will (also suffer) a most painful penalty

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So nothing was the answer from (Ibrahim's) people except that they said: "Kill him or burn him." Then Allah did save him from the fire. Surely, in this indeed, are Signs for people who believe
