21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Obey those who do not ask any reward from you and (those) who have themselves received (Allah’s) Guidance

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "It is not reasonable for me if I did not serve Him Who created me, and to Whom you shall (all) be brought back

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah, Ar-Rahman) Most Gracious should have some misfortune for me, their pleading for me will not be of any use and they cannot set me free

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "If I do so, truly I will be (making) a clear mistake

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "For me, I have faith in the Lord of you (all): Then, listen to me!"

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It was said: "You enter the Garden." He said: "O me! If only my people knew (what I know)

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "That my Lord has given me Forgiveness and has given me (a place) among those held in honor!"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We did not send down any army from heaven against his people, after him. And it was not necessary for Us to do that

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It was not more than a single Mighty Blast (A powerful explosion), and look! They were (like ashes) put out (quiet) and silent

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ah! Sorrow on the part (My) servants! There has not come one messenger (of Allah) to them that they have not made fun of him

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not see how many of the generations before them We have destroyed? Verily, they (messengers) will not return to them

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But each one of all of them (the generations)— Will be brought before Us (for Judgment)

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a Sign for them is (that when) the earth is dead: We give it life, and produce grain from it, from which you do eat

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We produce in it gardens with date trees and grapes (in vines that climb), and We cause springs to come from within it

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That they may eat the fruits of this (gift from Allah) it was not their hands that made this (possible): Then will they not give thanks

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Glory to Allah, Who created all the things in pairs that the earth produces, and also their own kind (also created in pairs) and (other) things about whom they do not know

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a Sign for them is the night: We withdraw from it the day, and look, they are thrown in darkness

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the sun moves along its way for a (length of) time set for him: That is the order of (Allah), the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Knowing (Al-Aleem)

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the moon— We have measured for it stages (to travel) till it comes back like the old (and worn out like the) lower part of a (crescent, dried out) date stalk

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is not allowed for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night overtake the day: Each (can only) stay on in (its own) path (according to the Order of Allah)

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a Sign for them is that We held together their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark (of Nuh, or Noah)

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We created for them similar (ships) on which they ride

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If it was Our Will, We could drown them: (And) then there would be no helper (for them), nor could they be saved

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except as the part of Mercy from Us, and as a part of a few (worldly) things (for them) for a (little) while

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when it is said to them: "You fear that which has happened before you, and that which will come after you, so that you may (also) receive (Allah's) Mercy," (then they do not listen and go away)

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: From the many Signs (verses) of their Lord, there is not (even) one Sign (verse) that comes to them from which they do not turn away

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they are told: "You spend from (the many gifts) that Allah has given to you;" The unbelievers say to those who believe: "Shall we really feed those (people) whom, if Allah had so willed, He (Himself) would have fed? You are in nowhere but in clear mistake."

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they also ask: "When will this promise (be fulfilled), if you are truthful?"

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will not (have to) wait for anything, except a single Blast (A powerful explosion), it will catch (and grip) them while they are still quarreling among themselves

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they will have no (chance by their own) will to settle (their affairs), and not (even) to return to their own people

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Trumpet (a very loud instrument) shall be sounded, when (you will) see! From the graves (men) will come quickly forward to their Lord

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "Ah! Sorrow to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep?" (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah, Ar-Rahman) the Most Gracious had promised, and the word of the messengers was (really) true?"

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It will be no more than a single Blast, so behold! They will all be brought up before Us

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, on that Day, not (even) one soul will be unfairly treated in the least, and you shall be only given the (just) reward for your past actions

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, on that Day, the companions of the Gardens shall be busy and happy in everything that they do

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They and their wives will be in the (cool) shade of thick trees, resting on thrones (of dignity)

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There will be (every type of) fruit for them; They shall have whatever they want

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Their word will be), "Peace!" A Word (of greeting) from the Lord, Most Merciful (Raheem)

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (To others, the word will be:) "And, you O criminals (the peoples of sin!) You get (yourselves) far away on this Day

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " Did I not command you? O! Children of Adam! That you should not worship Satan; Verily, he is to you an open enemy.—

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And that you should worship Me (Allah); For, that is the Straight Path

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And he (Satan) did take (you) a large number of you, (away towards evil). Then, did you not understand

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This is the Hell of which you were promised (many times)

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This Day, you burn (yourself in the Fire) because you rejected (the Truth many times)."

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This Day, We shall set a seal on the mouths. And their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness to all that they did

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If it was Our Will, We could surely have wiped out (blinded) their eyes; So that they would have run about searching for the Path, but (then again) how could they have seen

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if it was Our Will, We could have transformed them (just to be) in their places; Then they would not have been able to forward (move about), and they could not have turned back

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if We gave long life to anyone, We would have reversed him in creation (by making him weak after giving him strength) then will they not understand

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have not taught the (Prophet) poetry, and (poetry) is suited not for him: This is no less than a Message and Quran making things clear

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And also) that it may warn anyone (who is alive), and that its Word (Message) may be justified against the disbelievers

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not see that it is We Who have created from the (many) things that Our hands have fashioned for them— (Is also) cattle, for which they are the owners

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have subdued them (the cattle) for their (use)? Of them some are for riding, and some they eat

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they have (other) benefits from them (the cattle), and they get (milk) to drink; Then will they not be thankful

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they take besides Allah, other false gods, (thinking) that they might be helped (by the false gods)

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They (the gods) have not the power to help them: But they (the unbelievers) will be brought forward (for Judgment) as a (whole) group (to be punished)

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, do not let their (idle) talk, make you sad (O Prophet!). Surely, We know what they hide and what they say

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does man not see that it is We Who created him from (a clot in the) sperm-ovary drop? Yet see! He (makes himself) an open enemy

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he puts forth (and invents) comparisons for Us, and forgets his own (true origin of) Creation: (And) he says: "Who can give life to the bones after they have become rotten and turned to dust?"

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "He will give them (the bones) life (the One) Who created them for the first time! And He is All Knowing (Aleem) of every kind of creation

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "The same (Allah); He, Who produces fire out of the green tree, for you, who see! You may start a fire with it

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create (another) like them? Yes indeed! (He can recreate them.) He is the Supreme Creator (Al-Khaliq), the All Knowing (Al-Aleem

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Surely, when He wants anything, His Command to it is, 'Be', and it is!"

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So Glory be unto Him, in Whose hands is the kingdom of all things, and to Him all of you will be brought back

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By those who arrange themselves in ranks (or rows, to serve and to worship Allah,

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by those who raise the clouds in a holy way, (to keep away the fears from the mind of humans,

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who recite the Message (of Allah)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely! (And assuredly,) your Allah is One (Wah'id)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all (that is) between them, and Lord of every point of the sun-rising, (that keeps changing every day of the year

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We have truly stored the lower heaven with beauty (of) the stars—

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (For beauty) and for protection against every tough (unwilling and) revolting Satan

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (So that) they (the Satans') should not try to hear from the direction of the Exalted Assembly (of men and angels in Allah’s service and worship) but (they) be thrown out from every side

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Outcast (and unwelcome), they are under an everlasting penalty

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except such who may snatch something by stealing: And they are being followed by a flaming Fire of stabbing brightness

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then just ask (the disbelievers) what they think: Are they the more difficult to create, or the (other) creations whom We have created surely, We have created them (the disbelievers) out of a sticky clay

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nay! Do you wonder while they mock (and make fun of you and the Quran)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they are reminded, they pay no attention—

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they see a Sign (from Allah), they mock at it

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they say: "This is nothing but evident magic!"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "What!" (they ask), "When we are dead, and become dust and bones, shall we (then) be resurrected (raised up again)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And also our fathers from the old (days)?"

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You say: "Yes, then you shall (also) be put to shame (because of your evil)."

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then it will be a single (harsh) cry; And look, they will begin to see

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "Woe (misery) to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (A voice will say:) "This is the Day of Sorting Out, whose Truth you denied (once)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The angels will be told): "Bring (all of) you up (for Judgment); The wrongdoers and their companions; And the things they worshipped—

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Besides Allah, and lead them to the way to the (burning) Fire

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But stop them, verily, they must be asked

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " 'What is the matter with you, why do you not help each other (now)?' "

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! But on that Day they shall submit themselves, (to the Judgment

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will turn to one another, and question one another

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "It was you who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will reply: "No, you, yourselves were not believers

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Also we did not have any authority over you. No, it was you who were a transgressing people

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So now (this moment) has come true against us, the Word of our Lord that we shall really taste (the penalty of our sins)

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "We led you astray: Because, truly we were ourselves astray."

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then truly, (on) that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, that is how We shall deal with the criminals (Al-Mujrimun)

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, they would fill themselves up with (false) pride

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they said: "What! Shall we give up our gods for the sake of a poet possessed?" (Referring to Prophet

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No, he (the Messenger) has come with the Truth, and he restates (the Message of) the messengers (before him)

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, you shall really taste the painful Penalty—

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But it will be no more than the penalty for (the evil) that you have done —

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except the true (and loving) servants of Allah—

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For them, their food (and provision) is known

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Fruits (and Joys); And they (shall have) honor and dignity

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In Gardens of (supreme) happines

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Facing each other on thrones (of dignity)

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Around to them will be passed a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Crystal-white (and) of a delicious taste for those who drink (from it)

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Free from all pains (and annoyances); They will not suffer intoxication (from it)

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And beside them will be noble (and pure) women, holding back their looks, with big eyes (filled wonder and beauty)

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded (from evil)

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they will turn to one another and question one another

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: One of them will start the speak and say: "Verily, I had a close companion (on the earth)

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Who used to say: 'What! Are you from those (people) who confirms the Truth (of the Message)

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " 'That when we die and become dust and bones, shall we really receive the rewards and punishments?' "

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The speaker) said: "Would you like to look down?"

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So he looked down and saw him (the questioner) in the middle of the Fire

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (the speaker) said: "By Allah! You brought me very close to ruin (in this Hell)

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would surely be among those brought (to Hell)!"

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The people of Paradise will say:) "Is it (true) that we will not die (again)

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, this is the supreme success (to be in the Paradise of joy)

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For those who like (the state) this (joy) let (them) all work hard, (those) who wish to strive

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is that (the Paradise), the better place (of joy) or the (evil and wicked) tree of Zaqqum (in the Pit of Hell, see 37.64—65)

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, We have made it (the evil tree of Zaqqum) a trial for the wrongdoers

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, it is a tree that comes out from the bottom of Hell-Fire

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The buds of its fruit-stalk, come out of the stems; (They are) like the heads of Satans'

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, they (the wrongdoers) will eat from there and fill their stomachs with it

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, thereafter, verily their return will be to the burning Fire of Hell

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, they found their fathers on the wrong path

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So they (also) were rushed down after them (in their fathers evil footsteps)

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, before them, many (people) from the olden days went astray—

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We sent (messengers) among them, to warn them—

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then see what was the end of those who were warned (but did not pay attention)—

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except the devoted (and loving) servants of Allah

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, (in the old days), Nuh (Noah) cried to Us, and We are the best of those to answer him

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We rescued him, and his family from the great destruction (of the Flood)

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made his children (and descendants) to live (and stay on this earth)

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We left for him (this noble blessing) in the generations to follow in later times

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Peace! (and greetings) to Nuh (Noah) among the (Our) Creation!"

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, like this do We reward those who do good

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, he (Nuh) was one of Our believing servants

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We drowned the others (in the Flood)

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, among those who followed his (Nuh’s) way was Ibrahim (Abraham)

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When he said to his father and to his people, "What is it that, which you worship

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it a lie, false gods other than Allah, that you want

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Then what do you know about the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen )?"

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he took a look at the stars

89.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he said, "I am truly sick (at my heart)!"

90.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So they (his people) turned away from him, and left (him)

91.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he turned to their gods and said: "Will you not eat (from what is offered to you)?..

92.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "What is the matter with you that you do not speak (and make sense)?"

93.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he turned upon them (their gods), striking (them) with the right hand

94.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then (the worshippers) came with quick steps, and faced (him)

95.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "Do you worship what you have carved (yourselves)

96.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "While (it is) Allah (Who) has created you and (also) what you have made!"

97.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "Build for him a house (burning like a furnace), and throw him into the blazing fire!"

98.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So (after having failed; See 21.69), they then took a way (to hurt) against him, but We made them the ones most ashamed

99.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he said: "Verily, I am going to my Lord! He will surely guide me

100.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O my Lord! Grant me (a progeny) of the righteous!"

101.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We gave him the good news of a boy ready (to be born) to suffer and be patient

102.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when (his son, Ismail) became (the age to) work with him, he (Ibrahim) said: "O my son! I see in a dream (vision) that I offer you in sacrifice (to Allah): Now see what is your (own) thought!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do like you are commanded: You will find me, if Allah so wills one who has (great) patience (and constancy!)"

103.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when they both had submitted their wills (to Allah’s Wish), and he (Ibrahim) had laid him (his son, Ismail) prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice)

104.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We called out to him, "O Ibrahim (Abraham)

105.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You have already fulfilled your vision!"— Verily, thus We do reward those who do good

106.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, it was clearly a trial (for Ibrahim)—

107.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (with that of a ram)

108.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We left for him (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times

110.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, thus do We reward those who do good

111.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, he was one of Our believing servants

112.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We gave him the good news of Ishaq (Isaac)— A prophet— One of the righteous

113.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We blessed him and Ishaq (Isaac): And of their children (and descendants) are (some) who do right, and (some) who clearly do wrong to their own souls

114.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And again, (from the past) We bestowed Our favor on Musa (Moses) and Haroon (Aaron)

115.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We saved them and their people from (their) great misfortune

116.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We helped them, so that they overcame (their troubles)

117.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We gave them the Book and Clear Scripture (Torah, which helps to make things clear)

118.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We guided them to the Straight Path

119.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We left for them (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times

120.Syed Vickar Ahamed: “Peace, be upon Musa (Moses) and to Haroon (Aaron)!"

121.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, thus do We reward those who do good

122.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, they were two of Our believing servants

123.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, Ilyas (Elias) was one of Our messengers

124.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When he said to his people: "Will you fear (Allah)

125.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Will you call upon the false god (Baal) and give up the Best of Creators—

126.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Allah— Your Lord and (Cherisher and) the Lord (and Cherisher) of your fathers from the earlier days?"

127.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they denied him, so they will be truly brought up (for punishment)—

128.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except the sincere and the devoted servants of Allah (among them)

129.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We left for him (this blessing) in the generations to follow in later times

131.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, thus do We reward those who do good

132.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, he was one of Our believing servants

133.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, Lut (Lot) was one of the messengers

134.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, We saved him and all his people (with him

135.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except an old woman (his wife) who was with those who fell behind

137.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, you pass by their (sites) by the morning—

138.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by night: Will you not reflect and understand

139.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, Yunus (Jonah) was one of the messengers

140.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When he ran away (like a slave runs from captivity) to the ship (fully) loaded (with men and cargo)

141.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he (agreed to foretell fortunes and) cast lots, (and he was blamed for the ships bad weather) and he was a loser, punished (and thrown in the sea)

142.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then the (big) fish swallowed him, and he had done actions worthy of blame (by running away from his mission)

143.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If it was that he had not (repented and) glorified Allah

144.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He would surely have remained inside the fish till the Day of Resurrection (to be raised from the dead)

145.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But We cast (threw) him on the open shore while he was (still) sick

146.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We made a vine (of hard shelled fruit) to grow over him for shade

147.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We sent him to (teach Allah’s Message to) a hundred thousand (men) or more

148.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they believed; So We let them enjoy (their lives) for a while

149.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Now ask them (the unbelievers) what they think: Is it that your Lord has (only) daughters, and they have sons

150.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or that We created the angels female, and they have seen (it)

151.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, is it not they who say (in their disbelief and), from their own lies and sayings

152.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Allah has had children?" And verily, they are liars

153.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons

154.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What is the matter with you? How do you decide

155.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then will you not remember (receive the warning)

156.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do you have a clear authority

157.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (If so), then you bring your Book (of authority) if you are truthful

158.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they have invented a blood-relationship between Him and the jinns', but the jinns' know (very well) that they (also) have to appear (for Judgment)

159.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Glorified be Allah! (He is) Free from the things that they relate (to Him)

160.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except those slaves of Allah, whom He chooses

161.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So surely, neither you nor those you worship—

162.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Can lead (any of Allah’s servents) into temptation (and lies) about Allah

163.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except those who are (by themselves) going to the blazing Fire (of Hell)

164.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Those angels arranged in ranks to serve Allah say): "Not even one of us does not have a place appointed

165.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And, verily we are surely arranged in ranks (for Allah’s Service)

166.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And surely we are those who speak out (Allah’s Supreme) Glory!"

167.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed they (the pagan Arabs) used to say

168.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "If only we have had a Message before us from those (Books) of old

169.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "We would truly have been the Servants of Allah, sincere (and loving)!"

170.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (now that the Quran has come), they (still) reject it: But soon will they know (the penalty)

171.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, Our Word, already has been given before (this) to Our servants and messengers sent

172.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That they would certainly be made victorious

173.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that Our forces— Surely, they would the be victor

174.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So you (O Prophet!) turn away from them for a little while

175.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And watch them (how they will do), and they shall soon see (how you do)

176.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they really want to hurry Our punishment

177.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then when it (the punishment) falls into the open space before them; Painful will be the morning for those who were warned (but did not pay attention)

178.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So you turn away from them for a little while

179.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And watch them (how they will do), and they shall soon see (how you do)

180.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Honor and Power! (He is free) from the things that they relate (to Him)

181.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Peace (be) on the messengers (of Allah)

182.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And all the Praises (and thanks) to Allah, the Lord (and Cherisher) of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Sad: And the Quran, full of Guidance and Reminding (and Warning, this is the Truth)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! Those who disbelieve are in arrogance and opposition (and think only about self-glory and separatism)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: How many generations before them did We destroy? In the end, they cried but there was no more time (for them) to be saved

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they (pagans) are surprised that a warner (the Prophet) has come to them from themselves! And the unbelievers say: "This is a magician (with unusual powers and) telling lies

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Has he (the warner) made (all) the gods into one god? Truly, this is a wonderful thing!"

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And their leaders (the unbelievers) hurry away, (saying:) "You (also) walk away, and remain with your gods! Truly, this is a thing meant to be (against you)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "We have never heard (anything like this) from the people of these latter days: This is nothing but an invention (made up story)!"

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "What!" (they say in anger), "Has a Message been sent to him (of all the persons) from us?"... But they are in doubt about Me (and My Message); No, but they have not yet tasted My punishment

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they have the wealth of the Mercy of your Lord- The Supreme in Power (Al-Aziz), the Bestower of Bounties without measure (Al-Wahhab)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or have they the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all between? If so, let them reach up with the ropes and means (to get there)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But there- Even a large number of (their) allies will be defeated

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Before them (there were many who rejected messengers of Allah)— The people of Nuh (Noah), and Ad, and Firon (Pharaoh), the lord of (wooden) poles, (to mark his empire.

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Samood (Thamud), and the people of Lut (Lot), and the companions of the Wood— Like this were the Confederates (the allies of unbelievers

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Not one (of them did anything) but denied the messengers, but My punishment came justly and surely (to them)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And these (people) only wait for a single Blast, which (is blown by Angel Israfil) will tolerate no delay

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They (the unbelievers will) say: "Our Lord! Hasten our sentence (of punishment, even) before the Day of Reckoning (and account)!"

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have patience at what they say, and remember Our servant Dawood (David), the man of (great) strength; Verily, he always came back in repentance (to Allah)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We made the hills recite Our Praises together with him, in evening and at break of day

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And all the birds gathered (in flocks), did turn (to Allah) with him (Dawood)

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom, and good judgment in what he talked and what he decided

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, has the story of the (two) who disagreed reached you? When they climbed over the wall of the private room (where he prayed)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When they entered in presence of Dawood (David), and he was frightened of them, they said: "Fear not: We are two litigant (who disagree), one of us has wronged the other: Therefore, decide between us now with truth, and do not treat us with injustice, and guide us to the Right way

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, this man is my brother (in religion): He has ninety and nine ewes (female sheep), and I have (only) one: Yet he says; 'Leave her (the one sheep) to me,' and (also he) is rude to me when he talks."

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Dawood) said: "Without a doubt he has done wrong to you by asking you for (the single) sheep to add to his (flock of) sheep: And truly, there are many partners (in business) who do wrong to each other, except those who believe and work deeds of righteousness do not act like that, and how few are they?"... And Dawood (David) gathered that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness from his Lord, and he fell down, bowing (in prostration), and turned (to Allah in repentance)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We forgave him (for) this: And he really enjoyed an extreme closeness to Us, and a Beautiful Place of (final) Return

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Oh Dawood (David)! Verily, We truly made you a successor and leader on earth: So you judge between men in truth (and justice): And do not follow the (idle) desires (of your heart), for they will take you away from the Path of Allah: Verily, those who go away from the Path of Allah, (there) is a painful penalty, because they forget the Day of Reckoning (and Account)

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between (them) without purpose. That is what the unbelievers thought. But warning (and sorrow) to the unbelievers because of the Fire (of Hell)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Shall We treat those who believe and do righteous good deeds in the same (way) as those who make (evil) mischief on earth? Or shall We treat those who are the pious and righteous, in the same (way) as those who turn away from right

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (This is the Quran) a Book that We have sent to you full of blessings, so that they may (carefully) think about its Signs, and so that men of understanding may be remember

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And to Dawood (David), We gave (his son) Sulaiman (Solomon)— Verily, he always turned (to Us) very well in Our service

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When, in the evening, horses of the finest breeding, and quick in running, were brought before him

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he (Sulaiman) said: "Truly, I love the good things, in order to see the Glory of my Lord," until (the sun) was hidden behind the curtain of (dusk). [During this late Asr—Maghrib time (i.e., early—mid evening), Sulaiman used to pray to Allah.]

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Then, he said:) "Bring them (the horses) back to me." Then he began to pass his hand over (their) legs and their necks

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, indeed We did try Sulaiman (Solomon): We placed a body (without life) on his throne: (Like giving him power without giving him a soul) but he turned (to Us in true devotion)

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my Lord! Forgive me, and grant me a kingdom which may not suit another (king) after me: Verily, You are the Bestower (Al-Wahhab) of good things (without measure)."

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We made the Wind obey his power, to flow gently by his order, where ever he wanted—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And like this did (others obey his order); The Evil ones (Satans and jinns') of every kind of builder and diver—

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As also others (obeyed his order those) tied together in chain

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah addressed Sulaiman and said:) "These are Our many gifts (of good things): Whether you (O Sulaiman!) give them (to others) or do not give them, no account will be asked."

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And truly, he enjoyed, an extreme closeness to Us, and (it is) a Beautiful Place of (final) Return

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And remember (with honor) Our Servant Ayub (Job). When he cried to his Lord and said: "The Satan has hurt me with pain and suffering!"

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (An order from Us was given:) "Strike your foot: This is where (water) is to wash, to cool, to refresh, and to drink."

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We gave him (back) his people and doubled their number— As a Favor from Ourselves, and a thing to remember for all who have understanding

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And take in your hand a little (bunch of thin) grass, and strike (your wife with) it: And do not break your promise." Truly, We found him (Ayub or Job) full of patience and constancy. How well in Our service did he ever return (to Us)

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And remember (with honor) Our Servants Ibrahim (Abraham), Ishaq (Isaac), and Yaqoub (Jacob), those who had power and vision

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, We did choose them for a special (purpose)— Restating the Message of the Hereafter

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (in Our sight,) they truly were of the company of the chosen and of the Good

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And remember (with honor) Ismail (Ishmael), Al-Yasa (Elisha), and Zul-kifl: Each of them was of the company of the Good

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This is a Remainder (with guidance and warning): And surely, for the Righteous, is a Beautiful Place of (final) Return—

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Paradise, (Gardens of Eternity), whose doors will (forever) be open to them

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In there they will rest (in comfort) in there they can call for fruit in plenty, and (for delicious) drink

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And beside them will be modest (and noble) women withholding their looks, (and companions) of equal age

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This is the Promise made to you for the Day of Reckoning (and Account)

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly like this will be Our Rewards (to you,) it (the Promise) will never fail—

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yes like this! And for those who do wrong the place of (their final) Return will be evil

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Hell, is where they will burn in there, an evil bed (to lie on)

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yes like this! (And) then they shall taste it— A boiling fluid, and the murky discharge of dirty wounds

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And other similar penalties of the same kind

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (When they are taken to Hell)— Here is a group going straight with you! (There will be) no welcome (even in the Hell) for them! Truly, they shall burn in the Fire

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The followers of evil will cry out to their leaders:) No, you (too)! (There is) no welcome for you! It is you who have made this happen to us! Now, (this) place to stay-in is evil

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They (the followers) will say: "Our Lord! Whoever has made this happen to us— Add a double penalty of Fire upon him!"

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will (also) say: "What has happened to us that we see not men whom we used to count among the bad ones

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Did we treat them with mockery, or have (our) eyes failed to see them?"

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, that is just and fitting— The charges made upon each other by the people of the Fire

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (O Prophet) Say: "Truly, I am a warner: There is no god except Allah, the One and Only (Al-Wah'id), the Irresistible (Al-Qahhar)—

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between,— The Exalted in Might, (Al-Aziz), the Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafa’r)."

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "That is a Message Supreme (above all)

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "From which you turn away

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "I have no knowledge about the high chiefs (angels), of the Exalted Assembly when they discuss (things) by themselves

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Only this has been revealed to me: That I am to give (this) warning plainly and publicly."

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Remember), your Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man from clay

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So, when I have fashioned him and breathed into him, his soul, from My Spirit, then you (angels should) fall down (and prostrate) in respect for him."

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except the Chief Satan: He was haughty, and became one of those who reject Faith

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) said: "O Satan! What prevents you from prostrating yourself to the one whom I have created with Both My Hands? Are you proud (and haughty)? Or are you one of the high (and mighty) ones?"

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Satan) said: "I am better than him (Adam): You created me from fire, and You created him from clay."

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) said: "Then get yourself out from here: For verily, you are an outcast, rejected and accursed

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And surely, My Curse shall be on you till the Day of Recompense (Judgment)."

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Satan) said: "O my Lord! Then give me time (of relief) till the Day when the (dead) are Resurrected."

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) said: "Surely, then time is given to you—

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Till the Day of the Time (which has been) appointed."

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Satan) said: "Then by Your Power (and Permission) I will mislead them (men) all in the wrong (path)—

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Except (those of) Your Servants amongst them (the men who are) sincere and purified (by Your Grace)."

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) said: "Then it is just and fitting— And I say what is just and fitting—

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "That I will surely fill Hell with you and those (men) who follow you, together."

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (O Prophet) say: "I do not want any reward from you for this (Quran), and I am not a pretender

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This (Quran) is not less than a Remainder to (all) the Worlds

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And you will surely know the truth of it (all) after a while."

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: the Revelation of this Book is from Allah; The Almighty, (Al-Aziz, the One Exalted in Power), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, it is We Who have revealed (and made known) the Book to you in Truth: So, worship Allah, giving Him (your) sincere love and prayer

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, for Allah Alone is the truest religion (of love, worship and sincerity). But those who take for protectors other than Allah, (say): "We only worship them so that they may bring us closer to Allah." Truly Allah will judge between them where they differ. But Allah does not guide him who is a liar and ungrateful

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If Allah had wished to take to Himself a son, He could have chosen whomever He pleased from those He creates: But Glory be to Him! (He is above such things.) He is Allah, the (Single) One (Al-Wah'id), the Compelling, (Al-Qahhar, Overpowering

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He has created the heavens and the earth in truth (and in proper proportions): He makes the night reach into the day, and makes the day reach into the night: He has subjected the sun and the moon follow (His law): Each one follows a path for a certain (preset) time. Verily, is He not the (One) Exalted in Power (Al-Aziz)— The Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafa’r)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He created (all of) you from a single person, then created, his mate of a similar nature; And He has sent down for you eight heads of cattle in (four) pairs (of sheep, goats, oxen and camels); He makes you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation (in stages one after another), in three covers (trimesters) of darkness. Such is Allah, your Lord (and Cherisher). To Him belongs (all) kingdom. There is no god but He: Why, then are you turned away (from Him)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If you reject, Allah, surely (He) does not have any need of you; But He does not like the thankless from His servants. And if you are thankful, He is pleased with you. No (human being who is a) bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another (human being). Then to your Lord is your Return, in the end, when He will tell you the truth of all that you did (in this life). Verily, He knows well all that is in (everyone's) hearts

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when some trouble comes to man; He cries to his Lord, turning to Him (the Lord) by feeling sorry for what he has done: But when He gives him (the man, a gift) of Mercy from Himself, (man) forgets what he cried and prayed for before, and he sets up rivals to Allah, so as to mislead others from His (Allah’s) Path. Say (to such people): "Enjoy your disbelief for some time: Surely, you are from the companions of the Fire!"

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is one who is obedient (to Allah) with love and sincerity in the hours of the night prostrating himself or standing (up in love and admiration), who pays attention to the Hereafter, and who places his hope in the Mercy of his Lord, (like one who does not)? Say: "Are those equal, those who know and those who do not know?" It is those who have understanding that receive guidance

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "O you my (people!) Servants who believe! Fear your Lord, for those who do good in this world, (the Reward) is good. Spacious is Allah’s earth! Those who patiently work hard will truly receive a reward without measure!"

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Surely, I am commanded to worship Allah with all my sincere love, servitude and prayer (to Him)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And I am commanded to be the first of those who bow to Allah in Islam."

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "If I disobeyed my Lord, I would truly have fear of the penalty of a Mighty Day."

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It is Allah Alone (Whom) I worship, with all my sincere love, servitude and payer (to Him)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So you worship whatever you will besides Him." Say: "Truly, those in loss (now) are those who (will) lose their own souls and their people on the Day of Judgment: Verily! That is truly the (greatest and) real Loss!"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They shall have layers of Fire over them, and layers (of Fire) below them: With this, Allah does warn His servants: "Oh My Servants! Then you fear Me!"

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who avoid evil— And do not fall into its worship— And turn to Allah (in repentance), for them are the glad tidings and good news so announce the good news to My servants—

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who listen to the Word, and follow the best (meaning) in it: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones blessed with understanding

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, is the one against whom the judgment of punishment is justly due (equal to one who avoids evil)? Then, would you save one who is in the Fire

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the high palaces (to live in) have been built one above another, for those who fear their Lord; Beneath them rivers (of joy) flow: (This is) the Promise of Allah, and He never fails in (His) Promise

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and leads it (the rain water) through springs in the earth? Then from it, He makes produce of various colors to grow: Then it fades (due to lack of water): (And) you will see it grow yellow; Then He makes it dry up and fall down. Truly, in this, there is a Message to remember for men of understanding

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is one whose breast Allah has opened to Islam, so that he has received the Light from his Lord, (not better than one whose heart is in disbelief)? (There is) grief for those whose hearts are hardened against saying the Praises of Allah! They are clearly walking about in error

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has sent down (from time to time) the Most Beautiful Message, in the form of a Book, (the Scripture, this Quran) true within (and to) itself, (always) repeating (its teaching): The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver and tremble by (reading and hearing) it; Then their skins and their hearts soften by to the remembrance of Allah. Like this is the Guidance of Allah. He guides like this whom He pleases, but no one can guide those whom Allah leaves to wander about

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, is the one who has to fear the hurt of the penalty on the Day of Judgment (and receive it) on his face, (like one who is safe from it)? And it will be said to the wrongdoers: "You taste (the fruits of) what you earned!"

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (There were) those who rejected (the Message) before them and so (for them) the punishment came to them from directions they did not expect

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, Allah gave them a taste of hurt (and disgrace) in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, in this Quran, We have put forth every kind of similar (and meaningful) story for men in order that they may be informed (and warned)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It is purely) a Quran in Arabic, without any (dishonesty or) crookedness in it: In order that they (those who read) may protect (themselves) against evil

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah puts forth a parable (the story with meaning and guidance in it)— A slave belonging to many different partners, (false gods) disputing with one another and a slave belonging only to one master : Are those two equal in comparison? All the Praises (and thanks) be to Allah! But most of them do not know

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, you will die (one day), and truly they will also die (one day)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then in the End, you will (all) on the Day of Judgment, settle your disagreements in the Presence of your Lord

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, who does more wrong than one who talks a lie about Allah, and rejects the Truth when it comes to him! Is Hell not the home for disbelievers (and blasphemous)

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he (the man) who says the Truth and he who restates (and supports) it— Such men are those who do right

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They shall have all that they wish for, in the Presence of their Lord: That is the reward for those who do good

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So that Allah will remove from them the evil of (the worst of) their deeds and give them their reward to suit the best of what they have done

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is not Allah enough for His servant? But they (the wrongdoers) try to frighten you with other (gods) besides Him! And whom Allah leaves to wander, for him, there can be no guid

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those whom Allah guides, for him there can be no one who can take them away (from the Straight Path). Is not Allah Supreme in Power (Aziz), Imposer of Retribution (Muntaqim)

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And truly, if you are to ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth?" Surely, they would say, "Allah." Say: "Do you see then? The things that you invoke besides Allah— If Allah gives me some penalty, can they remove His penalty? Or if He gives some mercy for me, can they keep back His mercy from?" Say: "Sufficient is Allah for me! In Him trust those who put their trust."

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "O my people! Do whatever you can: I will do (my part): But soon will you know—

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "To whom comes a penalty of dishonor, and upon whom will fall a penalty that stays forever."

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, We have revealed the Book to you in Truth, for (teaching the whole) mankind. Then, he who receives guidance helps his own soul: But he who wanders away hurts his own soul. You (O Prophet!) are not set over them as a trustee over them (for their affairs)

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is Allah, Who takes the souls at their death; And from those who do not die during their sleep (He takes as they sleep): Those for whom He has ordered death, He does not let (them to return to life), but He sends the others (to their bodies) for a length of time. Surely, in this, are (His) Signs for those who think

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What! Do they take intercessors other than Allah? Say: "Even if they do not have any power whatever and (have) no intelligence?"

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "To Allah Only belongs every (right to grant) any intercession: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: In the end, it is to Him that you shall be brought back."

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when (the Name of) Allah, the One and Only is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the hereafter are filled with disgust (and hate), and when (the false-gods) other than He are said, look, they are filled with joy

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "O Allah! Creator of the heavens and the earth! Knower of all that is hidden (Aa’lam-al-Ghaib), and all that is seen! It is You, Who will judge between Your Servants in those matters about which they have differed."

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who did wrong had all that there is on earth, and as much more, (for no use) they would offer it to save (themselves) from the pain of the penalty on the Day of Judgment: But something will confront them from Allah, over which they could never have counted upon

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for the evils of their actions will confront them, and they will be (completely) surrounded by that which they used to mock at

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When trouble comes to man, then he cries (and calls) to Us for help: When We give him a favor all by Ourselves, he says: "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge (I have)!" No, but this is only a trial, but most of them do not understand

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, the (people) before them talked like this! But everything they did was of no use to them

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, the evil results of their actions overtook them. And for the wrongdoers of this (generation)— The evil results of their actions will (also) soon overtake them, and they will never be able to stop or escape (Our Plan)

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not know that Allah increases the things (He gives) or reduces them, for anybody whom He pleases? Surely, in this are Signs for those who believe

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "O servants (slaves of Allah, those) who have transgressed against their souls! Do not feel sad about the Mercy of Allah: For Allah forgives all sins: Truly, He is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And you turn to your Lord (in repentance) now and submit to His (Will), before the Penalty comes on you: And after that you shall not be helped

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And follow the best (of the paths) revealed to you from your Lord, before the penalty comes upon you— All of a sudden, when you are not aware!"&mdash

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In case the soul should say: "Ah! I am in (deepest) sorrow because I neglected (my duty) to Allah, and (I) was among those who made fun!"&mdash

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or (in case) he should say: "If Allah had only guided me, then I should really have been with the righteous!"

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or when it sees the penalty (in case) it should say: "If only I had another chance, I should really be with those who do good!"

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yes verily, (the reply will be:) "But there came to you My Signs (verses), and you did reject them: You were proud (and haughty) and became one of those who rejected Faith!"

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And on the Day of Judgment, you will see those who told lies against Allah their faces will be turned dark because of their lies and fabrication; Is it not in Hell, a home (shall be) for the arrogant and haughty

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Allah will deliver the righteous to their place of joy and success (and to peace): Evil shall touch them not, and they shall not grieve (or be sad)

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah is Creator (Khaliq) of all things, and He is Guardian and the Trustee (Wakil) of all things

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To Him, belong the keys of the heavens and of the earth: And those who reject the Signs of Allah— It is they who will be in loss

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Is it that you order me to worship someone other than Allah?, O you! (Foolish ones) who do not know."

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, it has already been revealed to you— Like it was (made known) to those before you— "If you were to join (gods with Allah), truly useless (and meaningless) will be your work (in life), and surely you will be with those who lose (every good)."

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! But Allah (Alone, you) worship, and be among those who give thanks

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They have not made just estimate of Allah, like that which is due to Him: And on the Day of Judgment the whole of the earth will be held firmly by His hand, and the heavens will be rolled up in His right hand: Glory to Him! And He is high above the partners that they make up for Him

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Trumpet will be blown (by Angel Israfil, and sounded loudly), when all that are in the heavens and on earth will be dizzy (and faint), except what will please Allah. Then will a second (Trumpet) one be sounded, when, look, they will be standing and looking

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the earth will shine with the Glory of its Lord: And the Record (of deeds) will be placed (open); And the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward, and a fair decision made between them with truth and they will not be wronged (in the least)

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (the reward) of the actions of every soul will be paid in full; And (Allah) is All Aware (Aa’lam) of all that they do

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the unbelievers will be driven to Hell in groups; Till they arrive there, its gates will be opened. And the Keepers (of Hell, see 74.30) will say, "Did not the messengers come to you from yourselves telling you the Signs of your Lord, and warning you of your meeting (Allah) on this Day?" The answers will be: "Yes! But the Order of Punishment has been proved true against the unbelievers!"

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It will be said (to them): "Enter you the gates of Hell, to live in there: And evil is (this) home of the haughty!"

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Paradise (Garden) in groups: When they arrive there, and its gates will be opened; And the Keepers (of Paradise)  will say: "Peace be upon you! Well have you done! You enter here to live in there forever."

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will say: "All Praises (and thanks) be to Allah, Who has truly fulfilled His Promise to us, and has given us (this) land in return: We can live in the Garden like we will: How excellent a reward for those who work (righteously)!"

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you will see the angels surrounding the (Divine) Throne on all sides, glorifying the Praises to their Lord. (At Judgment) the Decision between them will be in (perfect) justice, and it will be said (from all sides), "All Praises (and thanks) be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)!"  (See verse 1.1

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ha  Mim

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Revelation of the Book (the Quran) is from Allah, the Almighty (Al-Aziz, Supreme in Power), the All Knowing (Al-Aleem, Full of Knowledge)—

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, the Severe in punishment, the Bestower (of Mercy). There is no god but He: To Him is the Final Return

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No one can dispute about the Signs (Verses) of Allah, except the unbelievers. Then, do not let their (useless and) broken words through the land deceive you

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (there were people) before them, who rejected (the Signs)— The People of Nuh (Noah), and those who joined together (in evil) after them; And every (one of those) people who plotted against their messenger, to seize him, and disputed by means of pride (and falsehood) just to bring down and therefore to knock down the Truth: But it was I Who seized them! And how (terrible) was My punishment (for them)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Thus the Judgment of your Lord against the unbelievers was proved to be true that really they are companions of the Fire

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those (angels) who bear the Throne (of Allah) and those around it recite the Glory and Praise of their Lord; And believe in Him; And pray for Forgiveness for those who believe: (Saying:) "Our Lord! Your reach is in all the things, in Mercy and Knowledge. Then forgive, those who turn in repentance, and follow Your Path; And save them from the punishment of Hell

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And our Lord! Permit (them), that they enter the Gardens of Eternity, which You have promised to them, and to the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their children! Verily, You are Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And save them from (all) evils; And any (people) whom You do save from evils; That (Last) Day— You will have blessed them with Mercy indeed: And (for them) will be truly a great success."

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The unbelievers will be told: "Indeed, to you the dislike of Allah was greater than the dislike of yourselves, (by) seeing that you were called to the Faith and you used to refuse."

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "Our Lord! Twice have You made us (when we were) without life, and twice You have given us Life! Now we have recognized our sins: Then, is there any way to get out (of this)?"

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The answer will be:) "This is because, when (you were told that) Allah was to be the Only (One for worship), you did reject Faith, and when partners were joined with Him, you believed (it)! The Command is with Allah, the Most High (Al-Ali’i), the Most Great (Al-Kabir)!"

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He, it is Who shows you His Signs, and sends down the (rain and) provision for you from the sky; But only those who receive guidance will turn (to Allah)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, you call upon Allah, with sincere devotion to Him, even though the unbelievers, may not like it

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Raised high above ranks (or limits, He is Allah), the Lord of the Throne (of Authority): By His Command, He does send the spirit (of inspiration) to any of His servants He pleases, that it may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting—

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day on which they will (all) come forward: Not a single thing concerning them is hidden from Allah. Whose will be the Kingdom that Day? It is Allah, the One (Al-Wah'id), the Irresistible (Al-Qahhar)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day will every soul be given back what it earned; There will be no injustice on that Day, truly, Allah is Swift in taking account (Al-Hasib)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And warn them of the Day, which is (always) coming closer, when the hearts will (come) right up to the throats to choke (the unbelievers): No close friend, nor anybody will the wrongdoers have to plead, who could be listened from

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah) knows (the tricks) that deceive the eyes and (He knows) all that the hearts (of men) hide

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Allah will judge with (Justice and) Truth: But those whom (men) call upon besides Him (Allah), will not (be in a position) to judge at all. Surely, He is Allah, the All Hearing (As-Sami’), the All Seeing (Al-Baseer)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before them? Those (people) were even superior to them in strength, and (see) in the little (that they have left) in the land: But Allah did call them to account (and explain) for their sins, and they had nobody to help them against Allah

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That was because their (own) messengers (from Allah) came to them with clear proof, (evidence and signs), but they rejected them: So Allah called them to account (and punish them for their sins): Verily, He is All Strong (Qhavi), Strict in Punishment

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed (earlier), We sent Musa (Moses), with Our Signs (verses) and a clear Authority

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And) to Firon (Pharaoh), Haman, and Qarun (Qaroon); But they called (him) "A magician telling lies!"..

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when he came to them in Truth, from Us, they said: "Kill the sons of those who believe with him, and keep alive their females," but the plans of the unbelievers (end) in nothing but mistakes (and delusions)

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said Firon (Pharaoh): "Leave me to kill Musa (Moses); And let him call on his Lord! What I fear is that he may change your religion, or that he may cause mischief to appear in the land!"

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Musa (Moses) said; "I have really called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from everyone (who is) proud (and) who does not believe in the Day of Account!"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a believing man from the people of Firon (Pharaoh), who had hidden his faith, said: "Will you kill a man because he says, ‘My Lord is Allah?’— When he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? And if he is a liar, (the sin of) his lie is on him: But, if he is telling the Truth, then something of the (great misfortune) about which he warns you, will fall upon you: Truly, Allah does not guide the one who sins against (Him) and lies

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O my people! The power this day is yours: You have the upper hand in the land: But who will help us from the Punishment of Allah, should it come upon us?" Firon (Pharaoh) said: "I point out to you only what I see (myself); Nor do I guide you to (any path) but to the path of right!"

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then the man who believed said: "O my people! I do truly fear for you something like the Day (of great suffering) for those who join together (in sin)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Something like the fate of the people of Nuh (Noah), and ‘Ad, and the Samood (Thamud), and those who came after them: And Allah never wishes injustice to His servants

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And, O my people! Verily, I fear for you a Day when there will be calling one another (in sorrow)—

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "A Day when you shall turn your backs and run away: No defender shall you have from Allah: And anyone whom Allah leaves to become lost, for him there is none to guide..

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And indeed, Yusuf (Joseph) came to you in earlier times, with Clear Signs, but you did not stop doubting about the (purpose) for which he had come: In the end, when he died, you said: ‘No messenger will Allah send after him.’ Thus does Allah leave (them) to be lost as those who act in sin and live in doubt—

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "(Such as those) who dispute about the Signs of Allah, without any authority that has reached them. Serious (painful) and disliked (is such conduct) in the Sight of Allah and of the believers. Thus Allah closes every heart of proud and stubborn sinners."

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Firon (Pharaoh) said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty tower (high palace), that I may find the ways and means—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens, and that I may climb up to God of Musa (Moses): But as far as I think, I think (Musa) is a liar!" Thus in Firon's (Pharaohs) eyes, the evil of his deeds, was made pleasant (and easy for him), and he was kept away from the (right) Path; And the plan of Firon (Pharaoh) led to nothing but destruction (for him)

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In addition, the man who believed said: "O my people! Follow me: I will lead you to the right Path

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary) comfort, it is the Hereafter that is the Home that will stay

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He who works evil will not be repaid except by its own kind: And he who works a righteous deed— Whether male or female —and is a true believer— Such (a person) will enter the Garden (of happiness): In there they will have plenty without measure

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And, O my people! How (strange) it is for me to call you to peace (and happiness) when you call me to the Fire

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You do call upon me to lie against Allah and to join with Him partners of whom I have no knowledge: And I call you to the Supreme in Power (Al-Aziz), the Often-Forgiving (Al-Ghafa’r)

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Without a lie! You do call me to one (the false god), who is not fit to be called to, either in this world, or in the Hereafter; And our Return will be to Allah; And those who exceed the limits will be companions of the Fire

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And soon will you remember what I say to you (now). My (own) actions (and future) I leave to Allah: Verily, Allah (always) watches over His servants."

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So Allah saved him (the believer) from the evils that they planned (against him), while the evil of the penalty surrounded the people of Firon (Pharaoh) on all sides

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Fire, they will be brought in front of it, morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "You throw the people of Firon (Pharaoh) into the severest Penalty!"

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will fight with one another in the Fire! The weak ones (who followed) will say to those who had been proud (and arrogant), "Verily, we only followed you: Can you then take (upon yourselves) from us some share of the Fire?"

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who had been proud (and arrogant) will say: "We are all in this (Fire)! Truly, Allah has judged between (His) servants!"

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell: "Pray to your Lord to lighten us the punishment (even) for a Day!"

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "Did your messengers not come to you with clear evidences and signs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply: "Then pray (as you like)! And the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (useless wandering) in error!"

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Without doubt, We will make victors, Our messengers and those who believe, (both) in the life of the world and in the Day when the witnesses will stand forth—

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when it will be of no use for the wrongdoers to bring up their excuses, but they will (only) have the Curse, and the Home of Misery

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed before now, We did give Musa (Moses) the Guidance, and We gave the Book (Torah) to inherit the Scripture for the Children of Israel—

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A Guide and a Message to men of understanding

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Patiently await, (O Prophet!): The Promise of Allah is true: And ask forgiveness for your fault, and celebrate the Praises of your Lord in the evening (‘Asr prayer), and in the morning (Faj’r prayer

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who disagree (and dispute) about the Signs of Allah without any authority given to them— In their hearts there is nothing but (the search for) greatness which they shall never get then, find (help and) shelter in Allah, Verily, it is He is the All Hearing (As-Sami’), the All Seeing (Al-Baseer)

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, the creation of the heavens and the earth is indeed a greater (matter) than the creation of mankind: Yet most men do not understand

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The blind and those who see are not equal: Those who believe and work the righteous deeds and those who do evil are (also) not equal. Little do you remember

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, the Hour will certainly come: About this (there) is no doubt: Yet, most men do not believe

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And your Lord says: "Call upon Me; I shall answer your (prayer): Verily, those who are too proud to worship Me they will surely find themselves in Hell, in shame and in humiliation."&mdash

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is Allah Who has made the night for you that you may rest in it and (it is Allah Who has made) the day for you, as that which helps (you) to see surely, Allah is Full of Grace and Bounty to mankind: Yet, most men do not offer thanks

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this is Allah (in His Mercy), your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no god but He: Then, why you are turned away from the Truth

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like so are turned (away from Truth) those who are used to rejecting the Signs (verses) of Allah

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is Allah Who has made for you the earth as a resting place, and the sky as a canopy (and a cover): And (He) has given you shape— And made your shapes beautiful— And (He) has provided for your living, from things pure and good— Like this is Allah (in His Mercy), your Lord. Therefore Glory (be) to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is the Ever-Living (Al-Hai’i): There is no god but He: Turn to Him, offering Him sincere love with gratitude. All the Praises (and thanks) be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "I have been forbidden to worship those whom you worship besides Allah— Since that the clear evidences have come to me from my Lord; And I have been ordered to bow (down in Islam) to the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)."

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has created you from dust, then from a sperm-ovary drop, then from a leach like clot, then He does get you out (into the light) as a child, then lets you (grow and) reach your age of full strength, then lets you become old, though there are some of you who die before, and lets some of you reach a term appointed; In order that you may understand (and learn wisdom)

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who gives life and causes death; And when He decides upon a thing, He says to it only: "Be," and it is

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see those who dispute about the Signs (verses) of Allah? How they are turned away (from reality)

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who do not accept the Book (this Quran), and the (Revelations) with which We sent Our messengers: But they shall soon know—

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the clamps of iron (shall be) round their necks, and the chains: They shall be dragged along—

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In the boiling (foul smelling) water; Then they shall be burned in the Fire

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then it shall be said to them: "Where are the (false gods) to which you gave part (of your) worship—

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Besides (and in offense to) Allah?" They will reply: "They have vanished and left us; No, we did not call upon anything before, anything (that had real existence) from the old." Thus Allah leaves the unbelievers to stray

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to them,) "That was because you were used to being happy on the earth in things which were not the Truth, and that you were used to being haughty (and disrespectful)

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You enter the gates of Hell, to live therein," and evil is (this) home of the haughty (and disrespectful)

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So keep (working, O Prophet!) with patience; Verily, the Promise of Allah is True: And whether We show you (in this life) some part of what We promise them— Or We cause you to die (in Our Mercy, in any case), it is to Us that they shall (all) return

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We did send messengers before you: Of them there are some whose story We have told you and some whose story We have not told you, and it was not (possible) for any messenger to bring a Sign except by the Permission of Allah: But when the Order of Allah was given, the matter was decided in truth and justice, and those who stood on falsehoods were destroyed to be lost

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah! It is He Who has made cattle for you, that you may ride on some of them, and some of them for food

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, for you there are many other benefits in them (the cattle) and that you may use them for any need that (there may be) in your hearts; And on them and on ships (that) you are carried

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He (always) shows you His Signs: Which, then of the Signs of Allah will you reject

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before them? They were more in number than them and (even) stronger in might and in the traces (they have left behind) in the land: Yet all that they did was of no use to them

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then when their messengers came to them with clear proofs and evidences, they were only happy (and proud) with the knowledge (and worldly things) that they had; And that very (suffering) at which they used to mock surrounded them

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So when they saw Our Punishment, they said: "We believe in Allah— the One Allah— And we reject all the partners we used to enjoin with Him."

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then their accepting the Faith after they (actually) saw Our Punishment was not going to help them. (Such has been) Allah’s Way of dealing with His servants, (from the oldest of times). And the rejecters of Allah were (totally) destroyed (in the Punishment)

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Ha  Mim

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A Revelation from (Allah), the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (This is Quran) a Book, in which the verses are explained in detail; A Quran in Arabic, for (those) people who understand

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Giving glad tidings (good news) and warning: But yet, most of them turn away, and so they do not hear

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they (those who do not hear) say: "Our hearts are (hidden) behind veils, from that to which you invite us; And in our ears is a deafness, and between us and you is a screen: So you do (whatever you wish); As for us, we shall do (whatever we wish!)"

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (O Prophet!) You say: "I am only a human like you: By Revelation, it is made known to me that your God is One Allah: So take the true Path to Him, and be in obedience (to Him) and ask for forgiveness," and (as) a warning to those who join gods with Allah—

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And to) those who do not give regular charity, and (to those) who even deny the Hereafter

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, those who believe and do righteous good deeds, for them is an eternal reward that will never fail

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Is it that you deny Him (the One), Who created the earth in two Days? And do you join (others) equal with Him? That is the Lord of (all) the Worlds (Rub-ul-‘Ala'meen)."

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He set upon the (earth) mountains standing firm, high above it (the earth), and He gave blessings upon the earth, and measured all the things, to give them nourishment in proper proportions; In four Days, in accordance with (the needs of) those who search (for the nourishment)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, He rose over the high heavens when it was (like) smoke: And He said to it and to the earth: "You (both) come together, willingly or unwillingly." They both said: "We do come (together), in willing obedience."

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, He completed them like seven arches (of the sky) in two Days, and He assigned to each heaven its duty and affair (as a command). And We brightened the lower heaven with lights and (provided) it with guard. Such is the Decree (Command from Him the One) the Almighty (Exalted in Might), All Knower

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But if they turn away, then you say (to them): "I have warned you of a sudden punishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which (overtook) the ‘Ad and the Samood (Thamud people)!"

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the messengers came to them, from before them and (from) behind them, (teaching) "Worship no one but Allah." They said, "If our Lord had so pleased, He would surely have sent down angels (to teach us): So, indeed we disbelieve in that with which you are sent. "

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Now the ‘Ad behaved haughtily through the land against all truth and reason, and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?" What! Did they not see that Allah, Who created them, was superior to them in strength? And they continued to reject Our Signs

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We sent against them a furious wind through days of misfortune so that We might give them a taste of a penalty of humiliation in this Life: But surely, the penalty of the Hereafter will be still more humiliating: And they will not find any help

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And as for the Samood (Thamud people), We gave them the guidance, but they preferred blindness (of heart) to Guidance: So the sudden punishment of humiliation got them, because of what they had earned

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We saved those who believed and practiced righteousness (and those who had truest Trust in Allah)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered together to the Fire, they will be marched in ranks

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: At length, when they reach the (Fire), their hearing, their sight, and their skins will speak up against them, as to (all) their actions

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will say to their skins: "Why do you bear witness against us?" They will say: "Allah has made us to speak, (He) Who gives speech to everything: And He created you for the first time, and to Him were you to return

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And you did not try to hide yourselves, because your hearing, your sight and your skins may bear witness against you! But you thought that Allah did not know many of the things that you used to do
