22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to the sinners:) "Indeed, you were careless about this; Now We have removed from you, your veil, and sharp is your sight this Day!"

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And his companion (angel) will say: "Here is (his record) ready with me!"

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The sentence from Allah will be:) "Both of you (angels) throw, into Hell every miserable rejecter (of Allah)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Who prevented what was good, exceeded all bounds, created doubts and suspicions

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Who set up another god besides Allah: Both of you (angels), throw him into a severe penalty."

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: His companion, (the Satan in the Hell) will say: "Our Lord! I did not make him transgress, but he was (himself) far away (from good)."

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He (Allah) will say: "Dispute not with each other in front of Me: I had already in advance sent you the Threat and Warning

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "The sentence that comes from Me shall not be changed, and I do not do the least injustice to My servants."

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On that Day, We will ask Hell, "Are you filled to the full?" It will say: "Are there any more (to come)?"

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Garden will be taken near the righteous— It will not be a far away thing

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (A voice will say:) "This is what was promised for you— For every one who turned (to Allah) with true repentance, (those) who kept (His Command)

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "(Those) who feared (Allah), Most Gracious, Unseen, (Rahman-bil-Ghaib) and brought a heart turned in repentance (and love for Him)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Therein, you enter in peace and security; This is a Day of Eternal Life!"

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For them, there will be all that they wish for— And more besides in Our Presence

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And how many generations before them did We destroy (for their sins)— (Though) they were stronger in power than them? And they wandered through the land: Was there any place of escape (for them)

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely in this there is a Reminder and a Message for anyone who has a heart and understanding or who gives ear and truly sees (the truth)

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We created the heavens and the earth and all between them in six Days, and no sense of tiredness touches Us

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then bear with patience, all that they say, and celebrate the Praises of your Lord, before the rising of the sun (Faj’r) and before (its) setting (Zuh’r and ‘Asr)

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And during part of the night (Maghrib and Isha), (also) celebrate His praises and (glorify Him) after the prayers (of His adoration)

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place close by—

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when they will hear a (mighty) Blast in truth (for awakening): That will be the Day of Resurrection

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, it is We Who give life and cause death; And to Us is the Final Return—

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day when the earth will be torn apart, from (men) quickly getting out: That will be a gathering together— (It is) quite easy for Us

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We know best what they say, and you (O Prophet) are not the one to bring Faith in them by force. But warn (him, the weary and confused) with the Quran such as (he, who) fears My Warning

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By (the winds) that scatter (around) the dust

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those (winds) that lift and carry away heavy weights

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those that flow with ease, (joy) and gentleness

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those that distribute and rearrange by (His) Order—

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, that which you have been promised is indeed true

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, Judgment and Recompense must indeed become established

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the sky with (its) numerous paths (through it)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, you are in a disagreeing opinion (about Faith and Islam

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Through (such opinions) which (people are) misled (away from the Truth) such as those who would be misled

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Misery to the liars and falsehood-mongers—

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who (are) carelessly (blundering) in a state of confusion (about the Faith of Islam)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They ask: "When will be the Day of Judgment and Recompense?"

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be) a Day when they will be tried (and burned) over the Fire

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Taste you your trial! This is what you asked to be hastened!"

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, as to the righteous (with firm Faith), they will be within the Gardens and Springs

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Taking joy in the things that their Lord has given them, verily, they were the doers of good deeds

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They were in the habit of sleeping but little by night

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the hours of early dawn, they (were found) praying for Forgiveness

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in their wealth and possessions (were remembered) the right of the (needy) he who asked and he who was prevented (from asking)

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the earth are Signs for those with certainty in Faith

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As also in your selves: Will you not then see

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the heavens is (beautiful) provision, and (all) that which (you) are promised

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then by the Lord of heaven and earth, this is the very Truth, as much as the fact that you can speak intelligently to each other

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Has the story of the honored guests (three angels) of Ibrahim (Abraham) reached you

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When they entered his presence, and said: “Peace!” He said, "Peace!" And said: "You are a people unknown to me."

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he turned quickly, to his household, brought out a fatted calf

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And placed it before them... He said, "Will you not eat?"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (When they did not eat), he became afraid of them. They said, "Fear not," and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then his wife came forward (laughing) aloud: She touched her face (in wonder) and said: "A barren old woman!"

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said, "Even so, your Lord has spoken: Verily, He is All Wise (Hakeem) and All Knowing (Aleem)."

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Ibrahim) said: "Then for what purpose have you have come, O messengers?"

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said, "We have been sent to a people who are criminals in (deep sin)—

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "To bring on, on them, (a shower of) stones of clay (brimstones)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Marked as from the Lord for those who trespass beyond bounds."

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We safely removed those of the believers who were there

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But We did not find there any just (believing) persons except in one house

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have left there a Sign for those who may fear the painful penalty

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in (Musa was another Sign) when We sent him to Firon (Pharaoh), with clear authorit

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (Firon) turned back with his Chiefs, and said, "An (evil) magician, or a madman!"

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So We took him and his forces, and threw them into the sea; And the blame was his

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the ‘Ad (people, is another Sign): We sent against them the devastating Wind

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It left nothing whatever that it came up against. But reduced it to ruin and decay

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the Samood (Thamud) people (was another sign): They were told, "Enjoy (your brief day) for a little while!"

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they angrily defied the Command of their Lord: So the stunning and destructive noise (of an earthquake) caught them, even while they were looking on

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they could not even stand (on their feet), nor could they help themselves

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So were the people of Nuh (Noah) before them: Verily, they wickedly exceeded all limits

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With Power (and Skill) did We construct the (mighty Arch of the) heaven : Verily, We are Who create the vastness of space with it

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have spread out the (spacious) earth: How excellently We do spread out

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And of everything We have created pairs: That you may remember and receive guidance

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So hasten you then (at once) to Allah: Verily, from Him, I am a Warner to you, clear and open

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And make no other object of worship with (Almighty) Allah: Verily, from Him, I am a Warner to you, clear and open

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this, no messenger came to the peoples before them, but they said (of him) in like manner, an (evil) magician, or a madman

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is this the teaching they have transmitted, one to another? No! They are themselves a people breaking beyond (their) bounds

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So turn away from them: Yours is not the blame

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And remind (the message) truly teaching the benefits (of the Quran) to the believers

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And I (Allah) have only created jinns' and men, that they may worship (and serve) Me

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No sustenance do I require from them, nor do I require that they should feed Me

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, Allah is the All Providing (Al-Raziq) of the provision— Lord of Power— Supreme, the Almighty (Al-Matin)—

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, for the wrongdoers, their portion (of punishment) is like the portion of their fellows (of earlier generations): Then let them not ask Me to hasten (that portion)

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Misery, then, to the unbelievers, on account of that Day of theirs which they have been promised

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By (the Mountain of) Thr

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the Book inscribed (and is carved out)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In a scroll (that is left open) unfolded

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the frequently visited Place of Worship (the mosque for angels above Ka’bah)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the sky raised high

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the ocean that fills with waves—

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, the (severe) penalty from your Lord will really come true—

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There is no one who can change it—

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day when the sky will swing in terrible fear

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains will fly here and there

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then woe (fear and misery), that Day to those (people) who treat (Truth) as falsehood

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those (people) who play (and indulge) in small and silly talk

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day when they shall be pushed down to the Fire of Hell, without any questions (being asked)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This," (it will be said:) "Is the Fire— Which you habitually deny

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is this a fake, or is it you who do not see

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So you burn in there, it is the same to you whether you can bear it with patience, or not: You only receive the penalty for your (own) deeds."

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, as to the righteous (people), they will be in the Gardens, and in happiness

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Enjoying the (true joy) which their Lord has given to them, and their Lord shall save them from the penalty of Fire

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to them:) "You eat and drink, with blessings and health, because of your (good) deeds."

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will rest (in comfort) on Thrones (of dignity) arranged in ranks; And We shall join them to companions, with beautiful, wide and lovely eyes

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who believe and whose families follow them in Faith— To them We shall join their families: And We shall not take away from them (the reward) of their works: (Still) each person is accountable for his deeds

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We shall provide them fruit and meat, anything that they want (to have)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There they shall exchange, one with another, a (loving) cup, free of pettiness, free of all signs of impurity

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And there will go around (devoted) to them, youths (handsome) as pearls, well-guarded

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will approach one another, engaging in mutual inquiry and questioning

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "Before now we were not without fear for the sake of our people

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So Allah has been gracious to us, and has delivered us from the penalty of the Burning Wind

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Truly, we did pray to Him from of old; Truly, it is He, the Beneficent (Al-Barr), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)!"

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore remind (mankind to celebrate the Praise of Allah). By the Grace of your Lord, you are not (any) petty-talker, and you are not a madman (nor one possessed)

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they say:— "A Poet! We will wait for him that some misfortune (will come) in time!"

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You say (to them): "You wait! I will also wait among those who wait!"

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they in their capacity to understand take themselves to this (way of lying), or are they only people exceeding beyond (their) bounds

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they say: "He made up (the Message);" No, they have no faith

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (If they can,) let them produce words (of the Message) like it, if they are telling the truth

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or were they created out of nothing? Or were they themselves the creators

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? No! They have no firm belief

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or are the treasures of your Lord with them? Or are they the tyrants to do anything they wish

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they have a ladder, by which they can (climb up to the heaven and) listen (to the secrets)? Then let (such a) listener of theirs come up with a clear proof

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or has He only daughters and you have sons

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or is it that you ask for a reward, so that they will be burdened with a load of debt

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, and they write it (the Suras) down

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they intend a plot (against you)? But those who act in disbelief (in Allah) are themselves involved in a (sinful) plot

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or have they a god other than Allah? Glorified is Allah, far above the things they associate with Him

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if they were to see a piece of the sky falling (on them), they would only say: "Clouds gathered in heaps!"

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So leave them alone until they face their Day (of Judgment), when they shall be taken over (with fear)—

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when their plotting will become useless for them and no help shall be given to them

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment (in the life) before this (Day), but most of them do not understand

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Now wait for the Decision of your Lord, with patience for surely, you are in Our eyes: And celebrate the Praises of your Lord the while you stand forth

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And also for part of the night you praise Him— And at the setting of the stars (during the dawn)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the Star when it goes down (and sets)—

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Your Companion (the Prophet) is not in evil ways and (he is) not being misled

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he does not say (anything) from (his own) desire

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is nothing less than Revelation sent down to him

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He was taught by one (Angel Gabriel, who is) mighty in power

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Gifted with wisdom, because he came clearly (in a noble way from limit of understanding  to High Throne of Allah.

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: While he was in the highest place of the horizon (in the distant skies)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he approached (nearer) and came closer

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And was at a distance of only two bow-lengths (of spiritual union) or even nearer

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like this (Allah) brought the Revelation (and the Message) to His servant (the Prophet)— (made known) what He (wanted) to reveal

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The (mind and) heart (of the Prophet) in no way lied about what he saw

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then will you disagree with him about what he saw

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, he (the Prophet) truly saw him (Gabriel) as (he) came down second (time)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Near the lote-tree (a thorny but a fruit bearing tree in Middle East beyond which none may pass: Symbolically, it is the limit of human understanding)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Near it is the Garden of Abode (Allah’s Divine Presence and His Paradise.

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the lote-tree was covered (in mystic wisdom that cannot be spoken!

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The (Prophet’s) vision (of Angel Gabriel) was never broken and it did not go wrong

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed he (the Prophet) saw, from the Signs of his Lord, the Greatest

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have you seen Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, (two forms of pagan Arabs goddesses in human forms

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And another, the third (goddess), Manat

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What (silliness)! For you (yourselves) the male sex, and for Him, the female

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That indeed, such a division will truly be most unjust

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These are nothing (at all) except names that you have made up— You and your fathers— For which Allah has not sent down any authority (whatever). They follow nothing but their own guesswork and what their own souls wish! Even though, already there has come to them guidance from their Lord

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! Shall man have anything (just because) he wishes for it

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But it is Allah to Whom the end and the beginning (of everything) belong

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And there are many angels in the heavens, their pleading will be of no use except after Allah has given permission for whom He pleases and that he is acceptable to Him

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who do not believe in the Hereafter, give names to the angels that are female name

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they do not have knowledge about it. They follow nothing except (their) guesswork; And, surely, guesswork is of no use against Truth

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore keep away from those who turn away from Our Message and (those who) want nothing except the life of this world

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That is as far as knowledge will reach them. Surely, your Lord knows best those who wander away from His Path, and He knows best those who receive guidance

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, to Allah belongs all there is in the heavens and on earth: So He rewards those who do evil, according to their actions, and He rewards those who do good, with what is best

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who keep away from great sins and shameful deeds, only (being caught up in) small faults— Surely, your Lord is plentiful in forgiveness. He knows you well when he creates you out of the earth (your chromosomes), and when you are hidden in your mothers’ wombs. Therefore do not justify yourselves: He knows best who it is who keeps away evil

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you see the one who turns back (from Faith)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Gives (in) a little then hardens his heart (and his feelings)

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does he have knowledge about the unseen so that he can see

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! Is he not familiar with what is in the books of Musa (Moses)—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And of Ibrahim (Abraham) who filled his promises

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Namely, that no bearer of burdens can carry the burden of another

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that man can have nothing except what he works (hard) for

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That (the fruit of) his work will soon come in sight

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then will he be rewarded with a complete reward

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that the final Goal is to your Lord

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That it is He Who gives laughter and tears

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That it is He Who causes death and gives life (again)

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that He created in pairs— Male and female

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: From a seed when placed (finally in the womb)

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that He has promised a second Creation (by raising the dead at Resurrection)

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that it is He Who gives wealth and satisfaction

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That He is the Lord of Sirius (Shi'ra, the Mighty Star in the constellation of Canis Major

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) 'Ad (people) of the old

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Samood (Thamud), and (He) did not grant them an eternal life

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And before them, the people of Nuh (Noah) because they were (all) most unjust and most arrogant (people) exceeding their limits

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He destroyed the defeated Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah)

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So that (soil and debris) have covered them up

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the gifts of your Lord (O man) will you question

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This is a warner (the Prophet), from the (number of) warners of old

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The (Judgment) ever approaching comes nearer

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: None besides Allah, can alter (the timing of) it

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, do you wonder at (the recitation of) this message

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And will you laugh and not weep—

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Wasting your time in useless things

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But you fall down in prostration to Allah, and (adoringly) worship (Him)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Hour (of Judgment) has drawn nearer, and the moon has been torn apart (cleft asunder.

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if they see a Sign they turn away, and say: "This is persistent magic."

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) desires and every matter has its appointed time

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed there have already come to them, recitations in which there is (enough) warnin

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Perfect wisdom (in this Quran)— But (the preaching of) warners does not profit them

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day when the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will come forth— Their eyes humbled—. From (their) graves, (dazed) like locusts scattered aboard

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller! The unbelievers will say: "Hard is this Day!"

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Before them, the people of Nuh (Noah) rejected (their prophet): They rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!," and he was driven out

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he called on his Lord: "I am the one overcome: Then You help (me)!"

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We caused the earth to gush forth with spring so, the waters met (and rose) to the decreed level

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks held together with palm-fiber

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: She (the Ark) floated under Our eyes (and care): A reward to the one who had been rejected (with contempt by his own people)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We have left this as a Sign (for all time): Then is there any who will receive the teachings

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then! How (terrible) was my Penalty and My Warning

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The ‘Ad (people also) rejected (the Truth): Then! How terrible was my Penalty and My Warning

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent disaster

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then! How (terrible) was my Penalty and My Warning

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The (people of) Samood (Thamud), also rejected (their) Warners

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they said: "A man! A solitary one from among ourselves! Shall we follow him? Truly, should we then be straying in mind, and mad

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Is it that the Message sent to him of all people amongst us? No! He is a liar, a disrespectful one!"

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will know the next day, who is the liar, the disrespectful one

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We will send the she-camel by the way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih) and keep yourself in patience

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each ones right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns)

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they called to their companion (in evil) and he took a sword in hand, and killed (the she-camel cutting her hamstrings)

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then! How (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one that keeps the cattle

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The People of Lut (Lot) rejected (his) warning

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We sent against them a violent tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut's household: (And) We delivered them by early part of the morning—

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As a Grace from Us: Thus do We reward those who give thanks

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (Lut) did warn them of Our punishment, but they disputed about the Warning

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, so, We blinded their eyes. (And they heard:) "Now you taste My Wrath and My Warning."

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Verily, early on the next day an abiding punishment seized them

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So you taste My Wrath and My Warning."

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have indeed made the Quran easy to understand and remember: Then is there any who will receive the teachings

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Also to the People of Firon (Pharaoh), before have, came Warners (from Allah)

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They (the people) rejected all Our Signs; So, We seized them with such penalty (that comes) from Almighty (Aziz, Exalted in Power), Able and Powerful (Muqtadir) to enforce His Will

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Are your unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they were or have you an immunity in the Sacred Books

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves?"

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon will their multitude be put to flight and they will show their backs

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! But the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most painful and most bitter

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (it will be said:) "You taste the touch of Hell!"

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, all things We have created in proportion and measure

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Our Command is but a single (Act)— Like the twinkle of an eye

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed (often) in the past, We have destroyed groups like you: Then is there any who will receive the teachings

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And all that they do is noted in (their) books (of deeds)

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And every matter, small and large, is on record

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, as to those who act right, they will be in the in the midst of gardens and streams

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Almighty (Muqtadir, Omnipotent Allah)

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah;) The Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has taught the Quran

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He has Created man

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He has taught him to talk (and understand)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The sun and the moon that follow (their) calculated courses

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the herbs (also the term for galaxy of stars) and the trees —Both prostrate (bow) themselves in respect (to Allah)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Arch of the Sky — He has raised high (above), and He has set up the balance (of Justice)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So that you may not willfully overstep (the fine) balance

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So establish (accurate) weight with justice and do not fall short in the balance

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) Creatures

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In there is fruit and date-palms, producing the long leaves (enclosing dates)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalks for feeding the cattle and the sweet smelling plants

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (men and jinns') renounce?—

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He created man from sounding clay like the clay of pottery

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He created jinns' from a smokeless flame of fire

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (He is the) Lord of the two easts (east and the far, far east) and the Lord of the two wests (west and the far, far west)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (He has created) the two free streams of flowing (salt and sweet) water, meeting together

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Between them is a barrier that they do not willfully overstep

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Out of them come pearls and coral

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And His are the ships sailing through the seas, high (and majestic) as mountains

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: All that is on earth will perish

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But will remain (Alive for ever), the Face of your Lord (Rab)— Full of Majesty, Bounty and Honor, (Zhul Jalal ul Ikram)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To Him begs (for its need) every creature in the heavens and on the earth: Every day in (new) splendor does He (shine)

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We shall soon settle your affairs— O both of you (jinns' and men)

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce? —

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you assembly of jinns' and men! If you can cross the zones of the heavens and the earth, then you cross (them)! (But) you shall not be able to cross, except with the authority (from Allah!

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce? —

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On you both (the evil ones from jinns' and men)! Will be sent (both) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke); No defense will you have

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the sky is split open, and it becomes red like (molten) ointment

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On that Day no question will be asked of man or jinn as to his sin

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The sinners will be known by their Marks: And they will be caught by their hair and their feet

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This is the Hell that the sinners (of this world) ignore

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In the middle, and (yes) in the middle of boiling hot water will they float around

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But for him who fears the time when they (the jinns' and men) will stand before (the Throne of Judgment of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens—

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Containing many kinds (of trees and delights)—

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them (each) will be two Springs (of water) flowing (free)

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two (for sufficiency and completeness)

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will recline (and rest) on carpets whose inner lining will be of rich embroidery: The fruit of the Garden will be near, (and easy to reach)

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them will be (maidens), chaste, restricting their glances, whom no man or jinn has ever before touched—

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They are like Rubies and Coral

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is there any Reward for good — Other than good

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And below these two, there are two other Gardens—

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Dark-green in color (and lush with water)

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them (each) will be two Springs with plenty of flowing water

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them both will be fruits and dates and pomegranates

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In them will be fair (companions), good and beautiful—

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Fair companions restricting (their glances), in (beautiful and decorated) homes—

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Companions) whom no man or jinn has ever before touched—

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both renounce? —

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Reclining (and resting) on green cushions and rich carpets of beauty

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then which of the miracles from your Lord will you both (jinns' and men) renounce?—

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Blessed be the Name of your Lord (Rab), Full of Majesty and Honor (Zhul-Jal-ul-Ikram)

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the Event that must occur will become a reality

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then no (soul) will have denial regarding its happening

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It will bring down (many) it will raise (many others)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the earth shall be shaken to its depths

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains shall be crushed to atoms

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So that they will become dust scattered around

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you shall be sorted out into three classes

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then (there will be) the companions of the right hand— What will be the companions of the right hand

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (there will be) the companions of the left hand— What will be the companions of the left hand

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those foremost (in Faith) will be foremost (in the Hereafter)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: These will be those nearest to Allah

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In Garden of (true) joy

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A number of people from those of the old

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a few ones from those of later times

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (They will be) on thrones inlaid (with gold and precious stones)

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Reclining on them, face to face

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Around them will (serve) youths of ever lasting (freshness)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With little glasses, (shining) tumblers, and cups (filled) from clear-flowing fountains

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No ill effects will they suffer from them, and they will not be dazed

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And with fruits, any that they may select

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the flesh of fowls, any that they desire

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (there will be) companions (Hu'rs) with beautiful, big and lustrous eyes—

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Like (they are) pearls, well-guarded

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A reward for the deeds of their past (life)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No pettiness will they hear in there, and not even a little of sinful speech (or idle talk)—

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But only the saying; "Peace! Peace!"

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those on the right (hand)— What will be the companions of the right hand

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (They will be joyful) among the (heavenly) lote-tree without thorns

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Among Talh (beautifully flowering) trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another—

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In (the) long-extended shade

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By water flowing constantly

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And fruit in abundance

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whose season is not limited, and (whose supply is not) stopped

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And on thrones (of dignity) raised high

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We have created (their companions) of special creation

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made them virgin, pure (and untouched)—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Loving (by nature), equal in age—

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For the companions of the right hand

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A (good) number from the first generation (in Islam)

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a (good) number from those of later generations

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The companions of the left hand— What will be the companions of the left hand

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (They will be) in the middle of a brutal blast of Fire and in boiling water

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And in the shades of black smoke

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (There will be) nothing to refresh, nothing to please

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, they used to indulge, before that, in wealth (and luxury)

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And willfully continued in the worst wickedness

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, shall we then indeed be Resurrected again

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "We and our fathers of old?"

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Yes, verily, those of old and those of later times

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a well-known Da

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Then surely, will you truly— O you who go wrong, and treat (Truth) as falsehood

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You will surely taste of the (Evil) tree of Zaqqum

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Then will you fill your insides with it

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And drink boiling water on top of it

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Indeed you shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: This will be their entertainment on the Day of Judgment

57.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is We Who have created you: Why will you not see (and accept) the Truth

58.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you see it? The (human) seed, (the chromosomes in the sperm and ovum) that you throw out—

59.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it you who created it? — Or are We, the Creator

60.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We have ordered death to be your common ending, and We are not to be frustrated—

61.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In changing your shapes and recreating you (again) in (shapes) that you have not known

62.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, you certainly know already the first form of creation: Why then do you not celebrate His praises

63.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you see the seed that you sow in the ground

64.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it you that cause it to grow, or are We the cause

65.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If it was Our Will, We could crumble it to dry powder, and you would be left in wondering

66.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Saying), "We are indeed left in debts (for no reason)

67.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Nay! Certainly we are denied (of the fruits of our labor)."

68.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see the water that you drink

69.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you bring it down (as rain) from the cloud or do We send it

70.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If it was Our Will We verily, could make it salt (and bitter) then why do you not give thanks (to Allah)

71.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see the Fire that you kindle

72.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it you who grow the tree which feeds the fire, or do We grow it

73.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We have made it (the fire) a monument and an article of comfort and convenience for those who live in the desert (this world)

74.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then celebrate with Praises the Name of your Lord (Rab), the Greatest (Al-Azeem)

75.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Next, I swear by the setting of the Stars—

76.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And surely, that is indeed a mighty and holy oath if you only knew—

77.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That, this is indeed a Quran most honorable

78.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In a Book well-guarded (with Allah)

79.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Which none shall touch except those who are clean

80.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen)

81.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it that such a Message that you would hold in light regard

82.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And have you made it your livelihood that you should renounce it

83.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then why do you not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throa

84.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you (sit) looking on—

85.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But We are nearer to him than you, and you see not—

86.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then why do you not— If you are excused from (future) account.—

87.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Return the soul, if you are truthful, (in your claim of independence)

88.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore, if he be among those nearest to Allah

89.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (For him there is) rest and satisfaction, and a Garden of (heavenly) delights

90.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if he be of the companions of the right hand

91.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (For him is the salutation); "Peace be upon you," for the companions of the right hand

92.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if he be of those who treat (truth) as falsehood, who go wrong

93.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then for him, the entertainment is with boiling water

94.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And burning in Hell-Fire

95.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely this! This is the very Truth (Haqq) and Certainty

96.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, celebrate with Praises the Name of your Lord (Rab), the Greatest (Al-Azeem)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: All that is in the heaven and on the earth— Glorifies Allah, and He is Almighty, (Exalted in Might), All Wise

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives life and causes death: And He is Able to do all things

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is the First (Awal) and (He is) the Last (Aakir), and the All Present, [Omnipresent, the All Evident (Za’hir)]: And (He is) the Hidden (Ba’tin), and He is the All Knower (Aleem) of all the (minutest) things

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days, and then He rose over the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes out of it: And what comes down from heaven and what rises up to it. And He is with you where ever you may be. And Allah sees well all that you do

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth: And to Allah, all affairs return (for the final decision)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He merges night into day and He merges day into night; And He has complete knowledge of the secrets in the breasts (in the hearts of humans)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend (in charity) out of the (sustenance) for which He has made you the inheritors. And (for those) who believe and spend (in charity), for them is a great reward

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what reason do you have? Why you should not believe in Allah? While the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord; And (He) has indeed taken your truest promise, (your covenant), if you are real believers

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He, the One Who sends to His servant (the Prophet,) clear Signs, that He (Almighty Allah) may lead you from the depths of darkness into the Light. And surely, Allah is full of Kindness (Ra'uf), Most Merciful (Raheem)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what reason do you have? Why you should not spend in the cause of Allah? And it is to Allah that belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought (the wars) before the Victory (of Makkah, with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought after (the Victory). But to all has Allah promised a best (reward). And Allah is familiar with all that you do

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Who is he who will lend to Allah a goodly and handsome loan? Then, He (Allah) will increase it many times to his credit, and he will (also) receive a generous reward

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day you shall see the believing men and the believing women— How their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (Their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens (of Paradise) beneath which flow rivers! To live in there for ever! This is indeed the highest success!"

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day the hypocrites— Men and women, will say to the believers: "Wait for us! Let us get something (a light) from your Light!" It will be said: "(You) go back to the rear! Then seek a light (where you can)!" So, a wall will be put between them, with a gate in it. Within it (the wall) will be mercy throughout, and outside and all alongside of it, will be (anger and) punishment

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Those hypocrites outside) will call the believers, "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply, "True! But you led yourselves into temptation; You looked forward (to our destruction); And you doubted (Allah’s Promise); And (your false) desires deceived you; Until the Command of Allah became true. And the Deceiver (Satan) deceived you in respect to (Almighty) Allah

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So, this Day shall no ransom be taken from you, or from those who disbelieved. Your home is Fire: That is the proper place to claim you: And it is an evil place to rest!"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Has not the time yet arrived for the believers, with their hearts, in all humility, should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been made known (to them); And that they should not become like those to whom was given the Message before, and during long ages (that) passed over them and their hearts grew hard? And many of them are rebellious transgressors

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You (who believe!) know that Allah gives life to the earth after its death! Already We have shown the Signs plainly to you. If you would only understand

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who give in charity, men and women, and loan to Allah, a beautiful loan, it shall be increased manifold (to their credit). And they shall have (besides) a generous reward

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers— They are the sincere (caretakers of Truth), and the witnesses (who testify), in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their reward and their light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs (verses), they are the companions of Hell-Fire

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You (who believe!) know that the life of this world is but a play and amusement, self-praising and boasting (within yourselves), and multiplying, (in rivalry) among yourselves, riches and children. Here is a similarity— Like a rain and the growth which it brings forth, give happiness (to the hearts of) the tillers; (But) soon it withers; You will see it grow yellow; Then it becomes dry and it crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a penalty severe (for those who follow wrong), and a Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure, (for those who love and worship Him). And what is the life of the world, but goods and possessions (objects) of deception

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Race with one another (to be the foremost in seeking) forgiveness from your Lord, and a Garden (Paradise of Bliss), whose width is the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers. That is the Grace of Allah that He bestows on whom He is pleased with: And Allah is the Owner of Gifts, great, (plentiful) and abounding

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls except that which is recorded in a command (written) before which We bring into existence: That is truly easy for Allah

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In order that you may not be sorry over matters that pass you by, nor become overjoyed by mercies bestowed upon you; Allah does not love any petty and showy boasters— (With praise for themselves)

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Such persons are stingy (with a selfish desire to own) and (they) suggest stinginess to men. And if any turn back (from Allah’s way), surely, Allah is free of all needs (Ghani), worthy of all praise (Hameed)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, We have sent Our messengers before with clear proofs and sent down with them the Book (the Scripture) and the balance (between right and wrong), that men may stand together in justice: And We sent down iron, in which is (material for) power and might (in war), as well as many benefits for mankind, that Allah may test who are those who will help Him (and His Religion), the Unseen and His messengers: Surely, Allah is Full of Strength (Qhavi), exalted in Might (Aziz, and able to enforce His Will)

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We sent Nuh (Noah) and Ibrahim (Abraham) and established in their line prophet-hood and revelation: And some of them (their people) were on right guidance but many of them became rebellious transgressors

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, afterwards, We followed them with (others of) Our messengers; And We sent after them Isa (Jesus) the son of Maryam (Mary), and gifted him the Gospel: And We placed compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But the self isolation and self-denial (practiced by monks in monasteries) which they made up for themselves, We did not place it upon them: (We commanded) only the seeking for the good Pleasure of Allah: But that they did not continue it as they should have done. So, We blessed, on those among them who believed, their (due) reward, but many of them are rebellious transgressors

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Fear Allah, and believe in His Messenger, and He will bless on you with twice the portion of His Mercy: And He will provide for you a light by which you shall walk (straight in your path), and He will forgive you (for your past): And Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That the People of the Book may know that they do not have any power over the Grace of Allah, that (His) Grace is (entirely) in His Hand, to (grant) it on anyone He wills. For Allah is the Owner of Gifts, great, (plentiful) and abounding

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed, Allah has heard (and accepted) the cries of the woman (Khaulah bint Thalabah) who pleads with you about her husband (Aus bin As-Samit) and brings her complaint (in prayer) to Allah; And Allah (always) hears the arguments between both sides among you: For Allah is All Hearing (Sami'), All Seeing (Baseer, of all things)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those men among you who make their wives unlawful to them (the men) by Zihar (a primitive and pagan custom of calling them mothers, see 33.4, these men know that) they (the wives) cannot be their mothers (of the men): None can be their mothers (of the men) except those who gave them birth. And in fact they (the men) use words (that are) unjust and false: But truly, Allah is All Pardoning (the sins), Often-Forgiving (Ghafoor

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But those who make unlawful their wives by Zihar, and wish to go back on the words they said— (It is necessary that such a man) should set a slave free before they (man and estranged wife) touch each other: This you are warned to do: And Allah is Well-Acquainted (Khabir) with (all) that you do

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if any (man) does not have (the means to free a slave), he should fast for two successive months (every day) continuously before they touch each other. And if anyone is unable to do so, he should feed sixty persons in need. This is (commanded to be) so, that you may show your faith in Allah and His Messenger. And these are the limits (set by) Allah. For those who disbelieve (in Him), there is a painful penalty

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be disgraced down to dust, like those who were disgraced before them: For We have already sent down clear Signs. And the unbelievers (will suffer) a shameful penalty—

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day when Allah will raise (resurrect) them all up (again) and show them the truth (and record) of their deed (and conduct). Allah has kept an account of it, while they may have forgotten it, and Allah is Witness (Shaheed) to all things

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see that Allah does know (all) that is in the heavens and on earth? There is not a secret talk between three (persons), but He makes the fourth among them (with his knowledge)— Nor between (any) five but He makes the sixth— Nor between fewer nor more but He is with them, wherever they may be: And in the end, He will tell them the truth of their conduct, on the Day Of Judgment. Verily, Allah is All Knowing (Aleem) of all things

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not see those who were advised against secret discussions: Yet (they) go back to that which they were asked not to do, and they hold secret discussions among themselves for injustice and hostility, and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet and salute you, not as Allah salutes you, (but in crooked ways): And they say to themselves: "Why does Allah not punish us for our words?" Enough for them is Hell: In it they burn, and evil is that place to go

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! When you hold secret discussions, do it not for injustice and hostility, and disobedience to the Messenger; But do it for good reasons and self-control; And fear Allah, to Whom you shall be brought back

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Secret discussions are for only (those inspired) by Satan in order that he may cause unhappiness to the believers; But he cannot harm them in the least, except as Allah permits; And on Allah let the believers put their trust

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! When you are told to make room in the gatherings, (spread out and) make room: (Ample) room will Allah provide for you. And when you are told to rise up, then rise up: Allah will raise up, to (suitable) ranks (and levels), those of you who believe and who have been granted (mystic) knowledge. And Allah is Well Acquainted with all you do

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! When you speak with the Messenger in private, spend something in charity before the consultation. That will be best for you, and most helpful towards purity (of conduct). But if you do not find, (the means to spend in charity), then verily, Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is it that you are afraid of spending sums in charity before your private consultation (with the Prophet)? If (that is the case), then, you do not do so, and Allah forgives you, but, establish regular prayer; Practice regular charity; And obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Well-Acquainted (Khabir) with all that you do

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you not turn your attention to those who seek (friendship) of such (people) that have the anger of Allah upon them? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to falsehood knowingly

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has prepared for them a severe Penalty: Evil indeed are their deeds

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They have made their oaths a screen (to hide their misdeeds): Thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah. Therefore they shall have a shameful penalty

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their wealth and their sons will not be of any profit to them, against Allah; They will be companions of the Fire, to live in there (for ever)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day, when Allah will raise all of them up (for Judgment): Then they will swear to Him as they swear to you: And they think that they have something (to stand upon). No indeed! They are liars

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Satan has taken the better of them. So he has made them forget the remembrance of Allah. They are the party of the Satan. Truly, it is the party of the Satan that will perish

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger they will be among those most humiliated

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has affirmed (and decreed): "Verily, it is I and My messengers who must win (prevail):" Verily, Allah is One full of Strength, Almighty (Able to make His Will become reality)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You will not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day, loving those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even though they were their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their kindred (by blood relationship). For such (people who believe) He (Allah) has written Faith in their hearts, and (He has) strengthened them with a spirit from Himself. And He will admit them to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to live in there (for ever). Allah will be well pleased with them, and they (will be well pleased) with Him. They are the party of Allah. Truly, it is the party of Allah who will be successful (and the ultimate happiness)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whatever is in heavens and whatever is on earth, glorifies and Praises Allah: And He is the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz, and) the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He, Who got out the unbelievers among the People of the Book (Scripture) from their homes at the first gathering (of the forces). You did not think that they would get out: And they thought that their fortresses would defend them from Allah! But the (anger of) Allah came to them from sources that they had not expected, and He cast fear into their hearts, so that they demolished their houses by their own hands, and by the hands of the believers. Take warning, then, O you (people) with eyes (to see)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, if Allah had not decided exile (and banishment) for them, He would certainly have punished them in this world: And in the Hereafter they shall have the punishment of the Fire

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger: And if anyone opposes Allah, then surely, Allah is severe in punishment

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whether you (O Muslims!), cut down the tender palm—trees, or you left them standing on the roots, it was the willingness of Allah, and (it was) because He might cover with shame those who exceed their limits

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what (booty) Allah has (taken) from them and granted to His Messenger,— Towards this (cause) you provided neither horses nor camels: But Allah gives power to His messengers over anybody He pleases; Verily, Allah is Able (Khadir) to do all things

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What Allah has granted (as booty) to His Messenger (and taken away) from the people of the townships, —Belongs to Allah, to His Messenger, —And to relatives and the orphans, the needy and the wayfarer; In order that it may not (merely) be circulated between the wealthy among you. So take what the Messenger gives to you, and deny yourselves that which he withholds from you. And fear Allah; For Allah is Strict in punishment

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Some part of the booty is due) to the needy emigrants (those who came from Makkah), those who were expelled from their homes and their property, while seeking Grace from Allah, and (His) Good Pleasure, and helping Allah and His Messenger (the Prophet): Such are indeed the sincere ones:—

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (it is also for) those who before them, had homes (in Medinah) and had adopted faith (in Islam)— Show their affection to those who came to them for refuge, and entertain no desire for things in their hearts, (and had) given to the (refugees), and give them preference over themselves, even though poverty was their (own lot), and those saved from the selfishness of their own souls— Such are they, the ones who are successful

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who came after them say: "Our Lord! Forgive us, and our brethren who came before us into the Faith (of Islam), and leave not in our hearts, hate (or sense of injury) against those who believed. Our Lord! You are indeed Full of Kindness (Ra'uf), Most Merciful (Raheem)."

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have you not seen the hypocrites say to the disbelieving brethren among the People of the Book (Scripture)? "If you are forced out, we will also go out with you, and we will never listen to anyone about your affair; And if you are attacked (in fight) we will help you." But Allah sees that they are indeed liars

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, if they are forced out, never will they go out with them; And if they are attacked (in fight) they will never help them; And if they do help them, they will turn their backs; And they will not be victorious

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Verily), you are stronger in their breasts (and hearts of hypocrites) than Allah (because of victories won by you). That is because they are men without understanding (for the Supreme Power of Allah)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will not fight you (even) together, except in fortified townships, or from behind walls. Their fighting (spirit) is strong among themselves: You would think they are united, but their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people who understand not

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They are like those who recently came before them, they have tasted the evil result of what they did; And (in the Hereafter there is) a painful penalty for them

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Their friends deceive them), like the Satan, when he says to man, "Deny Allah," but when (man) denies Allah, (the Satan secretively) says, "I am free of you, I do fear Allah, the Lord of the Worlds (Rub-ul-'Ala'meen) !"

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So the end of both will be that (both) go into the Fire, to live in there, for ever. Such is the reward for the wrongdoers

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Fear Allah, and let every soul look to what it has put forward for the future. Yes, fear Allah! Verily, Allah knows well (all) that you do

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you do not be like those who forget Allah; And He caused them forget their own souls! Such are those who are rebellious

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The companions of the Fire are not equal to the companions of the Garden; They will achieve the true happiness

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If We sent down this Quran on a mountain, surely, you would have seen it humble itself and split open with the fear of Allah. Such are the examples that We offer men that they may (deeply) think

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah is He, other than Whom there is no other god:— The All Knowing (Aa'lam), of the hidden and open, He, (is) the Most Gracious (Ar-Rahman), the Most Merciful (Ar-Raheem)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah is He, Other than Whom there is no other god:— The Sovereign Ruler (Al-Malik), the Holy One (Al-Qudus), the Source of Perfection (and Peace, As-Salaam), the Guardian of Faith (Al-Mu'min), the Preserver of Safety (Al-Muhaymin), the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz), the Compeller (Al-Jabbar), the Supreme and Majestic (Al-Mutakabbir). Glory to Allah! (High is He) above the partners they give to Him

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He is Allah, the Creator (Al-Khaliq), the Evolver (Al-Bari), the Grantor of Forms (Al-Musawwir) to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names. Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, declares His Praises and Glory, and He is the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Do not take My enemies, and yours, as protecting friends (or protectors by) offering them (your) love, even though they disbelieve the Truth that has come to you: And have (on the contrary) driven the Messenger (the Prophet) and yourselves (from your homes), (simply) because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out to strive in My Way (Cause) and to seek My Good Pleasure, (take them not as protectors); Holding secret conversation of love with them: For I (Allah) completely know what you hide, and all that you reveal. And any of you who does this has strayed from the Straight Way

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Should they gain an upper hand over you, they would treat you as enemies, and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you with evil, and they desire that you should be disbelievers (and reject the Truth)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Neither your relative, nor your children will benefit you on the Day of Judgment; He will judge between you: And Allah is All Seeing (Baseer) of all that you do

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Indeed for you, there is, an excellent example in Ibrahim (Abraham) and those with him, when they said to their people: "Verily, we have rejected you, and whatever you worship besides Allah. We have disbelieved you, and there has arisen, between us and you, a hostility and hatred for ever— Unless you believe in Allah and Him Alone." But (it was) not so when Ibrahim (Abraham) said to his father: "Verily, I will pray for forgiveness for you, though I have no power (to get) anything on your behalf from Allah." (They prayed) "Our Lord! In You do we trust, and to You do we turn in repentance, and to You is (our) final return

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Our Lord! Do not make us a (test and) trial for the unbelievers, but forgive us, our Lord! Verily, You are the Exalted in Might (Al-Aziz), the Wise (Al-Hakeem)."

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Certainly, there is indeed, in them an excellent example for you to follow— (And) for those who await the meeting with Allah and believe in the Last Day. And if any turn away, then truly, Allah is free of all wants, worthy of all Praise

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It may be that Allah will grant love and friendship between you and those whom you (now) hold as enemies, and Allah has the Power (over all things): And Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah does not forbid you to act justly and kindly with those (for friendship) who do not fight with you regarding (your) faith (of Islam), and do not drive you out of your homes. Verily, Allah loves those who practice equity and justice

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah only forbids you, those (for friendship) who fight against you regarding (your) faith (of Islam), and drive you out of your homes, and (those who) support (others) in driving you out, from turning to them (for friendship and protection). It is those who turn towards them (for friendship) that do wrong

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! When believing women come to you as refugees (and emigrants) examine (and verify) them (for their faith): Allah knows best as to their faith: Then if you ascertain that they are believers, then do not send them back to the unbelievers. They are not lawful (wives) for the unbelievers, nor are the (unbelievers) lawful (husbands) for them. But pay the unbelievers what they have spent (on their dowry). And there will be no sin (or blame) on you, if you marry them on payment of their dowry to them. But do not hold the guardianship of unbelieving women: Ask for what you have spent for their dowry, and let the (unbelievers) ask for what they have spent (on their dowers of women who have come to you). Such is the Judgment (the Command) of Allah: He judges (with justice) between you. And Allah is All Knowing (Aleem), All Wise (Hakeem)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if any of your wives have gone (fallen in) to go to the disbelievers, then you succeed over them (by gaining victory over the disbelievers), then pay (from the booty) to those whose wives have gone, the equivalent of what they had spent (on their dowry). And fear Allah, in Whom you believe

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O Prophet! When believing women come to you with an oath of their loyalty to you, (with a promise, pledging), that they will not associate in worship any other thing whatever with Allah, and that they will not steal, and that they will not commit adultery and that they will not kill their children, that they will not utter slander, fabricating falsehood from their hands and feet, and that they will not disobey you in any goodly just matter— Then, you accept their pledge (oath) of loyalty, and pray to Allah for the forgiveness (of their sins): Verily, Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Turn not (for protection) to people on whom is the Anger of Allah. About the Hereafter they are already in pain and suffering, just as the unbelievers are in pain and suffering, about those (buried) in graves

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whatsoever that is in the heaven and on earth, Glory Allah, and He is Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Why do you say that which you do not do

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, it is most unpleasant, in Allah’s sight that you say that which you do not do

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly Allah loves those who fight in His Cause in the battle array (rows), as if they were solid walls

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember), when Musa (Moses) said to his people: "O my people! Why do you hurt and insult me? Certainly, you know that I am a messenger of Allah (sent) to you?" So when they turned away (from the right path), Allah let their heart go wrong. And Allah does not guide those who are rebellious and disobedient

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) when, Isa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), said: "O Children of Israel! I am a messenger of Allah (sent) to you, reaffirming Torah (the Torah, that came) before me, and giving the good news of a Messenger (reference to the Prophet Muhammad) to come after me, whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he (the Prophet)  came to them with clear proofs, they said, "This is clearly magic (aimed at deception)!"

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And who does greater wrong than the one who invents lies against Allah, while he is being invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoers

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their intention is to darken Allah’s Light (by bellowing) with their mouths: But Allah will complete (brightening) His Light. Even though the unbelievers may dislike (it)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has sent His Messenger with Guidance and the Religion of Truth, that he may proclaim it over all religions even though the idolaters may dislike (it)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Shall I guide you to a trade (situation) that will save you from a painful penalty

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That you believe in Allah and His Messenger (the Prophet), and that you strive very hard (to your best) in the Cause of Allah, with your property and your persons: That will be best for you, if you only knew

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (If you do that), He will forgive you (for) your sins, and admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to beautiful palaces in Eden (the Paradise) of eternity: That is indeed the highest Achievement

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And another (favor) which you will love, —Help from Allah and a near (and quick) victory. So give glad tidings (and good news) to the believers

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe!– Be(come) you, the helpers (in the Cause) of Allah: As Isa (Jesus), the son of Maryam (Mary), said to the followers (disciples); "Who will be my helpers to (the work of) Allah?" Said the followers (disciples), "We are Allah’s helpers!" Then a portion of the Children of Israel believed, and a portion disbelieved: So, We gave power to those who believed, against their enemies, and they became the ones who won

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whatever is in the heavens and on earth, glorifies of Allah,—  The Sovereign King (Al-Malik), the Holy and Pristine (Al-Qudus), the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has sent amongst the unlettered ones a messenger from among themselves to rehearse to them His Verses, to purify them, and to instruct them in (Book, Quran) Scripture and Wisdom— Verily, they had been openly in error before

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (He has sent the Prophet to) others among them (the Muslims ready to accept the Faith), who have not already joined them (the Muslims); And He is the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That is the Grace of Allah that He grants on whom He wills; And Allah is the Lord of the highest grace

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The similarity of those who were entrusted and charged with the (obligations of the Judaic Law) Torah, but did not carry it (the trust) out, is (like) that of a donkey which carries voluminous scriptures (without understanding it). Evil is the likeness of people who falsify the Signs of Allah: And Allah guides not the wrongdoers

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "O you (Jewish people) who profess Judaism! If you think that you are friends to Allah, to the exclusion of (other believing) men, then express your desire for death, if you are truthful!"

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they will not express their desire (for death), because of the (deeds) their hands have sent on before them! And Allah knows well the wrongdoers

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Verily, the death from which you run away will really overtake you: Then will you be sent back to the All—Knower (Al-Aalam) of things that are unseen and seen: And He will tell you the things that you did!"

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! When the call is recited for prayer on Friday (the day of assembly), hurry sincerely to the Remembrance of Allah, and leave behind the business (and traffic): That is best for you if you only knew

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then when the (Friday) prayer is finished, then may you may disperse through the land, and seek of the Grace and Bounty of Allah: And celebrate the Praises of Allah much and often (and without restriction): That you may be successful

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they see some bargain or some amusement, they leave to run to it, and leave you standing. Say: "The (blessing) from the Presence of Allah is better than any amusement or bargain! And Allah is the Best to Provide (for all needs) (Khair-ur-Razikheen)."

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah." Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They have made their oaths a way (to hide what they really are and) like this they stop (men) from the Path of Allah: Truly, their deeds are evil

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That is because they had believed, and then they disbelieved; So a seal was set on their hearts; Therefore, they do not understand

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when you look at them, their bodies (that they show) please you; And when they speak, you listen to their words. They are like blocks of wood propped up, (unable to stand by themselves). They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemies, so (keep yourselves) beware of them. May the curse of Allah be on them! How are they deluded (away from the right truth)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when it is said to them, "Come, that the Messenger of Allah may pray for your forgiveness (from Allah) for you," they turn aside their heads, and you could see them turning away their faces in arrogance

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is equal (all the same) for them whether you (O Prophet!) pray for their forgiveness or pray not for their forgiveness; Allah will not forgive them. Truly Allah guides not those who rebel and transgress

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They are the ones who say: "Spend nothing on those who are with Allah’s Messenger, until they may disperse (and quit Medinah)." And to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth; But the hypocrites do not understand

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They say: "If we return to Medinah, surely, the more honorable (element) will expel from there the weaker." But honor belongs to Allah and to His Messenger, and to the believers; But the hypocrites do not know

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Let not your properties nor your children distract you from remembering Allah. If any act like this, the loss is their own

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And spend something (in charity) out of the sustenance that We have bestowed on you, before death should come to any of you and he should say, "My Lord! Why did You not give me relief for a little while? I should then have given (largely) in charity, and I should have been one of those who do good (deeds)."

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Allah grants relief to none when the appointed time (for it) has come; And Allah knows well of (all) that you do

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth, glorifies of Allah: His is the (entire) Dominion, and to Him belongs all the Praise (and thanks) and He is Able (Khadir) to do all things

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He, Who has created you; Some of you are unbelievers, and some of you are believers: And Allah is All Seeing (Baseer) of all that you do

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He has created the heavens and the earth in proper proportions, and has given you shape, and made your shapes beautiful: And to Him is the final return
