4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He knows what is in the heavens and (what is) on earth; And He knows what you hide and what you reveal: And Allah is All Knower (Aleem) of what (secret) lies in the breasts (and hearts of men)

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Has the story not reached you, of the disbelievers before you? And so they tasted the evil result of their conduct; And they had a painful penalty

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That was because messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they said: "Shall (mere) human beings direct us?" So they rejected (the Message) and turned away. But Allah is Free (Ghani) of all Needs, worthy of all Praise (Hameed)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The unbelievers think that they will not be raised up (for Judgment), say: "O Yes! By my Lord, you shall surely be raised up: Then shall you be told (the truth) of all that you did, and that is easy for Allah."

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore, believe in Allah and His Messenger, and in the Light that We have sent down. And Allah is All Aware (Khabir) of all that you do

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when He assembles you (all) for a Day of Assembly— That will be a day of mutual loss and gain (among you), and (for) those who believe in Allah and do righteous deeds— He will remove from them their sorrows, and He will admit them to Gardens beneath rivers flow, to live in there forever: That will be the supreme achievement

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But those who reject Faith and treat Our Signs as lies, they will be companions of the Fire to live in there forever: And evil is that goal

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No type of misfortune can occur, except by the permission of Allah: And if anyone believes in Allah, (Allah) guides his heart (towards right): And Allah is All Knowing (Aleem) of all things

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And obey Allah, and obey His Messenger: But if you turn away, the duty of Our Messenger is only to announce (the Message) clearly and openly

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah! There is no god but He: And in Allah (Alone), therefore, let the believers put their trust

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Truly, among your wives and your children are (some that are) enemies to yourselves: So be aware of them! But if you forgive them and overlook, and cover up (their faults), Surely Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Your wealth and your children may be a trial: But in the Presence of Allah is the Highest Reward

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So fear Allah as much as you can; Listen and obey; And spend in charity for the benefit of your own souls! And those saved from the selfishness for themselves— Then they are the ones who achieve abundance (and wealth)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If you loan to Allah a beautiful loan, He will double it to your (credit), and He will grant you Forgiveness: And Allah is Most ready to appreciate and reward (Shukoor), Most Forbearing (Haleem)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Allah is the) All Knower (Aleem) of what is hidden and of what is open, the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the All Wise (Al-Hakeem)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O Prophet! When you (Muslims) divorce women, divorce them at their prescribed periods, and count their prescribed periods (accurately). (Note: the Prophet himself never divorced any of his wives.) And fear Allah, your Lord: And turn them not out of their houses, nor shall they (themselves) leave except in case they are guilty of some clear and serious (sexual) misconduct. And these are the set-limits by Allah. And whosoever transgresses the set-limits of Allah, does indeed wrong his (own) soul: You do not know if by chance, Allah will bring about some new situation (later on)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When they fulfill their appointed term, either take them back in a good (and honorable) manner or part with them in a good (and honorable) manner. And take for witness two persons from among you, blessed with (a sense of) justice, and establish the evidence (as if you are) before Allah. Such is the guidance given to him who believes in Allah and the Last Day. And for those who fear Allah, He (always) prepares a way out

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He provides for him by (means that) he could never imagine. And if anyone puts his trust in Allah, then (Allah) is sufficient for him. Surely, Allah will accomplish His Purpose. Truly, for all things Allah has appointed proper proportions

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Such of your women who have passed the age of monthly courses, for them the prescribed period, if you have any doubts, (the period) is three months, and for those who have no courses (it is the same). And for those who carry (life within their wombs) their period is until they deliver their burden, and for he who fears Allah, He will make their path easy for him

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That is the Command of Allah, which He has sent down to you: And if anyone fears Allah, He will remove his sorrows from him, and will increase his reward

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Let the women live (during waiting) in the same style as you live, according to your means: Do not annoy them, so as to restrict them. And if they carry (life in their wombs), then spend (your sustenance) on them until they deliver their burden: And if they suckle your (offspring) for you, give them their recompense: And mutually consult together, according to what is just and reasonable. And if you find yourselves in difficulties for one another, let another woman suckle (the child) on the (fathers) behalf

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Let the man of means spend according to his means: And the man whose resources are restricted, let him spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah puts no burden on any person beyond what He has given him. After a difficulty, Allah will soon grant relief

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And how many towns (populations) that proudly opposed the command of their Lord and of His messengers; And have We called (them) to account— To severe account? And We imposed on them a strict punishment

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they tasted the evil result of their conduct, and the end of their action was (their) total loss

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has prepared a severe punishment for them (in the Hereafter). Therefore fear Allah, O men of understanding— Those who have believed! Allah has indeed sent down to you a Reminder (and a Message; The Quran)—

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A Messenger, who rehearses to you the Signs of Allah containing clear explanations, that he (the Prophet) may lead forth those who believe and do righteous deeds from the depths of darkness into light. And whosoever believe in Allah and do righteous good deeds, He (Allah) will admit him to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, to live in there forever; Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent provision

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah is He Who has created seven Orbits (of heavenly planets) and of the earth a similar number. His Command descends between and through them: That you may know that Allah has power over all things, and that Allah comprehends all things in (His) Knowledge

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O Prophet! Why do you forbid what Allah has made lawful to you? You seek to please your wives. And Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has already made possible for you, (O men), to absolve your oaths (in some cases): And Allah is your Protector, and He is All Knowing (Aleem), All Wise (Hakeem)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (remember) when the Prophet told in privacy a matter to one of his wives (Hafsah), and she then says it (to another, ‘Aishah), and Allah made it known to him, he (the Prophet,) informed a part of it and questioned a part. Then when he (the Prophet) told her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "He (Allah, Aleem) told me; (He) Who knows and is Well-Acquainted (Khabir, with all things.)"

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: If you two turn in repentance to Him (Allah), with sincerity in your hearts; But if you support each other against him, truly Allah is his Protector, and Gabriel, and every righteous one among those who believe— And after that the angels —will support him

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It may be, if he (the Prophet) divorced you (all) that Allah will give him in exchange wives better than you— Who submit (their wills), who believe, who are (devoutly) obedient, who turn to Allah in repentance, who sincerely worship (in humility) who travel (for their faith in Islam) and who fast— Previously married or virgins

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Save yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is men and stones, over which are (appointed) angels strong and severe, who do not hesitate (from executing) the commands they receive from Allah, but do (precisely) what they are commanded

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (They will say) "O you unbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! You are only being punished for all that you did!"

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance: In the hope that your Lord will remove from you your sorrows and admit you to Gardens beneath which rivers flow— The Day that Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believe with him, their light will run before them and on their right hands, while they say, "Our Lord! Perfect our light for us, and grant us forgiveness: Verily, You are Able (Khadir) to do all things."

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O Prophet! Strive (work) hard against the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and be firm against them. Their home is Hell— And (it is) an evil refuge (indeed)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Allah has set forth, for an example to the unbelievers, the wife of Nuh (Noah), and the wife of Lut (Lot); They were each under two of Our righteous servants, but they were untrue to their (husbands), and they gained nothing before Allah on their account, but they were told: "You enter the Fire along with (others) who enter!"

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Allah has set forth, as an example to those who believe the wife of Firon (Pharaoh): When she said: "My Lord! Build for me, in nearness to You, a mansion in the Garden, and save me from Firon (Pharaoh) and his (evil) actions, and save me from those who do wrong;"

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Maryam (Mary), the daughter of Imran, she guarded her chastity; And We breathed into (her body) of Our Spirit and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and the Books (of Revelation) and was one of the devout (servants)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Blessed be He in Whose hands is the Dominion; And He is All Powerful (Al-Khad'ir) Able to do all things

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He Who created Death and Life, that He may test which of you is best in deed: And He is the Almighty (Al-Aziz), the Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafoor)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He Who created the seven heavens one above the other: You will see no want of proportion in the Creation of (Allah) Most Gracious (Rahman). So look again, do you see any flaw

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then look again and once again: (And) your vision will come back to you dull and disjointed, in a worn out condition

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed, We have decorated the lowest heaven with lamps, and We have made them (like) missiles to drive away the Satans, and have prepared for them the penalty of the blazing Fire

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord (Ar-Rab'i, and Cherisher) is the Penalty of Hell: And evil is (their) destination

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When they are cast therein, they will hear the (terrible) sighing of its breath even as it blazes forth

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It almost flares up in fury: Every time a group is cast therein, its keepers will ask, "Did no warner come to you?"

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will say: "Yes, indeed a warner did come to us but we rejected him and said (to him), Allah did not send down any (Message): You are making a serious error!"

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will also say: "Had we only listened or used our understanding, we should not (now) be among the companions of the blazing Fire!"

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they will confess their sins: (But forgiveness will be far), so away with the dwellers of the blazing Fire

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, those who fear their Lord Unseen, for them is forgiveness and a great reward

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whether you hide your word in secret or make it known, He is the All Knowing (Al-Aleem), of what is in the breasts (men’s hearts)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Would He not know— He Who has created? And He is the Most Generous (Al-Lateef to His servants and He is) the All Aware (Al-Khabir)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who has made the earth manageable (and amenable) for you, so you may travel through its open lands and enjoy the gifts which He furnishes: And to Him is the Resurrection

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do you feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it rumbles (as if it is an earthquake)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do you feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with gravel and stones) so that you shall know how (terrible) was My warning (to them)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And indeed men before them rejected (My warning): Then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not watch the birds above them, spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most Gracious (Rahman). Truly, it is He who is All Seeing (Baseer) all things

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Who is there besides (Allah) Most Gracious (Rahman) who can help you, (even if it was) an army? But the unbelievers are in nothing but a delusion (and serious mistake)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or who is there who can give you sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? But, they (the unbelievers) knowingly continue in willful disbelief and escape (from the Truth)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Is then (the man) who walks headlong, with his face bitter and marred, better guided— Or the one who walks evenly on the Straight Path

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It is He, Who has created you (and made you grow), and made for you the faculties of hearing, (and) seeing, (feeling with your) heart (and its kindness): Little thanks it is you give."

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It is He, Who has created you on the earth, and to Him shall you be gathered together."

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They ask: "When will this promise be (fulfilled)? If you are telling the truth."

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "As to the knowledge of the time, it is with Allah Alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: At length, when they see it (the time) close at hand, painful will be the faces of the unbelievers, and it will be said (to them): This is (the Promise fulfilled), which you were asking for

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Do you see? If Allah were to destroy me, and those with me, or if He bestows His Mercy on us— Yet who can deliver the unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "He is (Allah), Most Gracious (Rahman): We have believed in Him, and on Him have we put our trust: So, soon will you know which (of us) who is in serious error."

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "Do you see?— That if your streams (in the underground earth), on some morning become lost, then who can supply you with clear-flowing water?"

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nu’n, (the Pen): By the Pen and by the (Record) which (men) write—

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You (O Prophet!) are not, by the grace of your Lord, mad, insane or possessed

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No (in reality), and surely, for you is a reward unfailing

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, you (are placed) on an exalted standard of character

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon will you see, and they will see

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Which of you is affected with madness

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, it is your Lord Who knows best, which (among men) has strayed from His Path: And He Knows (Aalam) best those who receive (true) Guidance

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So listen not to those who deny (the Truth)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their desire is that you should be suffering: So they would be suffering

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do not pay attention to the type of lowly man— Ready with (false) words

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A slanderer, going about with hurtful falsehoods

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (By habit) stopping (all) good, exceeding all bounds (and) deep in sin

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Violent (and cruel) and in addition a shrewd manipulator—

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Because he possesses wealth and numerous sons

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When Our Signs are rehearsed to him, he cries; "Tales of the men of old (ancient peoples),"

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the nose

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits of the (garden) in the morning

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But made no reservation, (by saying: "Insha-Allah", or "If Allah Wills it."

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from your Lord, (which swept away) all around while they were asleep

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark desolate spot (whose fruit had been gathered)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As the morning broke, they called out, one to another—

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Saying: "You go to your garden early in the morning, if you were to gather the fruits."

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And so they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Let not a single needy person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) claim

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But when they saw the (garden) they said: "We have surely lost our way

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Nay! Indeed we are denied (of the fruits of our labor)!"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Said one (person) more just than the rest of them: "Did I not say to you; Why not Glorify [Allah by saying, if Allah so Wills, (or Insha Allah)]?"

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Surely, we have been doing wrong!"

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then they turned, one against another, in blame

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They said: "Woe be unto us! We have indeed exceeded our limits

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: Truly, we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Such is the punishment (in this life); But surely, greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter— If only they knew

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, for the righteous, are the Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Shall We then treat the people of faith like (We treat) the criminals (and the peoples of sin)

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What is the matter with you? How can you judge

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or do you have a Book through which you learn—

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That you shall have, through it whatever you choose

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or have you promises with Us on oath reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that you shall have whatever you shall demand

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You ask of them, which of them will stand guarantee for that

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or have they some (false) ‘partners’ (in godhead referring the Nasrani’s idle notion of trinity)? Then let them produce their ‘partners’, if they are truthful

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day that when the Shin (Allah’s Divine Self) shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to prostrate themselves but they (the hypocrites) shall not be able to do so—

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their eyes will be cast down— Intense shame will cover them: Seeing that they had been summoned before to prostrate themselves (in love and prayer to Allah and His admiration) while they were whole, (human beings in this world and they had refused)

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then leave Me Alone with those who falsify this Message: By degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A (long) time will I give for them: (But) truly Powerful is My plan

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or is it that you do ask them for a reward, so that they are not burdened with a load of debt

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or that the unseen (Ghaib) is in their hands, so that they can write it down

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So wait with patience for the Decision of your Lord, and be not like the companion of the Fish when he cried out (to his Lord) in grief (see 21.87

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Had not the Grace from His Lord reached him, he would indeed, have remained (within the fish and not) cast off on the naked shore, while he was to be blamed

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Thus did his Lord choose him and grant him the company of the righteous

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, the unbelievers would almost deceive with their eyes when they hear the Reminder (the Quran); And they say: "Surely, he is possessed!"

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But it is nothing other than a Message to all creatures (men jinns' and all creations of) the worlds

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Sure Reality! (The Word and Retribution of Allah.

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What is the Sure Reality

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what will make you realize what the Sure Reality is

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Samood (Thamud) and the ‘Ad people (treated) the stunning calamity as false

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But the Samood (Thamud)— They were destroyed by a terrible storm of thunder and lightning

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the ‘Ad— They were destroyed by a furious wind extremely fierce

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Which (wind) He (Allah) made it rage against them for seven nights and eight days continuously so that you could see all the people lying on their faces in its (path), as if they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then do you see any of them left (still) living

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Firon (Pharaoh), and those before him and the cities overthrown, committed the same habitual sin

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (each) disobeyed the messenger of their Lord: So He punished them with a severe penalty

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, when the water (of Nuh's Flood) overflowed beyond its limits, We carried you (mankind) in the floating Ark

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That We might make it a Message for you, that (your) ears (may listen) and retain (its extraordinary lessons) in memor

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when the blast is sounded on the Trumpet once

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the earth and its mountains shall be dislodged from their places and are crushed to powder at one stroke—

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On that Day shall the Event (and Reality) become true

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the sky will be split apart, for that Day will be flimsy and torn apart

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the angels will be on its (the sky) sides, and on that Day eight (angels) will bear the Throne of your Lord above them

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day shall you be brought to Judgment: Not (even) one act of yours that you hide will be hidden

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he who will be given his record in his right hand will say: "Here! Read my record

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Surely, I did really know that my account would (One Day) reach me!"

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, he will be in a life of (ultimate) joy

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In a Garden placed high

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The fruits in bunches there, will be low and near at hand

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The greeting will be:) "You eat and drink, with full satisfaction; Because of the good that you sent before you, in the days that are gone!"

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he who will be given his record in his left hand, will say: "I wish my record was not been given to me

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And that I had never known what my account (contained)

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Would that (death) had made an end of me

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "My wealth has been of no profit to me

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "My power has departed from me!"..

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (The command will be:) "Seize him and bind (shackle) him

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And throw him in the blazing Fire

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Further, make him march in a chain, whose length is seventy cubits (99-128 ft)

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He was one, who would not believe in Allah, the Most Great (Al-Azeem)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And would not encourage the feeding of those in need

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So, no friend does he have here this Day

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Nor does he have any food (here) except the corruption from the washing of wound

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Which none do eat except those who have sinned."

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, I swear by what you se

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what you see not

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That this is truly the word of an honorable Messenger (of Allah, the Prophet Muhammad)

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is not the word of a poet: Little it is you believe

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer (or a fortune teller): Little warning (and advice) it is, that you receive

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And if he (the Messenger) were to invent any saying in Our Name

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We should certainly have seized him by his right hand

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And then We certainly would have cut off the artery of his hear

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our Anger)

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But truly this is a Reminder (the Quran) for those who fear Allah

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We certainly, know that there are among you those who reject (it)

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But truly, it (the Reminder, this Quran) is a cause of sorrow for the unbelievers

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And verily, it (the Quran) is the Truth of total certainty

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So glorify the Name of your Lord the Most Great (Rab-ul-Azeem)

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A questioner asked about the penalty to befall (yet to happen)—

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Upon the unbelievers— There is none that can avert (the penalty)—

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (A penalty) from Allah, Lord of the Ways of Ascent

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The angels and the Spirit [Ruh, Gabriel] rise up to Him in a Day whose measure is fifty thousand years

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore you stay patient— With a good Patience (of beautiful contentment)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But We see it (quite) near

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day that the sky will be like molten brass

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains will be like wool

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And no friend will ask about a friend

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Though they will be put in sight of each other— The sinners (only) wish will be that he could save himself from the penalty of that Day by (even offering) his children

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: His wife and his brother

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And his relatives who sheltered him

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And all, all that is on earth— So that it could save him—

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means! Verily, it would be the Fire of Hell

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Tearing out (his existence) right out of his skull

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Inviting (all) those who turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the right)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use for Allah)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, man was created very impatient—

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Anxious and angry when evil touches him

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And miserly when good reaches him—

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Not so (are) those devoted to prayer—

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who remain steadfast to their prayer

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those in whose wealth, is a recognized right (of Allah)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For the (needy) who ask and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking)

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who hold to the Truth of the Day of Judgment

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who fear the displeasure of their Lord—

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, their Lord’s displeasure is the opposite of peace and serenity:—

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who guard their chastity (and sexuality)

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except from their wives and the (captive) whom their right hand possess— For (them), they are not to be blameworthy

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But those who go beyond this are transgressors—

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who respect their trusts and covenants

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who stand firm in their testimonies

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And those who safeguard (the sacredness) of their worship—

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Such will be the honored ones in the Gardens (of Joy)

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, what is the matter with the unbelievers that they rush madly before you—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: From the right and from the left in crowds

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does every man from them wish to enter the Paradise (and the Garden of Joy)

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Definitely no! Verily, We have created them out of the (base matter) they know

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But now, I swear by the Lord of (every point in) the Easts' and the Wests' that We can certainly—

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Substitute them by others better (men) than them; And We are not to be defeated (in Our Plan)

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, leave them to sink in idle talk and play about— Until they encounter that Day of theirs that they have been promised

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when they will come out of from their graves in sudden haste as if they were rushing to a goal-post (fixed for them)—

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With their eyes lowered in sadness— Fear and shame covering them (all over)! That is the Day that they were promised

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people (with the command, saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful penalty."

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my people! Verily, I am an open warner to you

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "That you should worship Allah, fear Him and obey me

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "So He will forgive you your sins and give you relief for a fixed (and written) time: Verily, when the time is finished by Allah it cannot be put forward (changed or altered): If you only knew:"

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He said: "O my Lord! Verily, I have called to my people night and day

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "But my calling them only increases (their) flight (from the right)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And verily, every time I have called to them, that You may forgive them, they have (only) pushed their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their clothes, grown firmer (against faith), and given themselves up to false pride

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Then verily, I have called them loudly

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Then verily, I have spoken to them in public and secretly in private

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Saying to them, ‘Ask forgiveness from your Lord; Verily, He is Often Forgiving (Ghafa'r)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘He will send rain to you in plenty

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘Give you increase in wealth and children; And grant to you gardens and grant to you rivers (of flowing water)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘What is the matter with you, that you do not place your hope for kindness and long-suffering in Allah—

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘Seeing that it is He Who has created you in many different stages

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘Do you not see how Allah has created the seven heavens, one above another

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And made the moon a light in the middle, and made the sun as a (glorious) lamp

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And Allah has produced you from the earth, growing (you gradually)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And in the end, He will return you into the (earth) and raise you up (again at the Resurrection)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And Allah has made the earth for you as a carpet (a wide expanse, spread out)

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘That you may go about in there on broad and spacious roads?’ "

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! They have disobeyed me, and they follow one whose wealth and children give them no increase but only loss

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And they have planned a huge (and evil) plot

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And they have said (to each other); ‘do not give up your gods: And do not give up Wadd, nor Suwa, neither Yaguth, nor Ya’uq, nor Nasr’—" (These are the false gods of the people of Nuh

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And indeed, they have already misled many; And (Allah,) You grant no increase to the wrongdoers but in wandering (aimlessly in their goal)."

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Because of their sins they were drowned (in the Flood), and they were made to enter the Fire (of punishment) and they found— Other than Allah, none to help them

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And Nuh (Noah) said: "My Lord! Do not leave of the unbelievers, (even) a single one on earth

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "For, if You do leave (any of) them, they will only mislead Your servants and they will breed only the wicked ungrateful ones

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "My Lord! Forgive me, and my parents, and all who enter my house in Faith, and (all) believing men and believing women. And to the wrongdoers, You grant them no increase except in their loss!"

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It has been revealed to me that an assembly of jinns' listened (to the Quran). They said, ‘Verily, we have really heard a Wonderful Recitation (this Quran)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘It gives guidance to the Right (Path,) and we have believed in it (what is read, i.e., the Quran): We shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And unequaled is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: “ ‘And that the foolish ones among us, who used to say terrible and worst lies against Allah

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: “ ‘And verily, we do think that no man or spirit (among jinns') should say anything that is untrue against Allah

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: “ ‘(It is) true, there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons (other personifications) among the jinns', but they (only) increased them in their mistakes

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And they (used to) think as you thought, that Allah would not raise up anyone (to Judgment)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And we have wanted to reach the (secrets of) heavens; But we found it filled with strong (and unfailing) guards and flaming fires (and shooting stars)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And verily, we used indeed, to sit there in (the hidden) places, to listen in but anyone who listens now will find a flaming fire (and shooting stars) watching him in hiding (to drive him away)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And we do not understand whether suffering is intended for those on earth, or whether their Lord intends to guide them to the right conduct

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘There are some among us who are righteous, and some (that are) the opposite:— We are assemblies (of jinns') having different ways

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘But we think that we cannot resist Allah all through the earth, nor can we resist Him by flight

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And indeed for us, since we have listened to the Guidance, (from the Quran), we have believed therein: And anyone who believes in his Lord (he or she) has no fear, neither of a decrease in reward for the good deeds, nor an increase in punishment for the sins

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And among us are some who submit their wills (to Allah as Muslims), and some who wander away from justice. Now those who submit their wills (as Muslims)— They have sought the right Path

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: " ‘And those who wander away (from the right Path)— They  (are only fuel for fire of Hell ’ "&mdash

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And Allah’s Message is): "If they (the pagan) had (only) believed in Allah and walked on the (right) Path, we should certainly have granted (in kindness) to them (the) bountiful rain

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "That We might try them by that (means), and if anyone turns away from remembering his Lord, he will cause (for himself) to undergo a severe penalty

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And the places of worship are for Allah (Alone): So do not pray to anyone along with Allah

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And when the one devoted (the Prophet) to Allah stands forward to pray to Him, they (the jinns') just make around him a dense crowd as if sticking to one over the other (to listen)."

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "I do no more than call upon my Lord, and I do not join any (false gods) with Him."

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm, nor to bring you to right conduct."

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "No one can save me from Allah's punishment, (if I were to disobey Him) nor should I find protection except in Him

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His Messages; For whoever that disobeyed Allah and His Messenger— Then verily, for him (the one who disobeys) is Hell:—  He shall live in there forever."

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: At length, when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised— Then will they know who is the one weakest as (their) helper and least important in point of numbers

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Say: "I do not know whether the (punishment) which you are promised is near or whether my Lord will appoint for it a long time (later)

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "He (Allah, Alone) is All Knowledgeable of the Unseen, (Aalam-ul-Ghaib), nor does He make anyone familiar with His unseen mysteries—

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Except a messenger whom He has chosen, and then He makes a band of watchers (angels) march before him and behind him

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "That he (the messenger) may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord. And He surrounds (all with mysteries) that are with them, and takes account of every single thing."

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you (Prophet! Clothed and) folded up in garments

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Stand up (in prayer) by night, except a little (less)—

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Half of it (the night), or less than that by a little

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or a little more; And recite the Quran in slow, stately (and) rhythmic tones

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, soon We shall send down upon you a weighty message

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, the rising by night is most powerful for governing (the soul) and most suitable for (understanding) the Word (of Prayer and Praise

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, for you by the day, there is long (and hard) work with ordinary duties

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And keep remembering the Name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him entirely

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (He is) Lord of the east and the west: There is no god but He: Therefore take Him to be the disposer (Wakil) of (your) affairs

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And have patience with what they say, and leave them with noble (dignity)

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And leave Me Alone to deal with those in possession of the good things of life, who (still) reject the Truth; And (patiently) give them respite for a little while

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With Us are shackles (to bind them), and a Fire (to burn them)

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a food that chokes, and a penalty that is painful

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day when the earth and the mountains will be in violent bang and the mountains will be like a heap of sand poured out and flowing down

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We have sent to you (O men!) a Messenger, (the Prophet) to be a witness about yourselves, like We had sent a messenger (Musa) to Firon (Pharaoh)

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But Firon (Pharaoh) did not obey the messenger; So We seized him with a stiff punishment

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then how shall you, if you deny (Allah) save yourselves against the punishment of Allah on a Day that will change children into gray-headed (old men)—

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the sky will be torn apart— His Promise certainly will come true

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, this is a (stern) warning and a guidance! Therefore, whoever wishes, let him take a (straight) Path to his Lord

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, (O Prophet), your Lord knows that you stand up (to prayer) a little less than two-thirds of the night, or half the night, or a third of the night, and so do some of those with you. And Allah measures the night and day in proper parts. He knows that you are not able to keep praying the whole night. So He has turned to you (in His Mercy), therefore you read the Quran as much as it may be easy for you. He knows that there may be (some) among you that are sick; Others traveling through the land, seeking of Allah’s Bounty; Yet others fighting in Allah’s Cause. You recite, therefore, as much of the Quran as may be easy (for you); And establish regular prayer and give regular charity; And loan to Allah a beautiful loan. And whatever good you send forward for your souls, you shall find it in Allah’s Presence: Yes, better and greater, in reward. And you seek the Forgiveness of Allah: Verily, Allah is Often Forgiving (Ghafoor), Most Merciful (Raheem)

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you (Prophet) wrapped up (in garments, blanket)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Get up and announce your warning

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And you praise your Lord

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And keep your clothes cleansed

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And stay away from all pollution

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And do not expect, in giving (the warning), any gain (for yourself)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for (the duties) to your Lord be patient and unchanging

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when the trumpet is sounded

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, that will be — That Day, — A Day of suffering—

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Far from being easy for the disbelievers

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Leave Me Alone, to deal with the (creature) whom I created (bare and) alone

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And then to whom I (reference to Allah, have) granted resources in plenty

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And children to be by his side! —

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made (life) smooth and comfortable for him

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yet is he greedy that I should add (more and more), —

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nay! Truly, he has been opposing Our Signs

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon will I visit him with a mountain of miseries

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, he thought and he plotted—

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, let him be the cursed (one)! How he plotted

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And again let him be the cursed (one)! How he plotted

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he thought (a little)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he and frowned (in anger) and glowered (with rage)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he turned back and was haughty

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he said: "This is nothing but magic taken from the old

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "This is nothing but the word of a (mere) human being!"

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon will I throw him into the Fire of Hell

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what will explain to you what is the Fire of Hell

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Neither will it permit to tolerate, nor does it leave alone

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Darkening and changing (and burning away) the color of man

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Over it are nineteen (angels as the keepers)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We have set none but angels as guardians of the Fire: And We have fixed their number (at 19 and it is so written in other Books) confirming it only as a trial for unbelievers— So that the People of the Book (Scripture) may become certain, and the believers may become convinced of their Faith— And that no doubts may be left for the People(s) of the Book (Scripture), and the believers; And that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the unbelievers may say, "What does Allah mean by this (symbol of 19 angels)?" Thus does Allah leave to wander those whom He pleases, and guide those whom He pleases. And none can know the forces of your Lord, except He. And this is no other than a warning to mankind

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No, surely, by the moon

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the night, as it leaves

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by the morning, as it shines forward—

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, this is but one of the mighty (events unfortunate to the disbelievers)

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A warning to mankind—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To any one of you who chooses to move forward, or to those that fall behind—

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Every soul will be (held) to account for its deeds

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except the companions of the right hand

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (They will be) in Gardens (of happiness): They will question each other

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (ask) of the sinners

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "What led you into the Fire of Hell?"

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will say: "We were not from those who prayed

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Nor were we from those who fed the poor

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And we used to speak idle-talk with those who spoke against Truth

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And we used to reject the Day of Judgment

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Until there came upon us (the Hour) that is certain."

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There will be no pleading or intercession from (any) pleaders (to) profit them

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from plain warning—

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As if they were frightened wild donkeys

51.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Running away from a lion

52.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No doubt, each one of them wants to be given scrolls (of Revelation from Allah) spread out

53.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means! But they fear not the Hereafter

54.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nay! Verily, this surely is a (stern) warning

55.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Let any who will keep it (the warning) in memory

56.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will not keep it in memory (mind) except as Allah wills: He is the One Who deserving the righteousness (with prayer and supplication to Him) and He is the One Who grants forgiveness (of the sins)

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: I swear by the day of Resurrection (when the dead shall be awakened)

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And I swear by the spirit that blames itself

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does man think that We cannot assemble his bones together

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yes! We are able to put together the very tips of his fingers perfectly

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But man wishes to do wrong (even) in the time (now) for the time that is to come

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He asks: "When is the Day (of Resurrection)on which the dead shall be awakened?"

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Say:) "Soon, when the sight is bewildered

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And the moon is buried in darkness

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And the sun and moon are joined together,"&mdash

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On that Day man will say: "Where is the place to flee?"

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means! (There will be) no place of safety

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Before your Lord, that Day will be the place of rest

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On the Day will man be told (all) that he put in front of him and all that he put behind

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! Man will be (a true) evidence against himself

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Even though he may give his excuses

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Move not your tongue (O Prophet!) about the (Quran) to hurry on with it (in its reading)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is for Us to put it together and to make it known and be recited

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when We have it (known to you), then you follow its recitation (and form)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, it is for Us to explain it (and to make it clear)

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But no, (you men!) you love the present life of this world

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And neglect (and put aside) the Hereafter

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Some faces that Day, will glow (in brightness and beauty):—

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Looking towards their Lord

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And some faces that Day, will be sad and sorry

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In the fear that some back-breaking unhappy action was about to be started upon them

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Yes, when (the soul) reaches the collar-bone (as it leaves the body

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when there will be a cry (saying:), "Who is a magician (to put him together)?"

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he will conclude that it was (the time) of leaving (this world)

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And one leg will be joined with another leg

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (All) the drive (movement) on that Day will be to your Lord

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But he disregarded (the truth), and he did not pray

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And even more, he lied (against the truth) and turned away

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he went back to his family with false pride

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Suffering and sorrow to you (woe unto you, O man!), and a great suffering to you

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Again, suffering and sorrow to you (woe unto you, O man!), and a great suffering to you

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does man think that he will be neglected (and left alone), (without purpose for which he was created)

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Was he not a drop of  sperm emitted (without any form)

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then did he become a leech-like clot; Then (Allah) made and gave (him) the right size and shape

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He made two sexes, male and female of him

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Does He not have, the Power to give life to the dead

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Has there not been a long period of time, when man was nothing— (Not even) mentioned

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely We have created man from a drop of mixed sperm and ovary fluids, in order to try him, so, We gave him (the gifts) of hearing and of sight

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We showed him the Way: Whether he be thankful or not (rests upon his own will)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers:  Chains, shackles, and a blazing Fire

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As to the righteous: They shall drink of a cup blended with Kafur—

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A fountain where the devoted servants of Allah drink, making it flow in plenty

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They make (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose sorrow spreads far and wide

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they feed for the love of Allah the needy, the orphan, and the captive and the needy,—

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Saying), "We feed you for the sake of Allah Alone, no reward do we want from you, nor thanks

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, We only fear a Day of painful suffering (that may arrive) from the side of our Lord."

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, Allah will save them from the sorrow of that Day, and will spread over them a Light of beauty and a (cheerful) joy

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And because they were patient and steady, He will reward them with a Garden and (clothes of) silk

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Reclining in the (Garden) on raised couches (thrones), they will see there neither the sun’s (extreme heat) nor the moon’s (extreme cold)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the shades of the (Garden) will come low over them, and the bunches (of fruit), there will hang low in (their) easy reach

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And among them will be passed round containers of silver and glasses of crystal—

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Crystal-clear, made of silver: They will determine the amount in there (according to their wishes)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will be given to drink from a Cup (of drink) mixed with Zanjabil (ginger)—

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A fountain there called Salsabil

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If you were to see them you would think them as pearls scattered about

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when you look, it is there that you will see a joy and a magnificent kingdom (an immense constellation of beauty)

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Upon them will be green garments of fine silk and heavy ornaments and they will be decorated with bracelets of silver; And their Lord will give to them to drink a cleansing drink, pure and holy

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to them:) "Surely, this is a reward for you, and your struggle (in life) is accepted and recognized."

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, it is We Who have sent down the Quran to you by stages

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore be patient with uniformity to the Command of your Lord, and do not listen to the sinner or the thankless among them

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And praise (with joy) the Name of your Lord every morning (Faj’r) and afternoon (Zuh’r and ‘Asr)

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And part of the night prostrate yourself to Him (Maghrib and Isha prayers) and glorify Him (in predawn prayer) the long night through

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, as to these (thankless), they love the present life of this world, and put away behind them a heavy Day (that will be) hard

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is We Who created them, and We have made their joints strong; And when We (so) wish, We can replace them bringing others like them in their place

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, this (Verse of the Quran) is a warning: So whoever wishes, let him take a (straight) Path to his Lord

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But you will not except as Allah wishes; Verily, Allah is Ever All Knowing (Aleem), All Wise (Hakeem)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He will admit to His Mercy whomever He wishes; But the wrongdoers— For them, He has prepared a painful penalty

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the (winds) sent one after another

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Which then blow very hard in violent storms

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And drive (things and the clouds) far and wide

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then separate them, one from another

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then spread a Message

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Whether of justification or of warnin

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, what has been promised to you (shall) really happen

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then when the stars lose their light (and glow)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the heaven is torn apart

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the mountains are blown (to the winds) as dust

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when (all) the messengers are appointed a time (to gather)—

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For what Day are these Signs (of Allah) deferred

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For the Day of Sorting out (those destined to paradise from those destined to Hell)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what will explain to you what is the Day of Sorting out

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Did We not destroy the people before (for their evil ways)

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So shall We make later generations to follow them

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: We deal with men of sin in this way

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have We not created you from a fluid (held) in low esteem

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then We placed in a place of rest (the womb), securely placed

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For a period (of growth) depending (upon the need of the infant)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (And) We decide (the need); For We are the Best to decide (things)

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have We not made the earth (as a place) to bring togethe

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For the living and the dead

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made mountains in there standing firm, high (in stature) and provided for you water that is sweet (to drink)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to the disbelievers:) "You go to that which you used to reject (the Fire) as false

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You go away to a shadow (of smoke climbing) in three columns

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "(Which gives) no shade with coolness, and is of no use against the fierce Fire

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "Verily, it (Hell) throws sparks (of fire huge) as Forts

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "As if there were (a string of) yellow camels (marching swiftly)."

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That will be a Day when they shall not be able to speak (for parts of the Day)

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will not be allowed to bring out any excuse (begging for mercy)

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That will be a Day of Judgment! We shall gather you and those before you together

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Now, if you have a trick (or plot), use it against Me

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, as to the righteous (people) they shall be in (cool) shades and springs (of water)

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (they shall have) the fruits— All that they wish

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be said to the righteous:) "Eat you and drink you to your hearts content: Because you (have) worked (towards righteousness)

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Verily, We certainly reward the doers of good deeds (Mushinun), in this way

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (O you rejecters of the Truth,) you eat and enjoy yourselves (but) a little while, verily, you are the criminals (Mujrimun, and sinners)

47.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people) who reject the Truth

48.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when it is said to them, "Bow yourselves (in Islam)!" They do not do so

49.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, woe (sorrow and suffering), that Day for those (people who reject the Truth

50.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, in what Message, after that (warning) will they believe

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Concerning what are they asking

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Concerning the great news

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: About which they cannot agree

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, they shall soon know

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, (but) surely, they shall soon know

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Have We not made the earth as a wide expanse (as a bed)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains as pegs

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (have We not) created you in pairs

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made your sleep for rest

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made the night as an umbrella of peace

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And made the day for finding livelihoo

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (have We not) built over you the seven strong arches of the heavens

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And placed (in there) a Light of brilliance

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And do We not send down from the clouds water, in plenty

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That We may produce with it, corn and vegetables

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And gardens of rich growth

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, the Day of Judgment is an event appointed—

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day that the Trumpet shall be sounded and you shall come forward in crowds

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the heavens shall be opened as if there were doors

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains shall vanish, as if they were a mirage

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, Hell is like a place of ambush—

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For those who fought (against Faith); (Their) place of eternal stay

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will live in there for ages

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Nothing cool shall they taste there, nor any drink

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Save a boiling fluid and a fluid, dark, grim, bitterly cold—

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A fitting return (for their actions and for them)

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Because, they did not fear any accounting (of their deeds)

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they (grimly) treated Our Signs as false

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And all things, We have preserved on record

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So taste you (the reward), because We shall not grant you any increase except in (your) punishment

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, For the righteous there will be a fulfillment of (their hearts) desires

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Gardens enclosed, and grapevines

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Companions of equal age

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And a Cup full (to the very top)

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In there, they shall not hear useless talk, vanity (and they shall not hear) anything false—

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Reward from your Lord a gift, (large and) sufficient

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (From) the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all between— (Allah) Most Gracious (Rahman): None shall have power to argue with Him

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day that the Spirit (Gabriel) and the angels will stand forth in ranks, none shall speak, except anyone who is permitted by (Allah): Most Gracious (Rahman), and he (the speaker) will say (only) what is correct

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, that Day will be the Reality: Therefore, let anyone who wishes, let him take a (straight) path returning to his Lord

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, We have warned you of a penalty near— The Day when man will see (the very acts) which his hands have sent forward, and the unbelievers will say, "Misery upon me! I may as well be (mere) dust!"

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the (angels) who tear out (the soul of the wicked, from its depths) with great force

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By those who gently draw out (the soul of the blessed)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And by those who move along (the path of mercy)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then move swiftly as if they were in a race

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then arrange (themselves) to complete (the Commands of Allah)—

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: One Day, when everything that can be improper will be in violent shock

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Followed by often repeated (shocks)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day, hearts will be trembling with fear

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The eyes (of men) will be looking down

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Now) they say: "What! Shall we really be returned to (our) former state

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "What! When we shall have become rotten bones

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They say: "In that case, it will be a return with loss!"

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But surely, there will be a single (far reaching) cry

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And then watch! They will be (completely) awake (to receive Judgment)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Has the story of Musa (Moses) reached you

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Listen, your Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:—

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "You go to Firon (Pharaoh), because he has indeed exceeded all limits

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "And say to him: ‘Would you (wish) that you should be purified (from sin)

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: "‘And that I guide you to your Lord, so you should fear Him?’&rdquo

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then (Musa, Moses) showed him the great Sign

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But (Firon) rejected it and disobeyed (the guidance)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Also, he turned his back, working hard (against Allah)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he collected (his men) and made a (false) claim

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Saying, "I am your lord, most high,"

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But Allah punished him, (and made) him an example— In the Hereafter, and in this life

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, in this (instance) is a warning with guidance for those who fear (Allah)

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What! Are you (men) more difficult to make than the heaven (that Allah) has created

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: High above has He raised its cover, and He has given it order and perfection

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: At night He grants its darkness and its brightness He brings out (with light)

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And more, He has extended the earth (far and wide also in the shape of an egg)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He draws out its moisture from there and its grazing lands

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the mountains He has firmly fixed—

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For use and benefit to you and your cattle

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore, when the great and fearful (event) comes

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when man shall remember all what he struggled for

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the Fire of Hell shall be placed in full sight for (everyone) to see—

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then for those that had exceeded all limits

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (those who) had liked the life of this world

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The home will be the Fire of Hell

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And for those who had felt the fear of standing before their (Almighty) Lord and had restrained (their) souls from lowly desires

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their home will be the Garden

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They will ask you (O Prophet) about the Hour— "When will be its appointed time?"

43.Syed Vickar Ahamed: How are you (even included) in the announcement of its time

44.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Your Lord (Alone) knows the limit fixed for it

45.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You are only a warner for those who fear it

46.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Day when they see it, (it will be) as if they had waited for it a single evening, or the following morning

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He frowned and turned away

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Because there came to him (the Prophet), the blind man (breaking into the discussion)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But what could tell you (O Prophet) but that he (the blind man) might by chance grow (in his understanding)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Or that he may receive guidance and the teachings that might profit him

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: About the one who considers himself independent

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You attend to him

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Even though there is no blame on you if he did not grow (in understanding)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But to him (the blind man) who came to you with effort and sincerity

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And with fear (in his heart)

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Were you (O Prophet!) unmindful in shifting your attention to another

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means (should it be so), because it is indeed a Message of Instruction

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Therefore let anyone who makes up the mind, remember (and accept) it

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It is) in Books held in (great) honor

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Supreme (in dignity) kept pure and holy

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Written) by the hands of holy scribes (writers) —

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Blessed and just

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Warning to man! What has made him reject Allah

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: From what stuff has He (Allah) created him

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: From a sperm-drop has He (Allah) created him, and then (He) makes him in proper size and shape

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then He (Allah) makes the path smooth for him

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then He (Allah) causes him to die and puts him in his grave

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then, when it is His (Allah’s) Will, He will raise him up (again)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means has he (man) fulfilled what Allah has commanded him to do

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then let man look at his food, (how We provide it)

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For that We pour forth water in plenty

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And We split the earth into pieces

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And produce from there corn

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And grapes and plants to eat

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And olives and dates

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And enclosed gardens thick with tall trees

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And fruits and herbage (and the grasses)—

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For you to use and (for your) help and for your cattle

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: At last! When there comes the deafening noise—

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: That Day man will run away from his own brother

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And from his mother and his father

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And from his wife and his children

37.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On that Day each of the men, will have enough worry (of his own) to make him not mindful of the others

38.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Some faces that Day will be shining

39.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Laughing, being happy

40.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And other faces that Day will be soiled with dust

41.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Blackness will cover them

42.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Such will be the rejecters of Allah, the unrighteous

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the stars fall, losing their glitter

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the mountains vanish (like a dream)

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the she camels, ten months with young are left untended

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the wild beasts are herded together (in human habitations)

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the oceans boil over with a swell

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the souls are sorted out, (Put together, righteous with righteous and unrighteous with unrighteous

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the female (infant) buried alive, is questione

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For what crime she was killed

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the books of deeds are laid open

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the world on High (heavens) is made visible

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the fire of Hell is set to a fierce burn

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the Garden (of the heavens) is brought near

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Then) shall each soul know what it has brought (forward for this Day)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So truly I call to witness the receding stars that hide awa

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Go straight, or hide

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the night as it comes to an end

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the (glorious) morning as it moves away the darkness

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely this is the Word of a most honorable Messenger, [The Angel, Gabriel]

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Given the power with rank before the Lord of the Throne

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With authority there, (and) faithful to his trust

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And (O people!), your companion (the Prophet) is not one who is possessed

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And without doubt he (the Prophet) saw him (the messenger from Allah) in the clear horizon

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he does not withhold purposely any knowledge of the unseen

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And it is not the word of an evil spirit that is outcast

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Where, then are you going

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, this is the Message to (all jinns and men, all the) creations of the worlds

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (With guidance) to each one among you who is willing to walk straight

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But you shall not make up your mind except as Allah the Lord of the worlds (Rab-Al-'Ala'meen), wishes

82.SurahEnglishNames: The Cleaving, The Cleaving Asunder, Bursting Apart

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the sky is split apart

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the stars fall thrown around

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the oceans are made to burst apart; (into one big ocean covering the earth

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the graves are turned upside down

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (Then) each soul shall know what it has sent forward and (what it has) kept back

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O man! What has misled you (away) from your Lord, Most Generous (Rab-ul-Kareem)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: He, Who created you, given you the proper size and shape, and gave you a just basis (for thinking)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: In whatever form He wishes, He puts you together

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: No! But you (men) reject the (Final) Judgment

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But surely, over you (are angels) to protect you

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Kind and honorable writing down (your deeds and works)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: They know (and understand) all that you do

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: As for the righteous, they will be in Joy

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the wicked, they will be in Fire

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Which they will enter on the Day of Judgment

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they will not be able to keep away from there

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what will explain to you what the Day of Judgment is

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Again, what will explain to you what the Day of Judgment is

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It will be) the Day when no soul shall have power (to do) anything for another: Because on that Day, the Command will be wholly with Allah

83.SurahEnglishNames: Defrauding, The Defrauders, The Cheats, Cheating

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Misery to those who deal in fraud, (woe be unto those who cheat)—

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who demand full measure, when they have to receive by measure from men

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But when they have to give by measure or weight to men give less than due

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Do they not think that they will be called to account

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On a Mighty Day

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A day when (all) mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds (Rab-ul-'Ala'meen)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But! Surely the record of the wicked is (saved) in prison register (Sijjin)

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And what will explain to you what the prison register (Sijjin) is

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (There is) a register (fully) written

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Misery, on that Day, to those who deny—

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who do not accept the Day of Judgment

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And none can deny it except the transgressor beyond limits, the sinner

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When Our Signs are read (and repeated) to him, he says, "Tales of old!"

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By no means! But on their hearts is the stain of (the evil,) whatever they do

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Surely, from the Light (of) their Lord, on that Day will they be blocked

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Further, they will enter the Fire of Hell

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Further, it will be said to them: This is the (reality), which you rejected as false

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But no! Surely the record of the righteous is (saved) in register (‘Illiyyun) of the Supreme

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And What will explain to you what the register (‘Illiyyun) of the Supreme is

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: There is a register (fully) written

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: To which bear witness those nearest (to Allah)

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly the righteous will be in happiness

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On Thrones (of dignity) they will be able to see a view (of all things)

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You will recognize in their faces the beaming brightness of joy

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Their thirst will be quenched with pure wine sealed

26.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The seal will be musk: And for this let them desire, those who have true desires

27.Syed Vickar Ahamed: With it will be (given) a mixture of drink from the Paradise (Tasnim, the nectar from the pure heavenly fountain

28.Syed Vickar Ahamed: A spring, from (which) drink those nearest to Allah

29.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those in sin used to laugh at those who believed

30.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whenever they passed by them, used to wink at each other (in mockery)

31.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when they returned to their own people, they would return mocking

32.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And whenever they saw them (those who believed), they would say, "Look! These are the people truly astray!"

33.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But they (the unbelievers) had not been sent as keepers over them (those who believed)

34.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But on this Day the believers will laugh at the unbelievers

35.Syed Vickar Ahamed: On Thrones (of dignity) they will be able to see a view (of all things)

36.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Will not the unbelievers have been paid back for what they did

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: When the sky is split apar

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And obeys the command of its Lord, and it must do so

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the earth is flattened out

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And spills over what is within it and becomes empty

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And obeys the command of its Lord, and it must do so

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: O you man! You are surely always moving towards your Lord painfully moving but you shall meet Him

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Then he who is given his record (of deeds) in his right hand

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon his account will be taken by an easy settlemen

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And he will be together with his people, happy

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But he who is given his record behind his back

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Soon will he cry for his lost soul

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And, he will enter a blazing Fire

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, (on this earth) did he go about among his people, happy

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Truly, did he think that he would not have to return (to Us)

15.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But, for sure! His Lord was (always) watchful of him

16.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So, I swear by the deep (red) glow of sunset

17.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The night and its gathering (of nightly creatures)

18.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And the moon in her fullness

19.Syed Vickar Ahamed: You shall surely travel from one stage to the next (life to Hereafter)

20.Syed Vickar Ahamed: What then, is the matter with them that they do not believe

21.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And when the Quran is read to them, they do not fall prostrate

22.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But being the opposite the unbelievers reject (Islam and the Message)

23.Syed Vickar Ahamed: But Allah has full knowledge of what they do and think

24.Syed Vickar Ahamed: So announce to them a painful penalty

25.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Except to those who believe and work righteous good deeds: For them is a reward that will never be the end

85.SurahEnglishNames: The Mansions of the Stars, The Constellations

1.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the sky, (displaying) the Zodiacal Signs

2.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the promised Day (of Judgment)

3.Syed Vickar Ahamed: By the one who sees and that which is seen—

4.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Accursed are (unbelievers, who become) the makers of the pit (of Fire

5.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Fire, (amply) supplied with fuel

6.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Look! They sat by the (fire)

7.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they saw (all) that they were doing against the believers

8.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And they ill-treated them (the believers) for no reason other than that they believed in Allah, exalted in Power (Aziz), Worthy of all Praise (Hameed)

9.Syed Vickar Ahamed: (It is) to Him that belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth! And Allah is the One to Witness (Shaheed) all things

10.Syed Vickar Ahamed: Those who are cruel or unkind to (or draw into evil) the believing men and women, and do not turn in repentance, will have the penalty of Hell: They will have the penalty of the burning Fire

11.Syed Vickar Ahamed: For those who believe and do righteous deeds, will be Gardens, beneath which rivers flow; That is the great success, (the fulfillment of all desires)

12.Syed Vickar Ahamed: The Grip (and Power) of your Lord is truly Strong

13.Syed Vickar Ahamed: It is He Who creates from the very beginning, and He can restore (life)

14.Syed Vickar Ahamed: And He is the Often Forgiving (Al-Ghafoor) and full of loving Kindness (Al-Wadood)
